text:
Chicken Ole
Dice 4 cooked chicken breasts and mix with 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 can green chili salsa sauce, 1 can green chilies, 1 cup milk, 1 grated onion, and pieces of corn tortillas. Let stand overnight, then bake at 375°F for 1 1/2 hours.
json: {"title": "Chicken Ole", "ingredients": ["4 chicken breasts, cooked", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 can cream of mushroom soup", "1 can green chili salsa sauce", "1 can green chilies", "1 c. milk", "1 grated onion", "1 pkg. corn tortilla in pieces"], "directions": ["Dice chicken.", "Mix all ingredients together.", "Let sit overnight.", "Bake 1 1/2 hours at 375°."]}

text:
Creamy Coleslaw
In a large bowl combine 4 cups shredded cabbage, 1/2 cup shredded carrots, 1/4 cup chopped green pepper, and 2 tablespoons chopped onion. Mix separately 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon vinegar, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1 teaspoon celery seed, and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then toss with vegetables.
json: {"title": "Creamy Coleslaw(Better Homes And Gardens)", "ingredients": ["4 c. shredded cabbage", "1/2 c. shredded carrots", "1/4 c. finely chopped green pepper", "2 Tbsp. finely chopped onion", "1/2 c. mayonnaise", "1 Tbsp. vinegar", "2 tsp. sugar", "1 tsp. celery seed", "1/4 tsp. salt"], "directions": ["In a large bowl, combine cabbage, carrot, green pepper and onion or can use package of slaw mix purchased from store."]}

text:
Creole Flounder
Arrange 2 lb flounder fillets in a baking dish. Mix together chopped tomatoes, green pepper, lemon juice, salad oil, salt, onion, basil, black pepper, and red pepper sauce. Spoon mixture over fish and bake at 500°F for 5 to 8 minutes, until fish flakes easily.
json: {"title": "Creole Flounder", "ingredients": ["2 lb. flounder or pollack fillets", "1 1/2 c. chopped tomatoes", "1/2 c. chopped green pepper", "1/3 c. lemon juice", "1 Tbsp. salad oil", "2 tsp. salt", "2 tsp. minced onion", "1 tsp. basil leaves", "1/4 tsp. coarsely ground black pepper", "4 drops red pepper sauce", "green pepper rings"], "directions": ["Heat oven to 500°.", "Place fillets in single layer in baking dish, 13 1/2 x 9 x 2-inch.", "Stir together remaining ingredients except pepper rings. Spoon over fillets.", "Bake 5 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.", "Remove fillets to warm platter. Garnish with green pepper rings. Makes 4 to 6 servings."]}

text:
Three Bean Salad
Combine 1 can green beans, 1 can yellow beans, and 1 can kidney beans, all drained. Mix together 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup salad oil, 2/3 cup vinegar, and 1/3 cup water until sugar dissolves, then pour over beans and let stand overnight.
json: {"title": "Three Bean Salad", "ingredients": ["1 can green beans, wash and drain", "1 can yellow beans, wash and drain", "1 can kidney beans, wash and drain", "1 c. sugar", "1/2 c. salad oil", "2/3 c. vinegar", "1/3 c. water"], "directions": ["Mix together all of sugar, salad oil, vinegar and water until sugar is dissolved.", "Pour over beans and let stand overnight."]}

text:
Dave’s Corn Casserole
Mix 1 can whole kernel corn, 1 can cream-style corn, 1 cup sour cream, 1 package corn bread mix, and 1 stick melted margarine. Pour into greased pan and bake at 350°F for 50 minutes.
json: {"title": "Dave'S Corn Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 (16 1/2 oz.) can whole kernel corn, drained", "1 (16 1/2 oz.) can cream-style corn", "1 (8 oz.) sour cream", "1 (8 1/2 oz.) pkg. Jiffy corn bread mix", "1 stick margarine"], "directions": ["In a bowl, mix corns, sour cream, corn bread mix and melted margarine.", "Pour into a greased 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan.", "Bake at 350° for 50 minutes."]}

text:
Casserole Italiano
Brown 1 lb ground beef with 1/3 cup chopped onion. Add 1 can tomato soup, 1/3 cup water, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir in 2 cups cooked noodles, place in casserole, top with 1 cup cheese, and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Casserole Italiano", "ingredients": ["1 lb. ground beef", "1/3 c. chopped onion", "1 can tomato soup", "2 c. cooked wide noodles", "1/2 tsp. oregano", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/3 c. water", "1 c. cheese"], "directions": ["Brown beef with onion and seasonings and combine in a 1 1/2-quart casserole with soup, water and noodles.", "Place cheese around edges.", "Bake at 350° for 30 minutes."]}

text:
Corned Beef and Cabbage Casserole
Combine 1 shredded cabbage, 1 teaspoon dry mustard, 1 can flaked corned beef, 1 can cream of celery soup, and 1 chopped onion. Cook uncovered over low heat until cabbage is tender, about 20 minutes.
json: {"title": "Corned Beef And Cabbage Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 small cabbage, shredded", "1 tsp. dry mustard", "1 can corned beef, flaked", "1 can cream of celery soup", "1 medium chopped onion"], "directions": ["Combine all ingredients and cook uncovered over low heat until cabbage is crisp-tender, about 20 minutes."]}

text:
Crab Cakes
Mix together 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon dry mustard, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1 egg, and Old Bay seasoning to taste. Gently fold in 1 lb lump crab meat and refrigerate before cooking.
json: {"title": "Crab Cakes", "ingredients": ["1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce", "2 or 3 shakes Old Bay", "1 tsp. dry mustard", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 egg"], "directions": ["Mix together and carefully add 1 pound lump crab meat.", "Mix ahead of time and refrigerate so they will hold together better."]}

text:
Taco Dip
Mix 2 packages softened cream cheese with 1/2 cup mayonnaise. Spread on a platter and chill briefly. Spread 8 oz taco sauce over top, then layer green onions, green pepper, tomato, Mozzarella cheese, Cheddar cheese, and optional olives. Serve with tortilla chips.
json: {"title": "Taco Dip", "ingredients": ["2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened", "1/2 c. mayonnaise or salad dressing", "8 oz. mild taco sauce", "2 to 4 thinly sliced green onions", "1/2 green pepper, chopped", "1 tomato, chopped", "1 c. Mozzarella cheese", "1 c. Cheddar cheese", "1/2 c. black olives (optional)", "tortilla chips"], "directions": ["Mix together cream cheese and mayonnaise.", "Spread on to a large platter or two dinner plates.", "Freeze for 15 minutes. Spread taco sauce evenly on top.", "Layer remaining ingredients in the written order.", "Serve with tortilla chips."]}

text:
Bonbon Cookies
Cream together 1/2 lb soft butter and 1/2 cup peanut butter. Add 1/2 lb graham cracker crumbs, 2 cups coconut, 1/2 cup nut meats, and a dash of vanilla. Mix well, form into balls, and chill several hours.
json: {"title": "Bonbon Cookies", "ingredients": ["1/2 lb. soft butter", "1/2 c. peanut butter", "1/2 lb. graham cracker crumbs", "2 c. coconut", "1/2 c. nut meats (optional)", "dash of vanilla"], "directions": ["Cream together the butter and peanut butter.", "Add the remaining ingredients.", "Mix and form into balls (best to mix with your hands) and chill several hours, even a day."]}

text:
Forever Amber
Mix together 1 lb chopped orange slice candy, 2 cans Angel Flake coconut, 2 cups chopped pecans, 2 cans condensed milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and 1 teaspoon orange flavoring. Spread in buttered pan and bake at 275°F for 30 minutes. While hot, sift powdered sugar over top and drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper to dry.
json: {"title": "Forever Amber", "ingredients": ["1 lb. orange sliced candy, chopped", "2 cans Angel Flake coconut", "2 c. chopped pecans", "2 cans condensed milk", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 tsp. orange flavoring"], "directions": ["Mix together.", "Spread in a buttered pan.", "Bake for 30 minutes at 275°.", "While still hot, sift 1 box of powdered sugar into it. Drop by teaspoons on waxed paper.", "Let dry.", "If it seems set on bottom, turn over and let it continue to dry."]}

text:
Gooey Coffee Cake
Mix 1 yellow cake mix with 2 eggs and 1 stick melted oleo. Spread into greased 9 x 13-inch pan and sprinkle with 1 cup chopped nuts. Mix 2 eggs with 8 oz cream cheese and 1 lb powdered sugar and spread on top. Bake 15 minutes at 325°F, then 20 minutes at 350°F.
json: {"title": "Gooey Coffee Cake", "ingredients": ["1 yellow cake mix", "2 eggs", "1 stick oleo, melted", "1 c. chopped nuts", "2 eggs", "8 oz. softened cream cheese", "1 lb. powdered sugar"], "directions": ["Mix together cake mix, 2 eggs and melted oleo.", "Put in greased 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Put chopped nuts on top of mixture.", "Mix together 2 eggs, cream cheese and powdered sugar.", "Add on top of first mixture.", "Bake 15 minutes at 325°, then bake 20 minutes at 350°."]}

text:
Phylis’ Pineapple-Banana Salad
Drain 1 large can chunk pineapple and reserve juice. Cut 4 to 5 bananas into chunks similar in size to pineapple. Combine gently and chill.
json: {"title": "Phylis' Pineapple-Banana Salad", "ingredients": ["1 large can chunk pineapple", "4 to 5 bananas"], "directions": ["Drain pineapple and reserve juice.", "Cut bananas in chunks like pineapple."]}

text:
Chicken Casserole
Mix together 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 can cream of celery soup, 1 cut-up chicken, 1/2 cup melted butter, and 1 1/2 cups uncooked rice. Cover and bake at 350°F for 2 1/2 hours, uncovering for the last 45 minutes.
json: {"title": "Chicken Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 can cream of mushroom soup", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 can cream of celery soup", "1 cut up chicken", "1/2 c. melted butter or margarine", "1 1/2 c. uncooked rice"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients together in baking dish.", "Cover and bake at 350° for 2 1/2 hours.", "Bake the last 45 minutes, uncovered, to brown top of chicken."]}

text:
Pineapple Nut Pie
Cream 1 package cream cheese until smooth, beat in 1 can sweetened condensed milk, then add 1/2 cup crushed pineapple, 1/3 cup chopped nuts, and 1/3 cup lemon juice. Pour into graham cracker crust and chill.
json: {"title": "Pineapple Nut Pie", "ingredients": ["1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 can sweetened condensed milk", "1/2 c. crushed pineapple", "1/3 c. chopped nuts", "1/3 c. lemon juice"], "directions": ["Cream the cream cheese; add the milk and beat smooth.", "Add lemon juice, pineapple and nuts.", "Beat well.", "Pour into graham cracker crust and chill.", "Slice in small servings (very rich) and top with dollop of Cool Whip."]}

text:
Annie’s Diabetic Candy
Mix together 1 package sugar-free vanilla pudding mix, 8 oz light cream cheese, 2 tablespoons butter, and 2 tablespoons peanut butter. Form into small balls, roll in chopped peanuts, and refrigerate.
json: {"title": "Annie'S Diabetic Candy", "ingredients": ["1 (8 oz.) Jell-O sugar-free vanilla or French vanilla pudding (put in dry)", "1 (8 oz.) Philadelphia light cream cheese", "2 Tbsp. butter", "2 Tbsp. peanut butter or more if you would like"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients, form in small balls and roll in chopped peanuts.", "Keep refrigerated."]}

text:
Frozen Peach Mousse
Puree 4 peeled chopped peaches. Blend in 1 to 1 1/4 cups sugar, 1 1/4 cups sour cream, 1/4 cup lemon juice, and 3/4 to 1 teaspoon vanilla. Pour into container and freeze.
json: {"title": "Frozen Peach Mousse", "ingredients": ["4 medium peaches, peeled and chopped", "1 to 1 1/4 c. sugar", "1 1/4 c. sour cream (use light)", "1/4 c. lemon juice", "3/4 to 1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Puree peaches in a blender.", "Add remaining ingredients.", "Blend and pour in container and freeze."]}

text:
Strawberry Pie
Mix together 16 oz Cool Whip, 2 packages frozen strawberries, 1 3/4 cups sugar, and 12 oz cream cheese. Spoon into deep pie crusts and chill before serving.
json: {"title": "Strawberry Pie", "ingredients": ["16 oz. Cool Whip", "2 pkg. frozen strawberries *", "2 (9-inch) deep pan pie crusts", "1 3/4 c. sugar", "12 oz. cream cheese"], "directions": ["*Can also use blueberries or cherries."]}

text:
Blueberry Surprise
Mix 1 stick melted margarine with 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs and 1/4 cup sugar. Press two-thirds of mixture into bottom of baking dish.
json: {"title": "Blueberry Surprise", "ingredients": ["1 stick margarine", "1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs", "1/4 c. granulated sugar"], "directions": ["Mix ingredients and press 2/3 mixture in bottom of square baking dish.", "(A bowl that has the same diameter top and bottom may be used, 1 1/2 to 2-quart size.)"]}

text:
Moist Devil’s Food Cake
Sift together 2 cups flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cream 1/2 cup shortening with 1 1/2 cups sugar. Add 2 egg yolks, then stir in cocoa mixture made with cocoa, water, and vanilla. Alternate flour mixture with 1 cup milk, fold in beaten egg whites, and bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Moist Devil'S Food Cake", "ingredients": ["2 c. sifted flour", "1 1/2 tsp. baking soda", "1/4 tsp. salt", "1/2 c. shortening", "1 1/2 c. sugar", "2 eggs, separated", "1/2 c. cocoa", "water", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 c. milk"], "directions": ["Sift together the flour, soda and salt; set aside.", "Combine shortening and sugar in a bowl.", "Beat until creamy.", "Add egg yolks; beat well.", "Combine cocoa, water and vanilla to make 1 cup; mix well.", "Add to batter.", "Add flour mixture alternately with milk.", "Beat well after each addition; set aside.", "Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form when beater is lifted.", "Fold into batter. Bake in two 9-inch greased cake pans at 375° for 30 minutes."]}

text:
Dot’s Civil War Cake
Cook together 3 chopped apples, 2 cups raisins, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons shortening, and 2 cups water. Boil 5 minutes and cool. Stir in 3 cups flour, 2 teaspoons soda, spices, and nuts. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Dot'S Civil War Cake", "ingredients": ["3 medium apples, chopped", "2 c. raisins", "1 c. brown sugar", "1 c. granulated sugar", "2 Tbsp. shortening", "2 c. cold water", "3 c. flour", "2 tsp. soda", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 tsp. nutmeg", "1 tsp. cloves", "1 tsp. salt", "1 c. nuts"], "directions": ["Combine and cook first 6 ingredients.", "Bring to boil and boil 5 minutes; cool.", "Add sifted, dry ingredients to apple mixture. Stir and blend only.", "Add nuts.", "Pour into greased and floured tube pan.", "Bake 1 hour at 350°.", "Serves 16."]}

text:
Potato Casserole
Mix 6 cups diced potatoes with 1/2 cup chopped onion, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 cup sour cream, and 1 cup Cheddar cheese. Transfer to casserole dish, top with crushed cornflakes mixed with melted butter, and bake at 350°F for 50 minutes.
json: {"title": "Potato Casserole", "ingredients": ["6 c. diced potatoes", "1/2 c. chopped onion", "3/4 c. melted butter", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 (8 oz.) sour cream", "1 c. grated Cheddar cheese", "2 c. crushed cornflakes"], "directions": ["Peel and dice potatoes; place in bowl of cold, salted water. Drain potatoes and dry on paper towels.", "Mix 1/2 cup butter, onions, soup, sour cream and cheese; stir well.", "Add potatoes to mixture and pour into a 2 1/2-quart casserole dish.", "Crush cornflakes, mix with remaining butter.", "Sprinkle cornflakes and butter on top of potato mixture.", "Bake at 350° for 50 minutes."]}

text:
Dream Pie
Mix vanilla wafer crumbs with butter until combined. Press into pie dish and chill.
json: {"title": "Dream Pie", "ingredients": ["vanilla wafers", "butter"], "directions": ["Mix vanilla wafer crumbs with butter."]}

text:
Divinity Fudge
Boil together 2 2/3 cups sugar, 2/3 cup white corn syrup, and 2/3 cup water until it forms a hard ball in cold water. Pour slowly over stiffly beaten 2 egg whites, beating constantly. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1 cup chopped nuts, then drop onto wax paper.
json: {"title": "Divinity Fudge", "ingredients": ["2 2/3 c. sugar", "2/3 c. white corn syrup (Karo)", "2/3 c. cold water", "2 egg whites", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 c. chopped nuts"], "directions": ["Stir well together the sugar, syrup and water.", "Allow to boil without stirring until it forms a hard ball in cold water.", "Pour this over stiffly beaten egg whites, beating constantly.", "Cool; add vanilla and nuts.", "Beat until cool and thick enough to set. Pour into a buttered platter or drop by teaspoons on waxed paper."]}

text:
Apple Crisp
Spread apples in baking dish. Mix 1/2 cup sugar with cinnamon and sprinkle over apples. Combine remaining sugar, flour, salt, cornflake crumbs, and oleo, then spread on top.
json: {"title": "Apple Crisp", "ingredients": ["apples", "1/2 c. sugar", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1/4 c. sugar", "1 c. flour", "dash of salt", "1/2 c. corn flake crumbs", "1 stick oleo"], "directions": ["Mix 1/2 cup of sugar and cinnamon.", "Spread on apples.", "Mix 1/4 cup sugar, flour, salt, cornflake crumbs and oleo.", "Spread mixture on apples."]}

text:
Sausage Balls
Mix 2 cups Bisquick with 1 lb sausage and 8 oz grated Cheddar cheese. Roll into balls and bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
json: {"title": "Sausage Balls", "ingredients": ["2 c. Bisquick", "1 lb. sausage", "8 oz. pkg. Cheddar cheese, grated"], "directions": ["Mix sausage and cheese together.", "Add Bisquick and mix thoroughly.", "Roll into medium size balls.", "Bake at 350° for 15 minutes or until golden brown."]}

text:
Consomme Chicken
Mix cream of chicken soup and consomme with water to make 4 cups liquid. Add chicken parts, season with salt and pepper, and bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Consomme Chicken", "ingredients": ["chicken parts", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 can consomme", "2 c. rice", "salt to taste", "pepper to taste"], "directions": ["Add enough liquid to chicken soup and consomme to make 4 cups of water.", "Season with salt and pepper.", "Cook at 350° for 1 hour."]}

text:
Spanish Hamburgers
Brown celery, onions, and 1 lb ground beef in butter. Add vinegar, lemon juice, brown sugar, mustard, salt, pepper, catsup, and water. Simmer 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Spanish Hamburgers", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. celery", "2 chopped onions", "2 Tbsp. butter", "1 lb. ground beef", "2 Tbsp. vinegar", "2 Tbsp. lemon juice", "2 Tbsp. brown sugar", "1 1/2 Tbsp. mustard", "1 tsp. salt", "1 1/2 tsp. pepper", "1 c. catsup", "1 c. water"], "directions": ["Brown celery, onions and ground beef in butter.", "Add vinegar, lemon juice, brown sugar, mustard, salt, pepper catsup and water. Simmer for 30 minutes."]}

text:
Egg Drop Soup
Stir chicken broth into cornstarch in saucepan and cook until slightly thickened. Slowly pour in beaten egg, stirring gently once. Remove from heat and garnish with sliced green onion.
json: {"title": "Egg Drop Soup", "ingredients": ["2 (13 3/4 oz.) cans chicken broth", "1 Tbsp. cornstarch", "1 well beaten egg", "2 Tbsp. sliced (1/4-inch) green onion"], "directions": ["In saucepan slowly stir the chicken broth into cornstarch. Cook, stirring constantly, until slightly thickened.", "Slowly pour in the well beaten egg; stir once gently.", "Remove from heat. Garnish with sliced green onion.", "Makes 4 servings."]}

text:
Mulled Cider
Simmer 1/2 gallon apple juice with allspice, whole cloves, cinnamon stick, and 1 cup brown sugar. Strain into mugs and finish with a dash of nutmeg.
json: {"title": "Mulled Cider", "ingredients": ["1/2 gal. apple juice", "1 tsp. allspice", "1 tsp. whole cloves", "1 cinnamon stick", "1 c. brown sugar"], "directions": ["Simmer all of the ingredients.", "Strain into warmed mugs and top", "with", "a", "dash of nutmeg.", "This recipe can be doubled many times, according to the number of guests present."]}

text:
Sesame Ginger Chicken
Mix together 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, 2 teaspoons grated ginger, 2 tablespoons honey, and 2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce. Flatten 4 skinned chicken breast halves to 1/4-inch thickness. Grill the chicken, basting frequently with the sauce, cooking about 4 minutes per side. Garnish with thin green onion strips before serving.
json: {"title": "Sesame Ginger Chicken", "ingredients": ["1 Tbsp. sesame seed, toasted", "2 tsp. grated ginger", "2 Tbsp. honey", "2 Tbsp. reduced-sodium soy sauce", "4 (4 oz.) skinned chicken breast halves", "vegetable cooking spray", "thin green onion strips"], "directions": ["Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl, stir well and set aside.", "Place chicken between 2 sheets of waxed paper or heavy duty plastic wrap, and flatten to 1/4-inch thickness, using meat mallet or rolling pin.", "Coat grill rack with cooking spray; place on grill over coals.", "Place chicken on rack and cook 4 minutes on each side, basting frequently with soy sauce mixture.", "Transfer chicken to a serving platter and garnish with green onion, if desired.", "Yields 4 servings, about 200 calories."]}

text:
Egg Casserole
Sauté 1 chopped Vidalia onion, 16 oz sliced mushrooms, chopped green peppers, and 1 clove garlic in olive oil. In a separate pan combine buttered bread pieces, 6 eggs, and milk to desired consistency. Layer vegetables and egg mixture in a baking dish, refrigerate overnight, add cheese if desired, and bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Egg Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 Vidalia onion, chopped", "1 (16 oz.) pkg. fresh mushrooms", "2 green peppers", "1 clove garlic", "olive oil", "6 pieces bread (buttered with either butter or margarine)", "6 eggs", "milk (as much as you would like; to fluff eggs)"], "directions": ["Saute together first 5\tingredients.", "In a separate 9 x 12-inch pan, mix bread, eggs", "and", "milk.", "Put", "pieces of bread into", "pan; add your", "vegetables,", "then", "your", "eggs.", "Place\tin refrigerator overnight (at least 8 hours).\tAdd Cheddar cheese before cooking.", "Bake at 350° for 1 hour."]}

text:
Cranberry-Apple-Orange Salad
Grind 2 cups raw cranberries, 1 peeled apple, and 1 peeled orange in a food processor. Mix with 1 cup sugar and set aside. Prepare orange gelatin using slightly less water. Chill until thickened, then fold in fruit mixture and optional nuts. Chill until set.
json: {"title": "Cranberry-Apple-Orange Salad", "ingredients": ["1 (12 oz.) bag raw cranberries (2 c.)", "1 c. sugar", "1 medium apple, peeled, cored and cut into wedges", "1 orange, peeled, seeded and broken in wedges", "1 (3 oz.) pkg. orange gelatin", "1/2 c. nuts (optional)"], "directions": ["In food processor or blender, grind cranberries, apple and orange.", "Mix with sugar and set aside.", "Prepare gelatin according to package directions, using 1/4 cup less of cold water.", "Chill until it begins to thicken.", "Add cranberry mixture and nuts.", "Mix well.", "Pour into a mold, if desired, or leave in a bowl and stir before serving.", "Chill until set.", "Can even be made a day ahead. Keeps well in refrigerator for a few days."]}

text:
Brown Rice
Place 1 cup raw rice, 1 can beef consommé, 1 can French onion soup, 1 can mushrooms, and 1/2 stick margarine in a covered baking dish. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Brown Rice", "ingredients": ["1 c. raw rice", "1 can beef consomme", "1 can French onion soup", "1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms", "1/2 stick margarine, cut up"], "directions": ["Put in a covered 1 1/2-quart dish.", "Bake 1 hour at 350°."]}

text:
Cranberry Salad
Blend softened cream cheese with margarine and sugar. Stir in whole berry cranberry sauce, drained crushed pineapple, and chopped walnuts. Whip cream and fold into mixture. Freeze in mold for several hours before serving.
json: {"title": "Cranberry Salad", "ingredients": ["2 (3 oz.) pkg. softened cream cheese", "2 Tbsp. margarine", "2 Tbsp. sugar", "1 (16 oz.) can whole berry cranberry sauce", "3/4 c. crushed pineapple, drained", "1/2 c. chopped walnuts", "1 c. whipping cream"], "directions": ["Mix cream cheese, margarine and sugar.", "Add fruit and walnuts. Whip cream and fold into fruit and cream cheese mixture.", "Pour into round mold.", "Freeze 6 hours.", "Remove from mold shortly before serving.", "Makes 12 servings."]}

text:
Cheese Dip
Dice Italian tomatoes and green chili peppers. Combine with Velveeta cheese, minced onion, garlic, and salt in a double boiler. Heat for 30 minutes until smooth and serve hot with corn chips.
json: {"title": "Cheese Dip", "ingredients": ["2 lb. Velveeta cheese", "1 (15 oz.) can Italian tomatoes", "2 small cans green chili peppers", "1/2 medium onion, minced", "3 cloves garlic", "1/2 tsp. salt"], "directions": ["Dice tomatoes and peppers.", "Combine all ingredients in top of double boiler for 30 minutes.", "Serve hot over corn chips."]}

text:
Funnel Cake
Sift together flour, salt, soda, sugar, and baking powder. Mix egg and milk and combine with dry ingredients to form smooth batter. Pour batter through funnel into hot oil and fry until golden. Drain and dust with powdered sugar.
json: {"title": "Funnel Cake", "ingredients": ["1 1/3 c. flour", "1 1/4 tsp. salt", "1/2 tsp. soda", "2 Tbsp. sugar", "3/4 Tbsp. baking powder", "1 egg, beaten", "2/3 c. milk (more if batter is too thick)", "oil (for frying)", "powdered sugar"], "directions": ["Sift first 5 ingredients together in a bowl.", "Mix egg and milk together; add to dry ingredients.", "Beat until smooth.", "Hold finger over bottom of a funnel; pour in some batter.", "Remove finger to let batter drop.", "Drop batter in a spiral motion into pan filled with 1 inch of hot oil (375°).", "Fry until golden brown, turning once.", "Remove from pan; drain on a paper towel.", "Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve hot."]}

text:
Fast Real Good Fudge
Mix confectioners sugar, cocoa, and chopped nuts in a bowl. Melt margarine and Velveeta together, add vanilla, then pour over sugar mixture. Stir quickly, spread in buttered pan, cool, and cut into squares.
json: {"title": "Fast Real Good Fudge", "ingredients": ["4 lb. confectioners sugar", "1 c. cocoa", "1 c. chopped nuts", "1 lb. margarine (not whipped)", "1 lb. Velveeta", "1 Tbsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["In large bowl, put confectioners sugar, cocoa and chopped nuts.", "In saucepan, put margarine and Velveeta.", "Melt and add vanilla.", "Pour hot mixture over sugar mixture.", "Mix quickly and pour into buttered cookie sheet.", "Cool and cut into squares."]}

text:
Squash Casserole
Cook squash, onions, and carrots until tender, then mash. Melt butter and stir in stuffing mix. Combine squash with sour cream and soup. Layer squash and stuffing in baking dish and bake at 350°F for 35 minutes.
json: {"title": "Squash Casserole", "ingredients": ["3 lb. squash", "3 onions", "1 pt. sour cream", "3 carrots, grated", "2 cans chicken or mushroom soup", "1 pkg. Pepperidge Farm stuffing mix", "1 stick butter", "salt and pepper to taste"], "directions": ["Cook squash, onions and carrots until tender.", "Mash.", "Melt butter in pan; stir in stuffing until all is coated.", "Drain all water from squash.", "Stir in sour cream and soup.", "Place in a greased baking dish a layer of squash and a layer of stuffing. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes."]}

text:
Cheese Ball
Blend cream cheese with shredded Cheddar. Add chopped pimento, green pepper, onion, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, and salt. Mix well, shape into ball, and coat with chopped nuts.
json: {"title": "Cheese Ball", "ingredients": ["2 pkg. cream cheese", "2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese (8 oz.)", "1 Tbsp. chopped pimento", "1 Tbsp. chopped green pepper", "1 Tbsp. chopped onion", "1 tsp. lemon juice", "2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce", "dash of Tabasco sauce", "dash of salt"], "directions": ["Combine softened cream and Cheddar cheeses.", "Add chopped up items.", "Mix and add liquids last.", "Mix well.", "Roll into ball and cover with chopped nuts."]}

text:
Apricot Salad
Dissolve apricot gelatin in boiling water and sugar. Blend in cream cheese. Add crushed pineapple and apricot baby food. Chill until beginning to set, then fold in whipped evaporated milk. Chill fully before serving.
json: {"title": "*Apricot Salad", "ingredients": ["1 large pkg. apricot jello (6 oz.)", "2/3 c. sugar", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "2 jars Junior baby food apricots", "1 (No. 2) can crushed pineapple (20 oz.)", "1 tall can evaporated milk, chilled and whipped", "2/3 c. water"], "directions": ["Dissolve jello in boiling water; add sugar.", "Blend in the cream cheese with a fork.", "Add can of crushed pineapple and apricot baby food.", "Refrigerate.", "Chill can of milk.", "When jello starts to set, take milk out of the refrigerator and beat until stiff.", "Fold partially set jello into cream.", "Chopped nuts can be used for garnish.", "This is a large salad; could fill a 2-quart mold or 2 (1-quart) molds.", "Serves about 12."]}

text:
Pound Cake
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add eggs, margarine, Crisco, milk, and flavoring. Beat until smooth. Pour into greased tube pan and bake at 325°F for 1 hour and 20 minutes.
json: {"title": "Pound Cake", "ingredients": ["3 c. plain flour (cake flour may be substituted for plain flour)", "3 c. sugar", "1/2 tsp. baking powder", "3 dashes of salt", "5 eggs", "2 sticks margarine", "1/2 c. butter flavor Crisco", "1 c. sweet milk", "1 to 2 Tbsp. flavoring (lemon, vanilla or almond or a combination of the 3)"], "directions": ["Have all ingredients at room temperature. Hand stir all dry ingredients together. Add eggs and stir. Add butter and Crisco and stir. Add milk and stir. Put batter in", "mixer and beat at high speed until well blended. Add 1 to 2 teaspoons of your favorite flavoring and mix well. Pour batter into greased and floured tube pan. Place in cold oven. Bake at 325° for 1 hour and 20 to 30 minutes."]}

text:
Monkey Bread
Break frozen bread into balls and place in greased pan. Melt butter with brown sugar, pudding mix, milk, and cinnamon. Pour mixture over dough, allow to rise several hours, then bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Monkey Bread", "ingredients": ["2 loaves frozen bread, softened", "1/2 c. margarine", "1 c. brown sugar", "1 large box vanilla pudding (not instant)", "2 Tbsp. milk", "cinnamon to taste"], "directions": ["Use greased 9 x 13-inch pan or Bundt pan.", "Melt butter; add brown sugar, pudding, milk and cinnamon.", "Break up 1 loaf into round balls; place in pan.", "Pour mixture over and break second loaf over this.", "Rise 2 1/2 to 3 hours.", "Bake 30 minutes at 350°; turn out immediately to cool."]}

text:
Chicken Roll-Ups
Unroll crescent dough. Fill each piece with cooked diced chicken and grated cheese. Roll tightly and place in baking dish. Mix cream of chicken soup with milk and pour over rolls. Bake until golden.
json: {"title": "Chicken Roll-Ups", "ingredients": ["1 (8 oz.) can crescent rolls", "1 1/2 c. grated medium or sharp cheese", "1 hen, cooked and diced", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 1/2 c. milk"], "directions": ["Unroll crescent rolls; add cooked chicken and grated cheese. Wrap roll over chicken and cheese; pinch sides together."]}

text:
Beef and Spanish Rice Casserole
Layer canned Spanish rice, corned beef, diced onion, and Cheddar cheese in greased casserole. Bake at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes.

text:
Baked Beans
Cook onions and bell pepper in oil until soft. Add ground beef and brown. Mix with pork and beans, catsup, brown sugar, salt, and pepper. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes or cook in slow cooker.
json: {"title": "Baked Beans", "ingredients": ["3 (1 lb.) cans pork and beans", "1/2 c. bell pepper, chopped", "1/2 c. onions, chopped", "3/4 c. catsup", "1/3 c. brown sugar, packed hard", "1 tsp. salt", "1/3 tsp. black pepper", "1 lb. ground beef", "1 Tbsp. oil"], "directions": ["Cook onions and bell pepper in oil until onions are transparent.", "Add beef and cook until brown.", "Mix all ingredients together.", "Bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes, or after mixing together, pour in crock-pot and cook 6 to 10 hours on low."]}

text:
Sweet-and-Sour Chicken
Sauté onion in shortening. Add carrots, water, and bouillon cubes and simmer. Mix brown sugar, cornstarch, ginger, catsup, vinegar, and soy sauce, then add to pot. Stir until thickened, add chicken, peppers, and pineapple, and heat through.

Serves 6 people."]}

text:
Ambrosia
Combine diced oranges, coconut, pecans, cherries, sugar, and orange juice. Chill overnight before serving.

text:
Crazy Peanut Butter Cookies
Mix together peanut butter, sugar, and egg. Roll into balls, flatten with fork, and bake until set.

text:
Brickle Bars
Mix cake mix, egg, and margarine and press into pan. Combine condensed milk, egg, pecans, and brickle bits and pour over base. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes and cool before cutting.

text:
Pancakes
Mix flour, soda, salt, and sugar. Add egg, melted margarine, and buttermilk. Stir until smooth. Cook on greased griddle until bubbles form, flip, and cook until golden.

Stir by hand until well blended.", "Pour onto non-stick pan or griddle with a little oil added.", "Cook until bubbly and turn over."]}

text:
Rustic Garlic Chicken
Season 4 chicken thighs with 1 teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon black pepper, and 1 teaspoon paprika. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet and brown the chicken on both sides. Add 5 crushed garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute. Pour in 1 cup chicken broth, cover, and simmer for 35 minutes until tender.

text:
Simple Lemon Pasta
Boil 250 g spaghetti in salted water. In a pan heat 3 tablespoons olive oil and add the zest of 1 lemon. Drain the pasta and add it to the pan with 2 tablespoons lemon juice, ½ teaspoon salt, and 30 g grated Parmesan cheese. Toss and serve.

text:
Simple Chicken and Rice Bake
Cook 1 cup long-grain rice in 2 cups water until just tender. In a baking dish, combine the cooked rice with 300 g cooked chicken pieces, 1 cup chicken broth, ½ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon black pepper. Stir gently, cover with foil, and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 25 minutes until hot and slightly creamy.

text:
Garlic Butter Potatoes
Peel and dice 600 g potatoes into small cubes. Boil in salted water for 12 minutes until tender, then drain well. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a pan, add 2 minced garlic cloves, and sauté for 30 seconds. Add the potatoes, ½ teaspoon salt, and cook until lightly golden.

text:
Creamy Tomato Chicken
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan and brown 400 g chicken breast pieces. Add 1 cup crushed tomatoes, ½ cup cream, 1 teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken.

text:
Soft Scrambled Eggs

text:
Lentil Vegetable Stew

text:
Beef Brisket
In a bowl, mix 1 cup catsup with 1 cup water, 1/2 minced onion, 2 tablespoons cider vinegar, 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish, 1 tablespoon prepared mustard, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper to make a tangy sauce. Place a 4 lb beef brisket fat-side up in a shallow dish, pour the sauce over it, cover, and refrigerate for several hours or overnight so the flavors soak in. Roast the brisket in a preheated 300°F (about 150°C) oven for 3 1/2 to 4 hours, until very tender. Slice against the grain and serve with the sauce from the pan.

text:
Fruit Medley
In a saucepan, combine 3 tablespoons tapioca, 1 cup water, and 1/2 cup sugar, and let it stand for 5 minutes. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until the tapioca turns clear, then add 1 1/2 cups water and 1 can (6 oz) thawed frozen orange juice concentrate. Stir in 1 can (11 oz) mandarin oranges (drained) and 1 can (16 oz) peach slices (drained and cut in half). Chill thoroughly, preferably overnight. Just before serving, add 1 bag (16 oz) frozen whole strawberries (thawed) and 2 large bananas (sliced), mixing gently so the fruit stays intact. Serve in dessert bowls and top each portion with a scoop of lime sherbet; this makes about 8 servings.

text:
Nana’s Cornbread (9-inch skillet or 8x8 pan)
Preheat the oven to 425°F (about 220°C) and place 1/4 cup bacon fat in the 9-inch iron skillet (or 8x8 pan) to melt as the oven heats. In a bowl, stir 1/2 teaspoon baking soda into 1 cup buttermilk, then add 1 cup corn meal, 1 cup flour, 1 to 2 tablespoons sugar (depending on how sweet you like it), 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoons baking soda, and 1 egg. Mix until just combined, then carefully pour the batter into the hot pan with the melted bacon fat. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown and set in the center.

text:
Marinated Pork Roast
In a bowl, combine 1/2 cup sherry, 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1 tablespoon dry mustard, 1 teaspoon thyme, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 teaspoon ginger to make a marinade. Place 1 rolled pork roast (4 to 5 lb) into a large plastic bag set inside a deep bowl, pour in the marinade, and seal tightly. Let it marinate 2 to 3 hours at room temperature or overnight in the refrigerator, pressing the bag against the meat occasionally to distribute the marinade. Remove the roast, place it uncovered in a roasting pan, and cook at 325°F (about 165°C) for about 3 hours, basting with the marinade during the last hour. Slice and serve.

Let stand 2 to 3 hours at room temperature or overnight in refrigerator.", "Occasionally press bag against meat to distribute marinade.", "Remove meat.", "Roast, uncovered, at 325° for 3 hours. Baste with marinade the last hour."]}

text:
Dad’s Chili
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a saucepan over medium heat and fry 2 lb pork tenderloin cut into cubes until lightly browned. Add 1 tablespoon minced garlic and cook briefly, then drain excess fat if needed. Dice 6 to 10 roasted and peeled Pueblo green chilies and add them to the pot along with 1 can stewed tomatoes and garlic salt to taste. Pour in 3 cups of the 4 cups water and bring to a steady simmer. In a small bowl, dissolve 3 teaspoons cornstarch in the remaining 1 cup water, then stir it into the chili to thicken. Simmer over medium heat until slightly thickened and the pork is tender, adjusting garlic salt (and salt if needed) before serving.

Drain meat.", "Add 3 cups of water.", "Add green chilies and diced tomatoes; add with garlic salt.", "Mix cornstarch to remaining cup of water.", "Then add to mixture.", "Salt to taste.", "Cook at medium heat."]}

text:
Spoon Rolls
Dissolve 1 package dry yeast in 2 cups lukewarm water, then stir in 1/4 cup sugar, 3/4 cup melted Crisco, and 1 egg. Add 4 cups self-rising flour and mix until you have a thick batter. Spoon the batter into a well-greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full. Bake at 425°F (about 220°C) for about 20 minutes, until golden brown. If you want to bake later, the batter can be kept sealed in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
json: {"title": "Spoon Rolls", "ingredients": ["3/4 c. Crisco, melted", "1 egg", "1 pkg. dry yeast", "4 c. self-rising flour", "2 c. lukewarm water", "1/4 c. sugar"], "directions": ["Dissolve yeast in warm water.", "Mix with other ingredients.", "To bake, spoon batter into well-greased muffin tin about 2/3 full. Bake at 425° for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Will keep in refrigerator for 2 weeks if sealed in Tupperware bowl."]}

text:
Chicago Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies
Preheat the oven to 350°F (about 175°C). Sift together 3 1/2 cups flour, 3 teaspoons baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. In a large bowl, beat 1/2 cup butter with 1 cup packed brown sugar and 1 cup granulated sugar until blended, then beat in 1 egg, 1 tablespoon milk, and 2 tablespoons vanilla. Mix in 1 cup vegetable oil, then stir in 1 cup quick oats, 1 cup cornflakes, and 1 package (12 oz) semi-sweet chocolate pieces. Add the flour mixture and stir until a dough forms. Drop spoonfuls onto baking sheets and bake until set and crisp at the edges, about 10 to 12 minutes.

text:
Salad Dressing
Place 2 tablespoons lemon juice (or wine vinegar), 1 tablespoon honey, 1 diced garlic clove, 1 tablespoon rosemary, 2 tablespoons water, 1 small diced onion, 1 tablespoon flax seed, and 1 teaspoon parsley into a blender. Blend until smooth, then taste and adjust acidity or sweetness if needed. Chill before serving for best flavor.
