text:
Leroy’s Heavenly Hash
In a large bowl, combine 1 No. 2 can fruit cocktail (about 29 oz), 4 bananas (cut up), 1 small bag miniature marshmallows, 1 package (8 oz) pecan pieces, 1 pint Cool Whip, and 1 small can crushed pineapple. Mix gently until evenly combined, then refrigerate until cold and serve.
json: {"title": "Leroy'S Heavenly Hash", "ingredients": ["No. 2 can fruit cocktail", "4 bananas, cut up", "1 small bag miniature marshmallows", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. pecan pieces", "1 pt. Cool Whip", "1 small can crushed pineapple"], "directions": ["Mix in a large bowl.", "Refrigerate and serve cold."]}

text:
Banana Cream Pie
Whisk together 2 1/2 cups milk, 1/4 cup heavy cream, and 2 egg yolks. In a heavy saucepan, combine 2/3 cup sugar with 4 tablespoons cornstarch, then whisk in the milk mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes, then stir constantly until it comes to a boil, about 7 minutes more. Boil for 1 minute while stirring, then remove from heat and stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla and 3 tablespoons room-temperature butter. Fold in 1 to 2 sliced bananas, pour into a baked pie shell, smooth the top, and finish with meringue or whipped cream.
json: {"title": "Banana Cream Pie", "ingredients": ["2 1/2 c. milk", "1/4 c. heavy cream", "2 egg yolks", "2/3 c. sugar", "4 Tbsp. cornstarch", "2 tsp. vanilla", "3 Tbsp. butter (room temperature)", "1 or 2 sliced bananas"], "directions": ["Whisk together the milk, cream and egg yolks.", "Combine the sugar and cornstarch in heavy saucepan.", "Whisk in the yolk mixture and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Then stir the mixture constantly until it comes to a boil, about 7 minutes more.", "Boil, stirring, 1 minute.", "Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in the vanilla, butter and bananas.", "Pour into baked pie shell and smooth top.", "Finish with meringue or whipped cream topping."]}

text:
Marinated Onions and Blue Cheese
Whisk together 1/2 cup olive oil, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon salt, a dash of pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon sugar. Stir in 1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese, then add 2 cups sliced red or yellow onions and toss until coated. Chill briefly before serving so the flavors blend.
json: {"title": "Marinated Onions And Blue Cheese", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. olive oil", "2 tsp. lemon juice", "1 tsp. salt", "dash of pepper", "1/2 tsp. sugar", "1/4 c. crumbled Blue cheese", "2 c. sliced red or yellow onions"], "directions": ["Mix olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper and sugar.", "Add Blue cheese and onions."]}

text:
Cheese Cake (Graham Cracker Base)
Grease a springform pan (or a 13x9-inch pan). Mix 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs with 1/2 cup melted butter, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, and 1/4 cup sugar. Press the mixture firmly into the bottom of the pan and slightly up the sides. In a bowl, beat 1 package (16 oz) cream cheese with 1/3 cup milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 3 eggs, and 4 tablespoons lemon juice until smooth, then pour over the crust and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) until set (typically 40–55 minutes depending on pan size). Chill before slicing.
json: {"title": "Cheese Cake", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs", "1/2 c. butter", "1/4 tsp. cinnamon", "1/4 c. sugar", "1 (16 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1/3 c. milk", "1/2 c. sugar", "3 eggs", "4 Tbsp. lemon juice"], "directions": ["Grease a spring-form pan (you can use a 13 x 9-inch pan) and pat mixture of graham cracker crumbs, butter, cinnamon and 1/4 cup sugar in bottom and a little up the sides of the pan."]}

text:
Carrot Bread
In a bowl, mix 1 cup sugar with 2/3 cup oil, then beat in 2 eggs. Add 1 1/2 cups flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon baking powder, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon, mixing until smooth. Stir in 1 jar junior strained carrots (baby food) and 1/2 cup nuts. Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for about 1 hour, until a toothpick comes out clean.
json: {"title": "Carrot Bread", "ingredients": ["1 c. sugar", "2/3 c. oil", "2 eggs", "1 1/2 c. flour", "1 tsp. baking soda", "1 tsp. baking powder", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 jar junior strained carrots (baby food)", "1/2 c. nuts"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients in order.", "Bake in greased loaf pan for 1 hour at 350°."]}

text:
Mistletoe Punch
In a punch bowl, combine 1 can (6 oz) thawed frozen lemonade concentrate, 1 can (6 oz) thawed frozen orange juice concentrate, and 6 cups water. Stir in about 1/2 cup grenadine syrup (the original text is unclear on the exact amount, but 1/2 cup works well for color and sweetness). Chill the mixture thoroughly. Just before serving, add ice and pour in 1 quart chilled ginger ale, stirring gently. Garnish each cup with wafer-thin lemon slices and maraschino cherries; this serves about 30.
json: {"title": "Mistletoe Punch", "ingredients": ["1 (6 oz.) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed", "1 (6 oz.) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed", "6 c. water", "1/2 ??? grenadine syrup", "1 qt. ginger ale, chilled", "wafer thin lemon slices and maraschino cherries for garnish"], "directions": ["Combine all ingredients, except ginger ale and garnish, in a punch bowl.", "Just before serving, add some ice cubes and stir in the ginger ale.", "Put lemon slice and a cherry in each cup.", "Serves 30."]}

text:
Mixed Vegetable Casserole
Mix together 1 can Veg-All (drained), 1/2 cup chopped onion, 1/2 cup sliced water chestnuts, 1/2 cup grated Cheddar cheese, and 1/3 cup plus 2 level tablespoons mayonnaise. Spread into a casserole dish. Top with 1/2 roll crushed Ritz crackers mixed with 1/2 stick melted margarine, then bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for about 30 minutes until hot and lightly golden.
json: {"title": "Mixed Vegetable Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 can Veg-All, drained", "1/2 c. chopped onion", "1/2 c. water chestnuts, sliced", "1/2 c. grated cheese (Cheddar)", "1/3 c. plus 2 level Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1/2 roll Ritz crackers, crushed", "1/2 stick margarine"], "directions": ["Mix first 5 ingredients.", "Pour into casserole and top with crackers mixed with margarine.", "Bake at 350° for 30 minutes."]}

text:
Cheeseburger Crescent Bake
Preheat the oven to 350°F (about 175°C). Press 1 package (8 oz) crescent rolls into a 13x9-inch pan to form a crust, pushing the dough about 1/2 inch up the sides. Brown 1 lb ground beef with 1/8 cup chopped onion, drain the grease, then stir in 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Stir in 2 cups shredded cheese and 1 beaten egg, then spread the mixture over the crust. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until set and golden.
json: {"title": "Cheeseburger Crescent Bake(1 Hour)", "ingredients": ["1 lb. ground beef", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. crescent rolls", "1/8 c. chopped onion", "1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce", "1 tsp. lemon juice", "1/2 tsp. paprika", "1/4 tsp. garlic powder", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/8 tsp. pepper", "2 c. shredded cheese", "1 beaten egg"], "directions": ["Press crescent rolls in 13 x 9-inch pan, forming crust 1/2-inch up edge.", "Brown hamburger in skillet with onion.", "Drain grease.", "Remove from heat and stir in remaining ingredients. Spread over crescent rolls.", "Bake 20 to 25 minutes at 350°.", "Kids love this!"]}

text:
Do-Unkles Pumpkin Cake
Mix 2 cups sugar, 2 cups flour, 2 cups pumpkin, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 1 teaspoon nutmeg, 2 teaspoons baking soda, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 cup oil, 4 eggs, and 1 cup chopped walnuts. Beat at medium speed for about 3 minutes until smooth, then pour into a 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 325°F (about 165°C) for about 45 minutes, then cool and frost with cream cheese frosting or your favorite frosting.
json: {"title": "Do-Unkles Pumpkin Cake", "ingredients": ["2 c. sugar", "2 c. flour", "2 c. pumpkin", "1/2 tsp. salt", "2 tsp. cinnamon", "1 tsp. nutmeg", "2 tsp. soda", "1 c. oil", "4 eggs", "2 tsp. baking powder", "1 c. chopped walnuts"], "directions": ["Combine all ingredients together.", "Mix at medium speed for 3 minutes.", "Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Bake at 325° for 45 minutes.", "Frost with cream cheese frosting or your favorite."]}

text:
Colonial Cheese Biscuits
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons flour with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1 1/2 teaspoons paprika. Cut in 2 sticks softened butter, then work in 1 1/2 lb sharp Cheddar cheese until a stiff dough forms. Shape or roll and cut into small biscuit shapes, place on baking sheets, and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) until set and lightly browned, about 12 to 15 minutes. Dust lightly with confectioners sugar if desired (the ingredient list includes it, but it’s optional and unusual—use only if you want a sweet-salty finish).
json: {"title": "Colonial Cheese Biscuits", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 lb. sharp Cheddar cheese", "2 sticks butter, softened", "2 c. plus 2 Tbsp. flour", "1 1/2 tsp. salt", "1 1/2 tsp. paprika", "confectioners sugar"], "directions": ["These pancakes are as big as a dinner plate and formerly even bigger (12-inches in diameter!).", "Nowadays you may find such big pancakes on the menu of a restaurant, but at home, we make them the dinner plate size.", "They are either eaten as a savory (with smoked sausage or bacon) or as a sweet (plain with molasses or golden syrup or with apples).", "Pancakes are best when made with yeast and they should be served piping hot.", "Use two skillets when available. Keep the pancakes hot on steam, or covered in the oven.", "Cold pancakes are awful!", "The following recipe is a luxury one, for special occasions, as many eggs are used in preparing (instead of yeast)."]}

text:
Simple Salsa Dip
In a microwave-safe bowl, combine 1 jar salsa (any size), 1 lb shredded American cheese, and 1 can refried beans. Microwave in short bursts, stirring between each, until the cheese is fully melted and the dip is hot and smooth. Serve with tortilla chips.
json: {"title": "Simple Salsa Dip", "ingredients": ["1 jar (any size) salsa", "1 lb. American cheese (shredded)", "1 can refried beans"], "directions": ["Mix it all together and microwave until cheese melts.", "Goes good with tortilla chips."]}

text:
Any Flavor Pan Dessert
Mix 1 cup flour with 1 stick melted butter (or oleo), 1 tablespoon sugar, and 1/2 cup chopped pecans (optional). Press into a 9x13-inch pan and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for 8 to 10 minutes, then cool. Blend 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese with 1 cup powdered sugar and 1 cup frozen whipped topping, then spread over the cooled base and chill. Prepare 2 packages instant pudding with 3 cups milk, spread over the cream cheese layer, chill 15 minutes, and top with the remaining whipped topping. Chill before slicing; this makes about 16 servings.
json: {"title": "Any Flavor Pan Dessert", "ingredients": ["1 c. flour", "1 stick butter or oleo", "1/2 c. chopped pecans (optional)", "1 Tbsp. sugar", "1 small container frozen whipped topping", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 c. powdered sugar", "2 pkg. instant pudding", "3 c. milk"], "directions": ["Mix the first 4 ingredients and press into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake 8 to 10 minutes at 350°.", "Combine 1 cup whipped topping with cream cheese and powdered sugar.", "Spread on top of baked layer and chill.", "Mix pudding with milk and spread over second layer.", "Chill 15 minutes before spreading the remaining whipped topping over the pudding.", "Serves 16."]}

text:
Mexican Casserole
Cover the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish with Fritos or Doritos (enough to make a solid layer). Brown 1 lb ground beef with 1 chopped onion, then stir in 1 can Rotel, 1 can mushroom soup, 1 can cream of chicken soup, and 1 can (12 oz) Pet milk. Pour the mixture over the chips, top with grated cheese (as much as you like), and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes until bubbly.
json: {"title": "Mexican Casserole", "ingredients": ["Fritos or Doritos", "1 lb. ground beef", "1 onion", "1 can rotel", "1 can mushroom soup", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 (12 oz.) can pet milk (can use fat free)", "Grated cheese"], "directions": ["In 9 X 13 dish spree fritos or doritos to cover well.", "Brown and mix hamburger and onion.", "Add rotel, soups and milk.", "Pour over chips, cover with cheese and bake at 350 degrees until bubbly (25 to 30 minutes)."]}

text:
Apple Sour Cream Coffee Cake
Combine 2 cups flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. In another bowl, cream 1/2 cup butter (or margarine) with 1 cup sugar until fluffy, then beat in 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Add the flour mixture alternately with 1 cup sour cream until smooth. In a separate bowl, toss 1 1/4 cups peeled thinly sliced apples with 1/2 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and 1/2 cup chopped nuts. Spoon half the batter into a greased 9-inch tube or Bundt pan, sprinkle with half the apple mixture, add the remaining batter, then top with the remaining apple mixture. Bake at 375°F (about 190°C) for 40 to 50 minutes, cool 10 minutes, and unmold.
json: {"title": "Apple Sour Cream Coffee Cake", "ingredients": ["2 c. flour", "1 tsp. baking soda", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/2 c. butter or margarine", "1 c. sugar", "2 eggs", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 c. sour cream", "1/2 c. sugar", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1/2 c. chopped nuts", "1 1/4 c. apples, peeled and thinly sliced"], "directions": ["Combine flour, soda and salt. In another bowl, cream butter and 1 cup sugar until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla; mix well. Blend in flour mix, alternating with sour cream. In another bowl, mix together apples, cinnamon, 1/2 cup sugar and nuts. Spread half the batter in a greased 9-inch tube or Bundt pan. Sprinkle half the cinnamon-apple mix over the batter. Spoon in the rest of the batter and sprinkle on the rest of the cinnamon-apple mix. Bake at 375° for 40 to 50 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan."]}

text:
Snickerdoodles
Preheat the oven to 350°F (about 175°C). Beat together 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1/2 cup margarine, 1/2 cup vegetable shortening, and 2 eggs until smooth. In another bowl, combine 2 3/4 cups flour, 2 teaspoons cream of tartar, 1 teaspoon baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then stir into the wet mixture until a soft dough forms. Mix together 2 teaspoons sugar and 2 teaspoons cinnamon for coating. Roll dough into small balls (about 1 tablespoon each), roll in the cinnamon-sugar, and place on a cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until set.
json: {"title": "Snickerdoodles", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 c. sugar", "1/2 c. margarine", "1/2 c. vegetable shortening", "2 eggs", "2 tsp. cinnamon", "2 3/4 c. flour", "2 tsp. cream of tartar", "1 tsp. baking soda", "1/4 tsp. salt", "2 tsp. sugar"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 350°.", "Beat with an electric mixer, the sugar, margarine, shortening and eggs in a large mixing bowl.", "Put flour, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt into flour sifter and add to the sugar mixture.", "Stir until flour disappears.", "Shape dough by rounding teaspoonfuls into balls.", "Mix 2 teaspoons sugar and 2 teaspoons cinnamon; roll each ball in cinnamon sugar mixture. Place about 2 inches apart on cookie sheet.", "Bake until set, about 8 to 10 minutes."]}

text:
Spaghetti Salad
Cook 1 lb spaghetti until tender, drain, and cool completely. In a large bowl, combine the cooled spaghetti with 3 diced cucumbers, 4 diced tomatoes, 2 diced celery stalks, 1 diced green pepper, and 2 diced onions. Pour in 1 small bottle Wish-Bone Italian dressing and add 1/2 bottle Salad Supreme seasoning, then toss well. Chill before serving for best flavor.
json: {"title": "Spaghetti Salad", "ingredients": ["1 lb. spaghetti", "3 cucumbers, diced", "4 tomatoes, diced", "2 stalks celery, diced", "1 green pepper, diced", "2 onions, diced", "1 small bottle Wish-Bone Italian salad dressing", "1/2 bottle Salad Supreme"], "directions": ["In a saucepan, cook spaghetti until tender.", "Drain and cool. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients and stir."]}

text:
Spanish Meat Balls
Mix 1 lb ground meat with 2 slices cubed bread, 1 grated onion, 1/2 cup uncooked rice, 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon allspice, 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 green pepper (optional). Shape into small meatballs and place in a greased casserole dish. In a saucepan, heat 2 cans tomato soup with 2 1/2 soup cans of water and the remaining 1 teaspoon chili powder, then pour over the meatballs. Cover and bake at 375°F (about 190°C) for about 2 hours; this yields about 6 servings.
json: {"title": "Spanish Meat Balls", "ingredients": ["1 lb. ground meat", "2 slices cubed bread", "1 onion, grated", "1/2 c. rice (uncooked)", "1 tsp. chili powder", "1/2 tsp. allspice", "2 eggs", "1 tsp. salt", "1 green pepper (optional)", "2 cans tomato soup", "2 1/2 soup cans water", "1 tsp. chili powder"], "directions": ["Mix well the first 9 ingredients; shape into small balls.", "Put into a large greased casserole.", "Heat soup, water and remaining chili powder; pour over meat balls.", "Bake, covered, at 375° for 2 hours.", "Yields 6 servings."]}

text:
Broccoli Cornbread
In a large bowl, combine 1 box Jiffy corn muffin mix with 1 1/2 sticks melted margarine. Add 2 whole eggs and 2 egg whites, 1 cup sour cream, 1 package (10 oz) frozen chopped broccoli (thawed but not drained), and 1 medium chopped onion. Mix well, pour into an ungreased 9x13-inch pan, and bake at 400°F (about 200°C) for 20 to 25 minutes until golden.
json: {"title": "Broccoli Cornbread", "ingredients": ["1 box Jiffy corn muffin mix", "1 1/2 sticks margarine, melted", "2 whole eggs", "2 egg whites", "1 c. sour cream", "1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped broccoli, thawed but not drained", "1 medium onion, chopped"], "directions": ["Combine cornbread mix and margarine in a large bowl and mix together.", "Add remaining ingredients; blend well.", "Pour into an ungreased 9 x 13 baking pan.", "Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown."]}

text:
Fried Onion Rings
Slice 2 large sweet onions into 1/2-inch rings and separate them. Soak the rings in ice water for 30 minutes, then drain well. Make a batter by whisking 1 egg with 2/3 cup water, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, and 1 teaspoon lemon juice, then stir in 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 to 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, and 1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper. Heat deep frying oil in a pot, dip onion rings into the batter, and fry until golden, then drain on paper towels and salt lightly if needed.
json: {"title": "Fried Onion Rings", "ingredients": ["2 large sweet onions", "1 egg", "2/3 c. water", "1 Tbsp. vegetable oil", "1 tsp. lemon juice", "1 c. all-purpose flour", "1 1/2 tsp. baking powder", "1 to 1 1/4 tsp. salt", "1/8 to 1/4 cayenne pepper", "oil (for deep-fat frying)"], "directions": ["Cut onions into 1/2-inch slices; separate rings. Place in a bowl; cover with ice water and let soak for 30 minutes."]}

text:
Mayonnaise Rolls
Mix 1 cup White Lily self-rising flour with 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 1/2 cup sweet milk, and a pinch of salt. Stir until smooth, spoon into greased muffin pans filling each about 1/3 full, and bake at 400°F (about 200°C) until browned, about 12 to 15 minutes. This makes about 6 rolls.
json: {"title": "Mayonnaise Rolls", "ingredients": ["1 c. White Lily Self Rising Flour", "1/3 c. mayonnaise", "1/2 c. sweet milk", "pinch salt"], "directions": ["Mix well, fill muffin pans 1/3 full.", "Bake at 400° until brown.", "Makes about 6 rolls."]}

text:
Cheeseburger Loaf
Preheat the oven to 350°F (about 175°C) and lightly grease a loaf pan. In a bowl, mix 1 1/2 lb ground chuck with 1/2 cup evaporated milk, 1 egg, 1 cup cracker crumbs, 4 tablespoons finely chopped onion, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon dry mustard, and 1 tablespoon ketchup. Press 1/3 of the meat mixture into the pan, sprinkle 1/2 cup grated American cheese over it (keeping cheese away from the edges), add another 1/3 meat layer, another 1/2 cup cheese, and finish with the remaining meat. Bake for 1 hour, let stand 10 to 15 minutes, then slice; it yields about 6 servings.
json: {"title": "Cheeseburger Loaf", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. evaporated milk", "1 egg", "1 c. cracker crumbs", "1 1/2 lb. ground chuck", "4 Tbsp. finely chopped onion", "1 1/2 tsp. salt or to taste", "1 tsp. dry mustard", "1 Tbsp. ketchup", "1 c. grated American cheese"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 350°.", "Combine all ingredients except cheese in bowl and mix thoroughly.", "Lightly grease a loaf pan.", "Put 1/3 of meat mixture in the bottom of pan and spread evenly.", "Put 1/2 cup cheese on top (keep cheese away from the edge of the pan to prevent burning or sticking).", "Repeat layers (1/3 meat, 1/2 cup cheese, 1/3 meat).", "Bake 1 hour.", "Let stand 10 to 15 minutes before removing to a platter to slice.", "Yield:", "6 servings. Preparation time: 30 minutes."]}

text:
One Bowl Chocolate Fudge (Microwave)
In a microwave-safe bowl, combine 1 package (8 oz) semi-sweet chocolate with 2/3 cup sweetened condensed milk. Microwave on high for 1 minute, stir well, then microwave 1 minute more and stir until completely smooth. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1 cup chopped nuts. Spread into a greased 9x5-inch loaf pan and refrigerate about 30 minutes until firm, then cut into squares.
json: {"title": "One Bowl Chocolate Fudge(Microwave)", "ingredients": ["1 pkg. (8 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate", "2/3 c. sweetened condensed milk", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1/8 tsp. salt", "1 c. chopped nuts"], "directions": ["Microwave chocolate and milk in 1 1/2-quart microwavable bowl on High 1 minute; stir well.", "Microwave 1 minute longer. Stir until chocolate is completely melted and smooth.", "Stir in vanilla, salt and walnuts.", "Spread into greased 9 x 5-inch loaf pan. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm.", "Cut into squares."]}

text:
Ranch Style Baked Beans Casserole
Brown 1 lb ground beef in 2 tablespoons margarine, then stir in 1 package onion soup mix, 1/2 cup water, 1 cup catsup, 2 tablespoons prepared mustard, 2 teaspoons vinegar, 2 cans (1 lb each) pork and beans in tomato sauce, and 1 can (1 lb) kidney beans (drained). Pour into a bean pot or 2-quart casserole dish and bake at 400°F (about 200°C) for 30 minutes; this makes about 10 to 12 servings.
json: {"title": "Ranch Style Baked Beans Casserole", "ingredients": ["2 Tbsp. margarine", "1 lb. ground beef", "1 pkg. onion soup mix", "1/2 c. water", "1 c. catsup", "2 Tbsp. prepared mustard", "2 tsp. vinegar", "2 (1 lb.) cans pork and beans in tomato sauce", "1 (1 lb.) can kidney beans, drained"], "directions": ["Brown meat in margarine; stir in remaining ingredients.", "Pour into bean pot or 2-quart casserole (cool and freeze if desired.) Bake at 400° for 30 minutes.", "Makes 10 to 12 servings."]}

text:
Etta’s Hungarian Coffee Cake
In a bowl, mix 1 cup brown sugar with 1/3 cup shortening until blended, then work in 1 cup flour and a pinch of salt until crumbly. Reserve 1/2 cup of these crumbs for the topping. To the remaining mixture, add 1 beaten egg. Stir 1 teaspoon baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon baking powder into 1/2 cup sour milk (made by adding 1 tablespoon vinegar or lemon juice to milk), then mix into the batter. Spread into a greased 9-inch cake pan or pie plate, sprinkle the reserved crumbs over the top, and bake for about 35 minutes until set.
json: {"title": "Etta'S Hungarian Coffee Cake", "ingredients": ["1 c. brown sugar", "1 c. flour", "1/3 c. shortening", "pinch of salt", "1 egg, beaten", "1 tsp. baking soda", "1/2 tsp. baking powder", "1/2 c. sour milk (add 1 Tbsp. vinegar or lemon juice to sour 1 c. milk)"], "directions": ["Mix sugar and shortening.", "Add flour and salt until it crumbles.", "Put aside 1/2 cup of this mixture for topping.", "Add egg to remainder.", "Add soda and baking powder to sour milk, then mix everything together.", "Sprinkle crumbs on top.", "(Optional: Sprinkle cinnamon and ground nuts on top.)", "Bake for 35 minutes in a 9-inch cake pan or pie plate."]}

text:
Beer Biscuits
Stir 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar into 6 oz warm beer until dissolved, then pour into 2 cups biscuit mix and stir just until combined. Bake according to the biscuit mix package directions.
json: {"title": "Beer Biscuits", "ingredients": ["2 c. biscuit mix", "1 1/2 Tbsp. sugar", "6 oz. warm beer"], "directions": ["Dissolve sugar in beer and add to biscuit mix.", "Mix and bake in accordance with directions on biscuit mix container."]}

text:
Baked Spaghetti
In a large skillet, sauté 1 cup chopped onion and 1 cup chopped green pepper in 1 tablespoon butter until tender. Add 1 can (28 oz) tomatoes with liquid (cut up), 1 can (4 oz) drained mushroom stems and pieces, 1 can (2 1/4 oz) drained sliced ripe olives, and 2 teaspoons dried oregano, plus 1 lb browned ground beef if using. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes. In a greased 13x9-inch baking dish, layer half of 12 oz cooked and drained spaghetti, half the sauce mixture, and 1 cup of the 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese. Repeat the layers. Stir 1 can (10 3/4 oz) condensed cream of mushroom soup with 1/4 cup water, spread over the top, sprinkle with 1/4 cup grated Parmesan, and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) until hot and bubbly.
json: {"title": "Baked Spaghetti", "ingredients": ["1 c. chopped onion", "1 c. chopped green pepper", "1 Tbsp. butter", "1 (28 oz.) can tomatoes with liquid, cut up", "1 (4 oz.) can mushroom stems and pieces, drained", "1 (2 1/4 oz.) can sliced ripe olives, drained", "2 tsp. dried oregano", "1 lb. ground beef, browned and drained (optional)", "12 oz. spaghetti, cooked and drained", "2 c. (8 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese", "1 (10 3/4 oz.) can condensed cream of mushroom soup (undiluted)", "1/4 c. water", "1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese"], "directions": ["In a large skillet, saute onion and green pepper in butter until tender.", "Add tomatoes, mushrooms, olives and oregano.", "Add ground beef if desired.", "Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes.", "Place half of the spaghetti in a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Top with half of the vegetable mixture.", "Sprinkle with 1 cup Cheddar cheese.", "Repeat layers."]}

text:
Easy Apple Dumplings
Peel 5 cooking apples and cut into quarters. Separate and roll out 1 can biscuits (10 count), then cut each biscuit in half. Wrap one apple quarter in each biscuit half and place in a buttered baking dish. In a saucepan, mix 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1 1/2 cups water, 1 teaspoon apple pie spice, and 1 teaspoon vanilla, then pour over the dumplings. Cut 1 stick butter (or margarine) over the top and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) until apples are tender. Baste with the syrup and continue baking until golden; this yields about 8 to 10 portions.
json: {"title": "Easy Apple Dumplings", "ingredients": ["1 can biscuits (10 count)", "5 cooking apples", "1/2 c. granulated sugar", "1/2 c. brown sugar", "1 1/2 c. water", "1 tsp. apple pie spice", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 stick butter or margarine"], "directions": ["Peel, cut apples into quarters.", "Roll out biscuits.", "Cut each in half.", "Put 1 quarter apple in each biscuit half.", "Fold dough over apple, place in a buttered sheet pan or large casserole dish. Mix next 5 ingredients; pour over dumplings, cut butter over top. Bake in a 350° oven until apples are done.", "Take from oven, baste and continue baking until golden brown.", "May be served with Cool Whip.", "Yields 8 to 10 portions."]}

text:
Twinkie Dessert
Line the bottom of a 13x9-inch pan with 14 Twinkies. Dissolve 1 large box strawberry Jell-O in 2 cups hot water, then stir in 1 package (10 oz) frozen strawberries (thawed) or 2 cups fresh strawberries. Pour the strawberry mixture over the Twinkies and let set for at least 30 minutes. Prepare 1 large box vanilla instant pudding as directed, spread it over the set Jell-O layer, then top with 1 large container Cool Whip. Chill before serving and decorate with extra strawberries if desired.
json: {"title": "Twinkie Dessert", "ingredients": ["14 Twinkies", "1 large box strawberry jello", "2 c. hot water", "1 10 oz. frozen strawberries or 2 c. fresh", "1 large box vanilla instant pudding", "1 large container Cool Whip"], "directions": ["Line bottom of 13x9 pan with Twinkies.", "Mix jello with hot water and stir until dissolved. Add strawberries and pour over Twinkies.", "Let set for 30 minutes or more.", "Mix pudding as directed and pour over Twinkies and jello.", "Cover with Cool Whip and decorate with more strawberries if desired."]}

text:
Gooey Butter Cake
Preheat the oven to 350°F (about 175°C). Mix 1 box yellow or chocolate cake mix with 1 egg and 1 stick melted butter, then press into a greased and floured 9x12-inch pan. Beat together 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese with 2 eggs, 1 box powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla until smooth, then pour over the crust. Bake for about 35 to 40 minutes, cool completely, and cut into squares.
json: {"title": "Gooey Butter Cake", "ingredients": ["1 box yellow or chocolate cake mix", "3 eggs", "1 stick butter", "1 (8 oz.) cream cheese", "1 box powdered sugar", "1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Preheat oven at 350°.", "Mix cake mix with 1 egg and butter, melted.", "Press into a 9 x 12 cake pan that has been greased and floured.", "Then mix 2 eggs, cream cheese, 1 box powdered sugar and vanilla together.", "Use a blender until all mixed, then pour over cake in pan and bake about 35 to 40 minutes at 350° or until you can stick a toothpick in and it comes out clean.", "Cool, then cut into squares and eat."]}

text:
Corn Pudding
Mix 1 tablespoon flour with 3 tablespoons sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Stir this into 1 can (1 lb) cream-style corn, then add 1 tablespoon melted butter and 4 well-beaten eggs. Stir in 1 cup scalded milk, pour into a greased casserole dish, and set the dish in a pan of hot water. Bake at 325°F (about 165°C) for about 1 hour until set; this serves about 6.
json: {"title": "Corn Pudding", "ingredients": ["1 (1 lb.) can cream-style corn", "1 Tbsp. butter", "1 Tbsp. flour", "4 eggs, well beaten", "3 Tbsp. sugar", "1 c. scalded milk", "1 tsp. salt", "1/8 tsp. pepper"], "directions": ["Mix flour, sugar, salt and pepper.", "Add to corn.", "Add melted butter. Add eggs.", "Add milk.", "Pour into greased casserole.", "Place in a pan of water. Bake at 325° for 1 hour.", "Serves 6."]}

text:
Honey Cake
Preheat the oven to 325°F (about 165°C) and grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan. Beat 3 eggs with an unknown amount of honey (the source text shows “??? c. honey,” so the exact quantity is missing; a common workable amount would be 1 cup honey, but the original recipe does not specify). Add 1/2 cup sugar and mix again. Stir 2 teaspoons baking powder into 1 cup strong black coffee and add it, along with 3 tablespoons soft margarine, to the egg mixture. Add 1 teaspoon baking soda, 4 cups flour, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon, then beat until smooth. Pour into the pan and bake for 55 minutes to 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Honey Cake", "ingredients": ["3 eggs", "??? c. honey", "1/2 c. sugar", "1 c. strong black coffee", "2 tsp. baking powder", "3 Tbsp. soft margarine", "1 tsp. baking soda", "4 c. flour", "1 tsp. cinnamon"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 325°.", "Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch cake pan.", "In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs and honey together.", "Add sugar and mix again.", "Mix coffee with baking powder and add margarine to the egg mixture.", "Add baking soda, flour and cinnamon and beat together well.", "Pour into greased cake pan.", "Bake for 55 minutes to 1 hour."]}

text:
Enchiladas
In a saucepan, combine 1 can (12 oz) tomato paste with 1 quart water, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 5 teaspoons chili powder, then simmer for 20 minutes to make the sauce. In a skillet, brown 1 lb lean ground beef with 1/2 cup chopped green onions, drain fat, then stir in 1 1/2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese and 1 cup of the sauce. Spoon 1/4 cup sauce into a shallow 3-quart baking dish. Dip corn tortillas (1 dozen) quickly into the remaining sauce to soften, fill each with some of the beef mixture, roll up, and place seam-side down in the dish. Pour remaining sauce over the top, sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup cheese and extra onions, and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for 20 minutes; this makes about 6 servings.
json: {"title": "Enchiladas", "ingredients": ["1 (12 oz.) can tomato paste", "1 qt. water", "2 cloves garlic, minced", "5 tsp. chili powder", "1 lb. lean ground beef", "1/2 c. chopped green onions", "2 c. shredded Monterey Jack cheese", "1 doz. corn tortillas"], "directions": ["In a saucepan, combine tomato paste, water, garlic and chili powder; simmer 20 minutes.", "In skillet, brown ground beef with half of the onions; drain fat.", "Stir in 1 1/2 cups of cheese and 1 cup tomato paste mixture.", "Spoon 1/4 cup tomato paste mixture in 3-quart shallow baking dish.", "Soften tortillas, one at a time, by dipping in and out of remaining mixture.", "Spoon beef mixture down center of each tortilla; roll up.", "Place seam side down in baking dish.", "Pour remaining tomato paste mixture over top.", "Sprinkle with remaining cheese and onions.", "Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Makes 6 servings."]}

text:
Zucchini in Tomato Juice (Weight Watchers Style)
Cut zucchini into cubes (halve lengthwise first, then cube). Place the zucchini in a saucepan with 12 oz tomato juice, a dash of oregano, a dash of parsley flakes, a dash of garlic powder, 2 tablespoons bell pepper, 2 tablespoons dehydrated onions, salt to taste, and 1 chicken bouillon cube. Simmer until the zucchini is tender.
json: {"title": "Zucchini In Tomato Juice(From Weight Watchers)", "ingredients": ["zucchini", "12 oz. tomato juice", "dash of oregano", "dash of parsley flakes", "dash of garlic powder", "2 Tbsp. bell pepper", "2 Tbsp. dehydrated onions", "salt", "1 chicken bouillon cube"], "directions": ["Cut zucchini in half lengthwise, then cut into cubes.", "Put all ingredients in a saucepan and cook until the zucchini is tender."]}

text:
Pineapple Casserole
Mix 1 cup sugar with 6 tablespoons flour and 2 cups grated Cheddar cheese. Stir in 2 cans (15 1/2 oz each) pineapple chunks (drained), then spread into a greased 10x10-inch casserole dish. Top with 1 1/2 cups crushed Ritz crackers and drizzle with 1 stick melted margarine. Bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for 30 minutes until hot and golden.
json: {"title": "Pineapple Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 c. sugar", "6 Tbsp. flour", "2 c. grated Cheddar cheese", "1 1/2 c. crushed Ritz crackers", "2 (15 1/2 oz.) cans pineapple chunks, drained", "1 stick margarine, melted"], "directions": ["Mix sugar, flour and cheese.", "Add pineapple; pour in greased 10 x 10-inch casserole.", "Sprinkle crackers on top.", "Pour melted butter over top.", "Bake at 350° for 30 minutes."]}

text:
Brunswick Stew
Bring 1 whole chicken (about 2 lb) to a boil in 3 cups water with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, then reduce heat and simmer about 1 hour until tender. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add 3 potatoes (diced), 1 chopped onion, 1 box (10 oz) frozen lima beans, 1 cup corn (frozen or canned), and 1 can tomatoes to the broth and simmer until the vegetables are tender. Strip the chicken from the bones in large pieces and return it to the pot for the last 5 minutes of cooking. Finish with 1/4 cup butter and salt and pepper to taste.
json: {"title": "Brunswick Stew", "ingredients": ["1 (2 lb.) chicken", "3 c. water", "1 1/2 tsp. salt", "3 potatoes", "1 onion", "1 (10 oz.) box frozen limas", "1 c. frozen or 1 can corn", "1 can tomatoes", "salt and pepper to taste", "1/4 c. butter"], "directions": ["Bring chicken to boil in salted water.", "Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour, until tender.", "Remove from both.", "Add vegetables to broth and simmer until tender.", "Strip chicken from bones in large pieces and add to stew last 5 minutes of cooking."]}

text:
Cheese Ball
Beat 2 packages (8 oz each) cream cheese with 2 tablespoons mayonnaise and 1 teaspoon lemon juice until smooth. Finely chop 5 to 6 green onions, 1 package (6 oz) smoked deli beef, 1 small can chopped black olives, and 1 small green bell pepper, then stir into the cheese mixture. Chill at least 6 hours. Shape into a ball, roll in chopped nuts, and serve with Ritz crackers.
json: {"title": "Cheese Ball", "ingredients": ["2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 tsp. lemon juice", "5 to 6 green onions", "1 (6 oz.) pkg. smoked deli beef", "1 small can chopped black olives", "1 small green bell pepper", "chopped nuts", "Ritz crackers"], "directions": ["Mix together cream cheese, mayonnaise and lemon juice.", "Finely chop onions, beef, olives and bell pepper. Add to cheese mixture and mix well. Chill at least 6 hours.", "Shape into a ball and roll in chopped nuts. Serve with Ritz crackers."]}

text:
Marinated Carrots
Cook 2 lb carrots cut into diagonal slices until tender, drain, and cool. Toss with 1 large onion sliced into rings. In a saucepan, combine 1 can (10 oz) undiluted tomato soup with 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup salad oil, 3/4 cup vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper, then bring to a boil just until the sugar dissolves. Pour the hot marinade over the carrots and onions, mix well, cover, and refrigerate overnight.
json: {"title": "Marinated Carrots", "ingredients": ["2 lb. carrots, cut in diagonal slices", "1 large onion, sliced in rings", "1 (10 oz.) can tomato soup, undiluted", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/2 tsp. pepper", "1 c. sugar", "1/2 c. salad oil", "3/4 c. vinegar"], "directions": ["Wash and scrape carrots. Cut in diagonal slices. Cook and drain. Cool. Combine carrots with raw onion rings in a bowl. Combine tomato soup, sugar, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper in saucepan.", "Bring to boiling point; stir to dissolve sugar.", "Pour hot mixture over vegetables and mix together.", "Cover and chill in refrigerator overnight."]}

text:
Blueberry Cake
Beat 4 egg whites until stiff, then gradually add 1 cup of the 2 cups sugar and set aside. Cream 1 cup shortening with 1 teaspoon salt, the remaining 1 cup sugar, and 2 teaspoons vanilla, then beat in 4 egg yolks until creamy. Add 2 teaspoons baking powder, 3 cups flour, and 2/3 cup milk alternately, mixing until smooth. Fold in the egg white mixture, then gently fold in 3 cups floured blueberries. Pour into a well-greased and floured 9x13-inch pan, sprinkle a little sugar over the top if desired, and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for about 50 minutes.
json: {"title": "Blueberry Cake", "ingredients": ["4 eggs, separated", "2 c. sugar", "1 c. shortening", "1 tsp. salt", "2 tsp. baking powder", "2 tsp. vanilla", "3 c. flour", "2/3 c. milk", "3 c. floured blueberries"], "directions": ["Beat egg whites until stiff; add 1 cup sugar.", "Set aside. Cream the shortening, salt, rest of sugar and vanilla.", "Add egg yolks.", "Beat until creamy.", "Add baking powder, milk and flour to mixture alternately.", "Fold in egg whites, then blueberries.", "Pour into a well-greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Sugar the top. Bake at 350° for 50 minutes."]}

text:
Summer Squash Casserole
Cook 6 cups sliced yellow squash with 1 cup finely chopped onion using a little water or steaming, then drain well. Mix 1 can cream of chicken soup (undiluted) with 8 oz sour cream and stir into the squash mixture. Melt 1 stick butter and combine with 1 package (8 oz) stuffing mix. Spread a layer of stuffing in the bottom of a 6x10-inch baking dish, add a layer of squash mixture, then alternate layers, ending with stuffing on top. Bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for 20 to 25 minutes until hot and lightly crisp on top.
json: {"title": "Summer Squash Casserole", "ingredients": ["6 c. sliced yellow squash", "1 c. finely chopped onion", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "8 oz. sour cream", "8 oz. pkg. stuffing mix", "1 stick butter"], "directions": ["Cook squash and onion (in pot with just enough water to coat bottom or steam them),", "drain and set aside. Mix the soup (do not add water) with the sour cream; combine with", "squash and onion. Melt butter and combine with stuffing. Put layer of stuffing along bottom of 6 X 10 inch baking dish. Alternate layers of squash and stuffing ending with stuffing. Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes."]}

text:
Skor Cake
Bake 1 box German chocolate cake mix according to package directions in a 9x13-inch pan. As soon as the cake comes out of the oven, poke holes all over the surface and pour 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk and 1 jar Smucker’s caramel sauce evenly over the cake. Let cool completely, then spread 1 container Cool Whip over the top. Crush 6 Skor candy bars and sprinkle them over the frosting, then refrigerate.
json: {"title": "Skor Cake", "ingredients": ["1 box German chocolate cake mix", "1 can Eagle Brand condensed milk", "1 jar Smucker's caramel sauce", "1 container Cool Whip", "6 Skor candy bars"], "directions": ["Make cake according to directions on box and bake in 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Immediately after removing from oven, poke holes all over cake and pour Eagle Brand milk and caramel sauce over top of cake.", "Allow cake to completely cool and then ice with Cool Whip. Crush Skor candy bars and sprinkle over cake.", "Keep refrigerated."]}

text:
Never Fail Pie Crust (Double Crust)
In a bowl, combine 4 cups sifted flour with 1 teaspoon sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cut in 1 1/2 cups shortening using a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In another bowl, beat 1 egg with 1/2 cup ice-cold water, then stir in 1 tablespoon vinegar. Add the liquid to the flour mixture and mix until the dough comes together. Divide into two portions and roll out on a floured surface for a double-crust pie.
json: {"title": "Never Fail Pie Crust(Double Pie Crust)", "ingredients": ["4 c. sifted flour", "1 1/2 c. shortening", "1 egg", "1/2 c. ice cold water", "1 Tbsp. vinegar", "1 tsp. sugar", "1/2 tsp. salt"], "directions": ["Combine flour, sugar and salt.", "Put shortening in a chilled bowl and add flour mixture.", "Blend with pastry blender to a coarse meal.", "Blend egg and ice cold water together, then add vinegar and blend.", "Add to flour mixture and mix well.", "Roll out on floured surface."]}

text:
Best Brownies
Preheat the oven to 350°F (about 175°C) and grease a 9x13-inch pan. Melt 1/4 lb butter (about 1 stick) and pour into a mixing bowl. Beat in 1/2 cup cocoa and 2 cups sugar until smooth, then beat in 4 eggs one at a time and stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla. Add 1 1/2 cups flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1 cup flaked coconut, stirring just until combined. Spread in the pan and bake for about 25 minutes, then cool and cut into bars.
json: {"title": "Best Brownies", "ingredients": ["1/4 lb. butter", "1/2 c. cocoa", "2 c. sugar", "4 eggs", "2 tsp. vanilla", "1 1/2 c. flour", "1/4 tsp. salt", "1 c. flaked coconut"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 350°.", "Melt the butter.", "Pour into mixing bowl.", "Beat in cocoa and sugar.", "When mixture is smooth, beat in eggs, one at a time, then add vanilla.", "Stir in flour, salt and coconut.", "Pour in a 9 x 13-inch greased pan.", "Bake for 25 minutes. Let cool in pan and cut into squares.", "Yields about 30 bars."]}

text:
Stuffed Mushroom Caps
Carefully remove stems from 20 to 24 large white mushrooms and hollow out the caps, reserving the stems. Fry the mushroom stems, chop them, and drain. Brown and drain 1 lb sweet sausage, then mix it with the cooked stems, 3/4 cup Mozzarella cheese, and 1/2 cup seasoned bread crumbs. Fill each mushroom cap with the mixture, place in a shallow baking dish, add a little wine (amount not specified—just enough to lightly moisten the bottom), and bake at 400°F (about 200°C) for 15 to 20 minutes until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.
json: {"title": "Mushroom Caps Stuffed", "ingredients": ["20 to 24 white large mushrooms, cut off stems and hollow out carefully, reserving stems", "1 lb. sweet sausage", "3/4 c. Mozzarella cheese", "1/2 c. seasoned bread crumbs"], "directions": ["Fry and chop stems; drain.", "Fry and drain sausage.", "Mix cheese and bread crumbs and add mushroom stems and cooked sausage.", "Mix all ingredients together.", "Fill hollowed out mushroom caps with mixture.", "Put in shallow baking dish.", "Add a little wine.", "Bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes until cheese is melted.", "Serve immediately."]}

text:
Toffee Brickle
Line the bottom of a lasagna-size pan with unsalted soda crackers in a single layer. In a saucepan, boil 3/4 cup packed brown sugar with 2 sticks butter for about 8 minutes, stirring frequently, then pour the hot toffee evenly over the crackers. Bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for 15 minutes, remove from the oven, and immediately sprinkle 1 bag (12 oz) chocolate chips over the top. Let sit briefly so the chips melt, then spread the chocolate smooth with a knife. Cool completely, crack into pieces, and store airtight.
json: {"title": "Toffee Brickle", "ingredients": ["unsalted soda crackers", "3/4 c. packed brown sugar", "2 sticks butter", "12 oz. bag chocolate chips"], "directions": ["Line bottom of\tlasagne", "size", "pan", "with soda crackers. Boil sugar and", "butter", "about", "8 minutes.", "Pour over crackers. Bake at 350°", "for 15 minutes.", "Remove and sprinkle with chocolate chips. Spread melted chocolate chips with a knife.", "Cool and crack into pieces.", "Store in an airtight container."]}

text:
Stir-Fried Veggies Medley
Cut 2 medium carrots and 2 celery stalks into thin strips, thinly slice 1 medium onion (or 2 small onions), cut 1 medium bunch broccoli into 2 x 1/2-inch pieces, and quarter 1/2 lb mushrooms (halve if small). Heat 1/4 cup salad oil or olive oil in a large skillet over high heat and stir-fry the vegetables quickly for 3 to 4 minutes. Add the mushrooms, 1/4 cup water, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1 level teaspoon sugar, then cover and cook 5 to 6 minutes longer until tender-crisp, stirring occasionally.
json: {"title": "Stir Fried Veggies Medley", "ingredients": ["2 medium carrots", "2 celery stalks", "1 medium or 2 small onions", "1 medium bunch broccoli", "1/2 lb. mushrooms", "1/4 c. salad or olive oil", "1/4 c. water", "1 1/4 tsp. salt", "1/2 tsp. pepper", "1 level tsp. sugar"], "directions": ["Cut carrots and celery into thin strips.", "Thinly slice onions. Cut broccoli into 2 X 1/2 inch pieces. Cut mushrooms into quarters or in half if they are small.", "In five-quart or 12 inch skillet over high heat, in hot oil, cook vegies, stirring quickly and frequently, about 3 or 4 minutes.", "Add mushrooms, water, salt and sugar.\tOther spices may be added.", "Cover and cook 5 to 6 minutes longer until veggies are tender-crisp, stirring occasionally."]}

text:
Bacon and Egg Breakfast Bake
Preheat the oven to 450°F (about 230°C). Spread 4 oz diced fully cooked Canadian bacon or ham in the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate and sprinkle with 1/2 cup finely chopped cheese (Muenster, Cheddar, or Monterey Jack). Beat 4 eggs with 1 1/2 cups skim milk and 1/2 teaspoon pepper, then pour into the dish. Bake for 15 minutes, reduce heat to 350°F (about 175°C), and bake another 10 to 15 minutes until browned and firm in the center. Cool 10 minutes before cutting into wedges.
json: {"title": "Bacon And Egg Breakfast Bake", "ingredients": ["4 oz. fully cooked Canadian bacon or ham, cut into small cubes", "1/2 c. finely chopped Muenster, Cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese", "4 eggs", "1 1/2 c. skim milk", "1/2 tsp. pepper"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 450°.", "Spread bacon in bottom of 9-inch pie plate.", "Sprinkle with cheese.", "Beat eggs with milk and pepper. Pour over cheese.", "Bake for 15 minutes.", "Reduce heat to 350°. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer, until browned and firm in center.", "Place pie plate on wire rack to cool for 10 minutes.", "Cut in wedges.", "Yields 10 servings, 249 calories per serving."]}

text:
Spiced Tea Mix
In a jar or bowl, mix 1 1/4 cups Tang with 1/2 cup sugar, 1/3 cup instant tea, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon cloves, and a dash of salt. To serve, stir 3 to 4 teaspoons of the mix into 1 mug of hot water.
json: {"title": "Spiced Tea", "ingredients": ["1 1/4 c. Tang", "1/2 c. sugar", "1/3 c. instant tea", "1/2 tsp. cinnamon", "1/4 tsp. cloves", "dash of salt"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients.", "Use 3 to 4 teaspoons of mix for mug of hot water."]}

text:
Fruit Pizza (Cookie Dough Base)
Press 1 tube cookie dough into a circular baking pan and bake according to the package directions, then cool completely. Beat 1 package cream cheese with 1/3 cup Marshmallow Fluff until smooth, spread over the cooled cookie crust, and top with sliced blueberries, peaches, kiwi, and strawberries (amounts not specified, so use as much as needed to cover the surface). Chill briefly before slicing.
json: {"title": "Fruit Pizza", "ingredients": ["1 tube cookie dough", "1 pkg. cream cheese", "1/3 c. Marshmallow Fluff", "sliced blueberries, peaches, kiwi and strawberries"], "directions": ["Prepare cookie dough in circular baking pan.", "Bake according to directions; cool."]}

text:
Ham Roll-Ups
Lay 6 thin slices prosciutto ham on a cutting board and cut them into 1/2-inch strips lengthwise without separating the stacked strips. Mix 3 oz soft cream cheese with 1 small finely chopped onion, then spread a thin layer over the ham. Roll tightly into bite-size roll-ups; this makes about 30 pieces.
json: {"title": "Ham Roll-Ups", "ingredients": ["6 thin slices Prosciutto ham", "3 oz. soft cream cheese", "1 small finely chopped onion"], "directions": ["Place ham slices, one on top of the other, on cutting board. Cut 1/2-inch strips lengthwise; do not separate.", "Combine cheese and onion.", "Spread thin layer on top of first slice of ham.", "Roll up first strips of slice and repeat next slice, etc.", "Makes 30 roll-ups."]}

text:
Pineapple Soufflé
Melt 1/4 cup butter in a 9x9-inch baking dish. In a bowl, mix 1 1/2 cups sugar with 1 large can drained pineapple, 3 slices cubed bread, 3 beaten eggs, and 1/4 cup milk, then pour into the dish over the butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon (amount to taste), plus 1 tablespoon sugar, and top with roasted pecans (amount not specified). Bake at 300°F (about 150°C) for about 40 minutes.
json: {"title": "Pineapple Souffle", "ingredients": ["1/4 c. butter", "1 1/2 c. sugar", "1 large can pineapple, drained", "3 slices bread, cubed", "3 eggs, beaten", "1/4 c. milk", "cinnamon", "1 Tbsp. sugar", "roasted pecans"], "directions": ["Melt butter in pan (9 x 9-inch).", "Mix together the next 5 ingredients and pour into baking dish with melted butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon, 1 tablespoon sugar and roasted pecans. Bake at 300° for 40 minutes."]}

text:
Real Whipped Cream That Keeps
Soften 1/2 teaspoon unflavored gelatin in 4 teaspoons cold water in a small heatproof bowl. Set the bowl in a saucepan of hot water until the gelatin dissolves, then remove and let cool for 1 minute. Whip 1 cup heavy cream with a pinch of salt until almost stiff, then add the dissolved gelatin, 1/2 teaspoon real vanilla, and 1 teaspoon sugar. Continue whipping until stiff; this makes about 2 1/2 cups.
json: {"title": "Real Whipped Cream That Keeps", "ingredients": ["1/2 tsp. unflavored gelatin", "4 tsp. cold water", "1 c. heavy cream", "pinch of salt", "1/2 tsp. real vanilla", "1 tsp. sugar"], "directions": ["In small ovenproof bowl, spread gelatin over water. Set bowl in a saucepan of hot water. Let stand until gelatin dissolves. Remove from saucepan. Let cool 1 minute. Whip cream until almost stiff. Add gelatin, salt and vanilla. Continue to whip until stiff. Makes 2 1/2 cups."]}

text:
Montana Mud Cake
Cream 2 sticks margarine with 2 cups sugar and 2 tablespoons cocoa until smooth. Beat in 4 eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla, then stir in 1 1/2 cups flour, 1 1/3 cups coconut, and 1 cup chopped pecans. Pour into a greased and floured 9x12-inch pan and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for about 30 minutes. While still warm, spread a jar of marshmallow cream over the cake and finish with frosting if desired.
json: {"title": "Montana Mud Cake", "ingredients": ["2 sticks margarine", "2 c. sugar", "2 Tbsp. cocoa", "4 eggs", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 1/2 c. flour", "1 1/3 c. coconut", "1 c. chopped pecans"], "directions": ["Cream first 3 ingredients.", "Add eggs and vanilla.", "Add flour, then add coconut and pecans.", "Mix well.", "Bake in floured and greased 9 x 12-inch pan in 350° oven for 30 minutes.", "Pour a jar of marshmallow cream over cake and top with frosting."]}

text:
Egg Drop Soup
Heat 2 tablespoons peanut oil in a large pot over medium heat and cook 1 cup chopped onion with 1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic and 1 teaspoon minced ginger root for 2 minutes. Add 1 lb lean pork cut into strips and cook until no longer pink. Pour in 7 cups chicken broth, add 2 tablespoons soy sauce and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and bring to a boil. Add 1 cup thinly sliced carrots and simmer 15 minutes, then add 1 can (8 oz) bamboo shoots (drained), 1 can (8 oz) sliced water chestnuts (drained), and 6 oz frozen pea pods. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon sesame oil, reduce heat to low, and slowly drizzle in 2 well-beaten eggs while stirring with a fork to create strands.
json: {"title": "Egg Drop Soup", "ingredients": ["2 Tbsp. peanut oil", "1 c. chopped onion", "1 1/2 tsp. minced garlic", "7 c. chicken broth", "2 Tbsp. soy sauce", "1/4 tsp. pepper", "1 c. thinly sliced carrots", "1 tsp. minced ginger root", "1 lb. lean pork, cut in strips", "1 (8 oz.) can bamboo shoots, drained", "1 (8 oz.) can sliced water chestnuts, drained", "6 oz. frozen pea pods", "1/4 tsp. sesame oil", "2 eggs, well beaten"], "directions": ["In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, ginger and pork; cook and stir until tender. Stir in broth, soy sauce, pepper and sesame oil; bring to a boil. Add carrots; simmer 15 minutes.", "Add all remaining ingredients except eggs; bring to a boil.", "Reduce heat to low.", "Stir in eggs with a fork to separate into strands."]}

text:
Summer Berry Sauce
In a bowl, stir together 3/4 cup thawed frozen raspberry (or raspberry blend) juice concentrate with 2 tablespoons honey. Add 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries, 1 cup blueberries (fresh or partially thawed), and 1 cup raspberries (fresh or partially thawed), then toss gently. Chill before serving; this makes about 3 cups.
json: {"title": "Summer Berry Sauce", "ingredients": ["3/4 c. frozen raspberry or raspberry blend juice concentrate, thawed", "2 Tbsp. honey", "1 c. sliced fresh strawberries", "1 c. fresh or frozen blueberries, partially thawed", "1 c. fresh or frozen raspberries, partially thawed"], "directions": ["In a large bowl, combine juice concentrate and honey.", "Add fruit. Toss gently to combine.", "Store in refrigerator.", "Makes 3 cups."]}

text:
Cherry Pie (No-Bake Style)
Let 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese come close to room temperature. Blend the cream cheese with 1 can condensed milk, 1/3 cup lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon vanilla until smooth, then pour into a 9-inch graham cracker crust. Chill for about 2 hours, spread 1 can cherry pie filling on top, then chill another hour before serving.
json: {"title": "Cherry Pie", "ingredients": ["9-inch graham cracker crust", "1 can condensed milk", "1/3 c. lemon juice", "1 can cherry pie filling", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Cream cheese should be close to room temperature.", "Blend milk, lemon juice and vanilla with cream cheese and pour into pie crust. Chill about 2 hours.", "Then pour cherry pie filling on top.", "Chill one more hour.", "Keep refrigerated."]}

text:
Baked Bean Casserole
In a large bowl, combine 1 large can pork and beans, 1 regular can red kidney beans, and 1 can small green lima beans. Stir in 3 medium sliced onions, 4 tablespoons bacon drippings, 1/2 cup catsup, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup vinegar, 1 teaspoon dry mustard, 3 tablespoons garlic salt, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Pour into a 2-quart casserole and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for 1 3/4 hours.
json: {"title": "Baked Bean Casserole", "ingredients": ["4 Tbsp. bacon drippings", "3 Tbsp. garlic salt", "3 medium onions, sliced", "1 large can pork and beans", "1 regular can red kidney beans", "1 can small green lima beans", "1/2 c. catsup", "1 tsp. dry mustard", "1/2 tsp. black pepper", "1 tsp. salt", "1/2 c. brown sugar", "1/4 c. vinegar"], "directions": ["Cook at 350° for 1 3/4 hours in a 2-quart casserole."]}

text:
Pumpkin Bread
Mix 2 cups canned pumpkin with 1 cup salad oil and 3 cups sugar, then beat in 4 beaten eggs. Add 3 1/4 cups flour, 2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon cloves, and 1 teaspoon nutmeg, and mix until smooth. Divide into 2 greased loaf pans and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for at least 1 1/4 hours, until a tester comes out clean.
json: {"title": "Pumpkin Bread", "ingredients": ["2 c. canned pumpkin", "1 c. salad oil", "3 c. sugar", "3 1/4 c. flour", "4 eggs, beaten", "2 tsp. salt", "1 tsp. baking powder", "1 tsp. baking soda", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 tsp. cloves", "1 tsp. nutmeg"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.", "Pour into 2 greased loaf pans.", "Bake at 350° for at least 1 1/4 hours.", "Makes 2 loaves."]}

text:
Fried Rice
Cook 1/4 cup chopped onions and 2 tablespoons chopped green pepper in 2 tablespoons salad oil until the onion is tender. Add 2 cups cooked rice, 3 oz sliced mushrooms, and 2 tablespoons soy sauce, then cook over low heat for about 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in 3 beaten eggs and cook 2 to 3 minutes longer until the eggs are set throughout.
json: {"title": "Fried Rice", "ingredients": ["1/4 c. onions, chopped", "2 Tbsp. green pepper, chopped", "2 Tbsp. salad oil", "2 c. cooked rice", "3 oz. sliced mushrooms", "2 Tbsp. soy sauce", "3 eggs, beaten"], "directions": ["Cook and stir", "onions", "and", "green", "pepper", "in oil until onion is tender.\tStir in rice, mushrooms and soy sauce.\tCook over low heat", "for", "10", "minutes,", "stirring frequently, stir in beaten eggs. Cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes longer."]}

text:
Paw Paw’s Pancakes
Beat 2 eggs, then mix in 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar. Add 1 1/2 cups self-rising flour and 1 cup milk and beat until smooth. Stir in 3 to 4 tablespoons melted oleo (margarine) and add vanilla to taste. Pour batter onto a preheated skillet or griddle and cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
json: {"title": "Paw Paw'S Pancakes", "ingredients": ["2 eggs", "1 1/2 Tbsp. sugar", "1 1/2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. milk", "3 to 4 Tbsp. oleo, melted", "vanilla to taste"], "directions": ["Beat eggs.", "Add sugar and mix well.", "Stir in flour and milk. Beat until smooth.", "Add melted oleo and stir thoroughly.", "Add vanilla.", "Pour onto preheated skillet or griddle.", "Turn when bubbles appear."]}

text:
Speedy White Clam Sauce
Drain 1 can minced clams, reserving the liquid if you want extra clam flavor. Heat 1/2 cup olive oil in a skillet and lightly brown 2 minced garlic cloves. Add 1 tablespoon minced parsley, the clams, and salt and pepper to taste, then heat for about 2 minutes. Serve over cooked spaghetti.
json: {"title": "Speedy White Clam Sauce", "ingredients": ["1 can minced clams", "2 cloves garlic, minced", "1/2 c. olive oil", "1 Tbsp. minced parsley", "salt and pepper"], "directions": ["Drain clams.", "Heat olive oil in skillet.", "Add garlic; brown lightly.", "Add parsley and seasoning.", "Heat 2 minutes.", "Serve over cooked spaghetti."]}

text: Pineapple Cranberry Pie Filling Cook 3 cups cranberries with 1 1/2 cups crushed pineapple until the cranberries burst. Mix 1 1/4 cups sugar with 1 tablespoon flour, 3/4 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then stir into the fruit and cook until thickened. Cool slightly, pour into a 9-inch unbaked pie shell, and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for about 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Pineapple Cranberry Pie", "ingredients": ["3 c. cranberries", "1 1/2 c. crushed pineapple", "1 1/4 c. sugar", "1 Tbsp. flour", "3/4 tsp. cinnamon", "1/2 tsp. nutmeg", "1/4 tsp. salt"], "directions": ["Cook fruit until cranberries burst.", "Cranberries on bottom. Blend dry ingredients and stir into fruit.", "Cook until thickened. Cool slightly and pour into 9-inch uncooked pie shell and bake at 350°", "for 30 minutes."]}

text:
Strawberry Yum-Yum
Melt 1 stick margarine and stir in 2 cups graham cracker crumbs. Press half of the crumb mixture into the bottom of a baking dish. Prepare 2 packages Dream Whip according to package directions, then beat it with 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese, 1 cup sugar, and 1 cup cold milk until smooth. Spread half the cream mixture over the crumbs, layer on 2 cups strawberries, then spread the remaining cream mixture over the strawberries. Top with the remaining crumbs and chill at least 3 hours before serving.
json: {"title": "Strawberry Yum-Yum", "ingredients": ["1 stick margarine", "2 c. graham cracker crumbs", "2 pkg. Dream Whip", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 c. sugar", "1 c. cold milk", "2 c. strawberries"], "directions": ["Melt margarine and stir in crumbs.", "Place half of mixture in bottom of baking dish.", "Whip Dream Whip and cream cheese with sugar and cold milk.", "Pour half of the Dream Whip mixture on crumbs.", "Spread strawberries on creamed mixture.", "Spread remainder of creamed mixture on top of strawberries.", "Sprinkle remainder of crumbs on top.", "Chill 3 hours or longer."]}

text:
Blueberry Cream Pie
Beat 1 cup sour cream with 2 tablespoons flour, 3/4 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1 beaten egg for about 5 minutes until smooth. Fold in 2 1/2 cups fresh blueberries, then pour into 1 unbaked 9-inch pastry shell. For the topping, cut together 3 tablespoons flour with 3 tablespoons softened butter and 3 tablespoons chopped black walnuts, then sprinkle over the pie. Bake at 400°F (about 200°C) for about 25 minutes.
json: {"title": "Blueberry Cream Pie", "ingredients": ["1 c. commerical sour cream", "2 Tbsp. all-purpose flour", "3/4 c. sugar", "1 tsp. vanilla extract", "3/4 tsp. salt", "1 egg, beaten", "2 1/2 c. fresh blueberries", "1 unbaked 9-inch pastry shell", "3 Tbsp. all-purpose flour", "3 Tbsp. butter, softened", "3 Tbsp. chopped black walnuts"], "directions": ["Combine first 6 ingredients; beat 5 minutes at medium speed of an electric mixer or until smooth.", "Fold in blueberries.", "Pour filling into pastry shell.", "Bake at 400° for 25 minutes."]}

text:
Western Style Barbecue
Brown 4 frankfurters cut into 1-inch pieces in 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan. Add 1 can (19 1/4 oz) Campbell’s chunky old fashioned beans with ham soup, 1 can (12 oz) whole kernel golden corn with sweet peppers (drained), 1 can (8 oz) lima beans (drained), and 1/2 cup barbecue sauce. Heat through, stirring occasionally, and garnish with green pepper rings if desired; this makes about 5 cups.
json: {"title": "Western Style Barbecue", "ingredients": ["4 frankfurters, cut in 1-inch pieces", "2 Tbsp. butter", "1 (19 1/4 oz.) can Campbell's chunky old fashioned beans with ham soup", "1 (12 oz.) can whole kernel golden corn with sweet peppers, drained", "1 (8 oz.) can lima beans, drained", "1/2 c. barbecue sauce"], "directions": ["In saucepan, brown frankfurters in butter.", "Add remaining ingredients.", "Heat; stir occasionally.", "Garnish with green pepper rings.", "Makes about 5 cups."]}

text:
Lemon Jell-O Cheese Cake
Dissolve 1 package lemon Jell-O in 1 cup boiling water, then stir in 3 tablespoons lemon juice and cool slightly. In another bowl, beat 1 package (8 oz) cream cheese with 1 cup sugar, 1 small can drained crushed pineapple, and 2 teaspoons vanilla. Whip 1 large can Milnot until stiff. Crush 2 packages graham crackers and mix with 1/2 cup oleo (1 stick melted) and press half into the bottom of a pan. Combine the cream cheese mixture with the Jell-O mixture, fold in the whipped Milnot, and pour over the crust. Top with the remaining graham cracker crumbs and chill several hours.
json: {"title": "Cheese Cake", "ingredients": ["1 pkg. lemon Jell-O", "1 c. boiling water", "3 Tbsp. lemon juice", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 c. sugar", "1 small can drained, crushed pineapple", "2 tsp. vanilla", "1 large can Milnot", "2 pkg. graham crackers", "1/2 c. oleo (1 stick)"], "directions": ["Mix first 3 ingredients.", "Mix next 4 ingredients.", "Whip Milnot until stiff.", "Roll graham crackers and mix with 1 stick of oleo. Press crackers (half) into bottom of pan.", "Combine the cream cheese mixture into the Jell-O mixture and fold in the Milnot. Put on top of graham crackers.", "Add remaining crackers on top. Chill several hours."]}

text:
Angel Food Cake
Sift together 1 cup sifted cake flour and 1 1/2 cups sugar four times. Beat 1 1/2 cups egg whites (about 12 whites) until foamy, add 1 1/2 teaspoons cream of tartar and 3/4 teaspoon salt, and beat until soft peaks form. Gradually add the remaining sugar, then add 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 teaspoon almond flavoring. Fold in the flour mixture gently. Pour into an ungreased angel food cake pan and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) until it springs back lightly when touched, about 35 to 45 minutes, then cool upside down.
json: {"title": "Angel Food Cake", "ingredients": ["1 cup sifted cake flour", "1 1/2 cups sugar", "1 1/2 cups egg white (about a dozen)", "1 1/2 tsp. cream of tartar", "3/4 tsp. salt", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1/2 tsp. almond flavoring"], "directions": ["Sift of sugar with flour 4 times.", "Beat whites to a foam.", "Add cream of tartar and salt and beat till it holds up peaks.", "Add remaining sugar and flavoring.", "Fold in flour."]}

text:
Plum Nutty Cake
Mix 2 cups self-rising flour with 2 cups sugar, then stir in 1 cup oil, 2 jars strained plum baby food, 3 eggs, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon allspice, and 1 cup pecans broken into small pieces. Pour into a greased pan and bake at 300°F (about 150°C) for about 1 hour, or until done.
json: {"title": "Plum Nutty Cake", "ingredients": ["2 c. self-rising flour", "2 c. sugar", "1 c. oil", "2 jars strained plum baby food", "3 eggs", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 tsp. allspice", "1 c. pecans, broken into small pieces"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients together.", "When fluffy, cook at 300° for 1 hour or until done."]}

text:
Pinto Bean Pie
Mix 3 cups sugar with 2 sticks melted margarine, then stir in 1 cup mashed pinto beans, 4 beaten eggs, and 1 tablespoon vanilla. Pour into 3 unbaked pie shells and bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for about 35 minutes.
json: {"title": "Pinto Bean Pie", "ingredients": ["3 c. sugar", "2 sticks margarine, melted", "1 c. pinto beans, mashed", "4 beaten eggs", "1 Tbsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients; pour into 3 unbaked pie shells.", "Bake at 350° for 35 minutes."]}

text:
Speedy Little Devils
Combine 1 devil’s food cake mix with 1 stick melted oleo (margarine) until crumbly. Reserve 1 1/4 cups of crumbs for topping, then press the rest into an ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Spread 3/4 cup peanut butter mixed with 1 jar (7 oz) marshmallow cream evenly over the base, then crumble the reserved cake mixture over the top. Bake at 350°F (about 175°C) for about 20 minutes, cool completely, and cut into bars (about 3 dozen).
json: {"title": "Speedy Little Devils", "ingredients": ["1 devil's food cake mix", "3/4 c. peanut butter", "1 stick oleo, melted", "1 (7 oz.) jar marshmallow cream"], "directions": ["Combine melted butter and dry cake mix.", "Reserve 1 1/4 cups of this for top crust.", "Pat remaining crumb mixture into ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.", "Top that layer with combined peanut butter and marshmallow cream.", "Spread evenly.", "Crumble remaining cake mixture over that.", "Bake 20 minutes at 350°.", "Cool; cut into bars.", "Makes 3 dozen."]}

text:
Martha Washington Candy
Mix 1 box confectioners sugar with 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk and 1 teaspoon vanilla, then stir in 7 oz coconut until thick and add pecans as desired. Chill or freeze the mixture for 2 to 3 hours until very firm, then roll into balls, dusting and rolling with the second box of confectioners sugar. For the coating, melt 1/2 to 3/4 block paraffin with 1 box Baker’s semi-sweet chocolate, then dip the candy balls and let set.
json: {"title": "Martha Washington Candy", "ingredients": ["2 boxes confectioners sugar", "1 can Eagle Brand milk", "1 tsp. vanilla", "7 oz. coconut (not frozen)", "pecans", "1 box Baker's semi-sweet chocolate", "paraffin"], "directions": ["Mix together 1 box confectioners sugar, Eagle Brand milk and vanilla, then thicken with coconut and then add as many pecans as desired.", "Mix well.", "Put in freezer for 2 to 3 hours or until extremely stiff, then roll in balls, using the other box of confectioners sugar to roll in.", "Set aside.", "Melt 1/2 to 3/4 of a block of paraffin and 1 box of Baker's semi-sweet chocolate."]}

text:
24 Hour Salad
In a large bowl, layer 1 head lettuce (chopped), 1 cup chopped celery, 1 cup cauliflower pieces, 1 cup frozen peas, and 1 cup chopped onion. Sprinkle 1/2 cup bacon bits over the top. Mix 2 cups mayonnaise with 3 tablespoons sugar and spread it evenly over the salad, sealing the surface so it stays fresh. Cover and refrigerate overnight, then sprinkle 1 package shredded Swiss cheese on top just before serving.
json: {"title": "24 Hour Salad", "ingredients": ["1 head lettuce", "1 c. chopped onion", "1/2 c. bacon bits", "2 c. mayonnaise", "1 pkg. shredded Swiss cheese", "1 c. cauliflower (in pieces)", "1 c. chopped celery", "1 c. frozen peas", "3 Tbsp. sugar"], "directions": ["Layer vegetables in large bowl.", "Top with bacon bits.", "Mix mayonnaise and sugar together and pour on top of salad, making sure top is covered completely.", "Cover and place in refrigerator overnight.", "Put shredded cheese on top just before serving."]}

text:
Rocky Road Fudge
Grease an 8x8-inch pan. In a saucepan over low heat, melt 1/2 cup margarine, then stir in 2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa, 1/2 cup light corn syrup, 1 tablespoon water, and 1 teaspoon vanilla until smooth. Remove from heat and gradually beat in 1 lb confectioners sugar until smooth. Stir in 1 cup miniature marshmallows and 1/2 cup chopped nuts, spread into the pan, cover, and refrigerate until firm before cutting.
json: {"title": "Rocky Road Fudge", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. margarine", "2/3 c. unsweetened cocoa", "1/2 c. light corn syrup", "1 Tbsp. water", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 lb. confectioners sugar", "1 c. miniature marshmallows", "1/2 c. chopped nuts"], "directions": ["Grease 8 x 8 x 2-inch baking pan.", "In 2-quart saucepan, melt margarine over low heat.", "Stir in cocoa, corn syrup, water and vanilla until well blended.", "Remove from heat.", "Gradually stir in confectioners sugar until well blended and smooth.", "Stir in marshmallows and nuts.", "Turn into prepared pan.", "Cover and refrigerate until firm.", "Cut into squares.", "Makes about 1 3/4 pounds."]}

text:
Ice Cream
Beat 2 eggs with 2 cups sugar, 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk, 1/2 pint cream, 2 teaspoons vanilla, and a pinch of salt using an electric mixer. Stir in 2 quarts milk, pour into an ice cream freezer, and freeze according to your machine’s directions (the original recipe simply says “put in freezer,” but an ice-cream maker gives the intended result).
json: {"title": "Ice Cream", "ingredients": ["2 eggs", "2 c sugar", "1 can Eagle brand milk", "1/2 pt cream", "2 tsp vanilla", "pinch of salt", "2 qts milk"], "directions": ["Beat with electric mixer.", "Put in freezer."]}

text:
No-Bake Persimmon Pudding
Mix 1 cup persimmon pulp with 1 cup powdered sugar, then stir in 1/2 cup chopped peanuts and 1/2 cup miniature marshmallows. Add 2 cups graham cracker crumbs and mix until the mixture holds together. Shape into a roll, adding more crumbs if needed, then chill thoroughly and serve sliced with whipped cream.
json: {"title": "No Bake Persimmon Pudding", "ingredients": ["1 c. persimmon pulp", "1 c. powdered sugar", "2 c. graham cracker crumbs", "1/2 c. peanuts, chopped", "1/2 c. miniature marshmallows", "whipped cream"], "directions": ["Mix pulp, sugar, peanuts and marshmallows.", "Add graham cracker crumbs.", "Shape into roll, adding more crumbs, if needed, to retain shape.", "Chill thoroughly.", "Serve with whipped cream."]}

text:
Fruitcake Cookies
Cream 1 cup light brown sugar (the ingredient list does not specify butter, but the directions say “cream butter and sugar,” so use about 1/2 cup softened butter) until fluffy, then beat in 3 eggs. Mix in 3 cups self-rising flour, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and 1/2 cup milk, then fold in 2 lb candied fruit (or use 6 slices candied pineapple plus 2 cups candied cherries) and 3 to 4 cups pecans. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet and bake at 300°F (about 150°C) for 20 to 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Fruitcake Cookies", "ingredients": ["1 c. light brown sugar", "3 eggs", "3 c. self rising flour", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1/2 c. milk", "2 lbs candied fruit or 6 slices of candied pineapple and 2 cups of candied cherries", "3 to 4 c. of pecans"], "directions": ["Cream butter and sugar.", "Add eggs.", "Add other ingredients and mix well.", "Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet.", "Bake at 300 for 20 to 30 minutes."]}

text: Chicken And Tortilla Casserole Boil 1 medium chicken until cooked, remove bones and cut meat into pieces. Add 1 large chopped onion and 1 large chopped green pepper. Mix together 1 can mushroom soup, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 can tomatoes and green chilies, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt. Dip 12 soft tortillas in chicken broth and place in a buttered 9 x 12-inch baking dish. Layer tortillas, half the chicken, half the soup mixture and half of 1 pound grated Cheddar cheese. Repeat layers and bake at 350°F for 30 to 40 minutes until cheese is melted.
json: {"title": "Chicken And Tortilla Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 medium chicken", "1 can (12) soft tortillas", "1 large chopped onion", "1 large chopped green pepper", "1 can mushroom soup", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 can tomatoes and green chilies", "1/2 tsp. chili powder", "1/2 tsp. garlic salt", "1 lb. Cheddar cheese, grated"], "directions": ["Boil chicken; bone and cut up meat.", "To the meat, add onion and green pepper.", "Mix soups, tomatoes, chili powder and garlic salt.", "Dip each tortilla in chicken broth, then in a buttered 9 x 12-inch baking dish.", "Place a layer of tortilla, 1/2 the chicken, 1/2 the soup mixture and 1/2 cheese.", "Repeat layers; bake 30 to 40 minutes in 350° oven until cheese melts."]}

text: Fruit Pizza Press 1 tube refrigerated sugar cookie dough evenly onto a 13-inch pizza pan or cookie sheet and bake according to package directions. Cream together 8 ounces softened cream cheese with 1/2 cup powdered sugar and spread over cooled crust. Top with assorted sliced fresh or canned fruit and sprinkle with coconut to make one pizza.
json: {"title": "Fruit Pizza", "ingredients": ["1 tube refrigerator enriched sugar cookie dough", "8 oz. cream cheese, softened", "assorted canned or fresh fruits, sliced", "1/2 c. powdered sugar", "coconut"], "directions": ["Press out cookie dough flat on a 13-inch pizza pan or cookie sheet.", "Bake according to package directions.", "Cream together cream cheese and powdered sugar.", "Spread on cooled crust.", "Top with chopped or sliced fruits and sprinkle with coconut.", "Yields 1 pizza."]}

text: Harvard Beets Melt 2 tablespoons butter or margarine and stir in 2 tablespoons flour. Gradually add 1/4 cup boiling water, cooking and stirring until thickened. Add 1/4 cup vinegar, 1/3 cup brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper and 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves, mixing until sugar dissolves. Add 2 1/2 cups diced cooked beets and cook until thoroughly heated.
json: {"title": "Harvard Beets", "ingredients": ["2 Tbsp. butter or margarine", "2 Tbsp. flour", "1/4 c. boiling water", "1/4 c. vinegar", "1/3 c. brown sugar", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/8 tsp. pepper", "1/8 tsp. ground cloves", "2 1/2 c. diced, cooked beets"], "directions": ["Melt fat and stir in flour.", "Gradually add boiling water and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.", "Add vinegar, sugar and seasonings.", "Mix well until sugar dissolves.", "Add beets and cook until thoroughly heated.", "If canned beets are used, substitute 1/4 cup liquid from the can of beets for the water.", "Makes 6 servings."]}

text: Clam Chowder Dice 6 to 8 slices lean bacon and 1 cup onion and sauté in a soup pot. Add 2 cups diced cooked potatoes, 2 cans minced clams with 1 cup reserved clam juice, 2 cups half-and-half, 1 cup water, 2 tablespoons butter, and salt and pepper to taste. Heat gently without boiling and thicken if desired.

Saute in soup pot. Add remaining ingredients.", "Heat; do not boil.", "May be thickened, if necessary."]}

text: Easy Cranberry Relish In a food processor combine 2 small packages fresh cranberries, 1 cup sugar and 1 whole orange cut into pieces. Process until chopped, transfer to a bowl, stir in chopped walnuts, chill and serve.
json: {"title": "Easy Cranberry Relish", "ingredients": ["2 small pkg. fresh cranberries", "1 c. sugar (or more if you like)", "1 whole orange", "walnuts"], "directions": ["In food processor, mix cranberries, sugar and whole orange (cutting it into 2 to 4 parts seems to work better).", "Mix ingredients in processor until chopped.", "Transfer mixture into a mixing bowl and add chopped walnuts.", "Chill and serve."]}

text: Banana Omelette Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a skillet and sauté 4 sliced bananas for about 5 minutes, turning frequently, then set aside. Beat 6 egg yolks with 1/2 teaspoon salt, a dash of cayenne pepper and 1/4 cup milk. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold together with yolks. Pour into a buttered 7 x 10-inch casserole, arrange bananas on top and bake at 350°F for 20 minutes until lightly browned. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve.
json: {"title": "Banana Omelette", "ingredients": ["3 Tbsp. Butter", "4 Bananas (sliced)", "6 Eggs (separated)", "1/2 tsp. Salt", "Dash of Cayenne Pepper", "1/4 c. Milk", "2 Tbsp. Chopped Parsley"], "directions": ["Melt the butter in a skillet and saut the bananas about 5 minutes turning them frequently.", "Remove from the pan and set aside.", "Beat the egg yolks with the salt, cayenne pepper and milk.
