text: Banana Bread Mix 1 cup sugar, 2 eggs, 1/2 cup shortening, 3 mashed bananas, vanilla to taste, a pinch of salt, and optional 1/2 cup chopped nuts. Stir in 2 cups flour sifted with 1 tsp. soda and bake at 350°F for about 45 minutes.
json: {"title": "Banana Bread", "ingredients": ["1 c. sugar", "2 eggs", "2 c. flour", "1 tsp. soda", "vanilla to taste", "pinch of salt", "1/2 c. chopped nuts (optional)", "1/2 c. shortening", "3 bananas, mashed"], "directions": ["Sift together the flour and soda.", "Mix all ingredients together and bake at 350° for 45 minutes."]}

text: Mexicali Chicken And Cheese Bake Heat oven to 350°F and grease a 13 x 9-inch dish. Mix 3 cups cooked cubed chicken with 1 cup (of the 2 cups) shredded Monterey Jack, 1 (12 oz.) can drained corn, and 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can condensed cream of chicken soup; spoon into dish. Stir together 1 cup flour, 1/4 cup cornmeal, 1 3/4 tsp. baking powder, chili powder or seasoned salt to taste, 1 1/2 cups milk, 1/2 cup melted margarine, 3 beaten eggs, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chiles, and 2 oz. chopped drained pimento just until moistened (batter will be lumpy); pour over chicken mixture and bake 50 to 60 minutes, sprinkle with remaining cheese (about 1 cup) and return to oven just to melt, then let stand 10 minutes (serves about 8).

text: Ripe Tomato Ketchup Chop 1 gallon chopped cabbage, 1 gallon tomatoes, 6 to 8 onions, and 6 small bell peppers; add 1 quart vinegar, 1 hot pepper, 5 lb. sugar (or to taste), 1 Tbsp. allspice, 1/2 tsp. cinnamon, 1/2 tsp. nutmeg, and 1 Tbsp. salt. Cook about 40 minutes, then can and seal.

text: Fresh Broccoli Salad Cut 2 bunches fresh broccoli into bite-size pieces and combine with 10 cooked crumbled bacon slices, 2/3 cup raisins, 1/2 cup chopped onion, and optional 1/2 cup slivered almonds and/or 1/2 cup sharp cheese. Mix 1 cup Miracle Whip with 1/2 cup sugar and 2 Tbsp. vinegar, toss with broccoli mixture, and refrigerate about 2 hours before serving.

text: Lemon Chicken Heat oven to 400°F. Place 1 whole cut-up chicken in a pan, melt 1 stick butter and mix in juice from 3 large lemons, baste chicken, sprinkle with oregano to taste, and bake about 1 hour at 400°F.

text: Cherry Topsy-Turvy Pudding Cream 2 Tbsp. butter with 1 cup (of the 1 1/4 cups) sugar. Sift 1 cup flour with 1 tsp. baking powder and 1/8 tsp. salt, then add alternately with 3/4 cup milk to the creamed mixture; spread in a greased casserole. Heat 1 1/2 cups canned tart cherries with the remaining 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup reserved cherry juice, pour hot cherry mixture over batter, and bake at 350°F for 35 to 40 minutes (serves about 6).

text: Strawberry Pan Pie Cook 1 cup sugar with 1 cup water and 3 level Tbsp. cornstarch until thick and clear (add red food coloring if desired; amount not specified), cool, stir in 1 pint raw strawberries, and pour into 1 baked 9-inch pie crust.

text: Chicken Casserole Cook 1 large package spinach noodles in broth (amount not specified), then combine with 6 boiled chicken breasts (boned; reserve 1 cup broth), sautéed 1 cup chopped celery plus 1 large chopped green pepper and 1 large chopped onion, 1/2 lb. text: Cream Tacos Brown 1 lb. hamburger with onion (amount not specified). In a pan, layer 1 dozen corn tortillas (cut into quarters), topping each piece with about 1 tsp. meat, about 1 tsp. green chili (amount not specified), about 1 tsp. tomato sauce from 2 small cans, and grated Cheddar cheese (amount not specified); repeat layers, pour 1 can evaporated milk over all, cover with foil, and bake at 350°F for 30 to 35 minutes until milk has mostly evaporated.

text: Scottish Shortbread Let 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter come to room temperature. Grease an 8 x 8-inch metal pan; sift 2 cups all-purpose flour with 1/4 cup sugar and a pinch of salt, rub in the butter with fingers, knead gently into a soft dough, press evenly into pan, prick with a fork, bake at 325°F for 30 to 35 minutes until pale golden, cool slightly, sprinkle with a little granulated sugar (amount not specified), cut into fingers, and cool completely before storing airtight.

text: Slaw Whisk 1/3 cup sugar, 3/4 tsp. salt, 3/4 tsp. pepper, 1 Tbsp. celery seed, 1 Tbsp. prepared mustard, and 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar; slowly stir in 1 cup mayonnaise. text: Hot Cheese Balls With ingredients at room temperature, mix 1/2 lb. shredded Cheddar with 1 stick oleo, then add 1 cup flour, 1/4 tsp. paprika, 1/4 tsp. salt, and optional dash cayenne; roll into 1-inch balls and bake at 400°F for 15 to 20 minutes on an ungreased cookie sheet.

text: Pizza Cups Brown 1 lb. ground beef with 1/4 cup minced onion and optional 1/2 tsp. salt; drain. Stir in 8 oz. tomato sauce and 1 tsp. Italian seasoning and cook 5 minutes. Press 2 cans refrigerated biscuits (10-count each) into greased muffin tins, fill with meat mixture, top with 1/2 to 3/4 cup grated cheese, and bake at 400°F for about 12 minutes (makes about 20 cups).

text: All-American Apple Pie Fill a pastry-lined pie plate (pastry for a double crust) with 6 cups thinly sliced cooking apples, optionally tossed with 1 Tbsp. lemon juice. Mix 1 cup sugar with 2 Tbsp. flour, 1 tsp. cinnamon, and a dash nutmeg; toss with apples, mound into crust, dot with 1 Tbsp. butter, cover with top crust, cut slits, seal and flute edges, and optionally sprinkle with sugar (amount not specified).

text: Strawberry Cake With Icing Mix 1 box Duncan Hines Strawberry Supreme cake mix with juice from 1 box frozen strawberries, 4 eggs, 1 cup Crisco, 1/2 cup water, and 1 (3 oz.) box strawberry gelatin; beat well and bake in layers or a long pan until done (time depends on pan size; not specified).

text: Swedish Meat Balls Combine 1 1/2 lb. ground beef with 1 box garlic-and-onion croutons, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 2 eggs, and salt and pepper to taste; form balls and brown. Mix 1 (10 oz.) jar grape jelly with 1 (10 oz.) bottle chili sauce, pour over meatballs, and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes (or simmer on stovetop about 20 minutes).

text: Calf Liver Braised In Wine Dredge 1 lb. thin-sliced calf liver in 1/4 cup flour mixed with 1/2 tsp. salt and 1/8 tsp. pepper. Sauté 1/2 cup chopped onion in 3 Tbsp. butter until tender, add liver and brown lightly. Dissolve 1 bouillon cube in 1/2 cup boiling water, add 1 cup sliced mushrooms, the bouillon, 1/2 cup dry red wine, and 1/4 tsp. basil; cover and simmer about 15 minutes until liver is tender (serves about 4).

text: Sour Cream Pound Cake Cream 1 cup oleo with 3 cups sugar, blend in 1 cup sour cream, add 5 eggs in stages (3 then 2), then alternately add 3 cups flour mixed with 1/2 tsp. baking powder, 1/4 tsp. baking soda, and 1/4 tsp. salt with 1/2 cup milk stirred with 2 tsp. vanilla, blending after each addition without overbeating; bake time/temperature not specified in the data.

text: Baked Beans Mix 4 (15 oz.) cans Great Northern beans with 3/4 lb. cooked bacon pieces, 3/4 to 1 cup ketchup, and 1 cup white sugar; bake in a casserole at 325°F for 1 hour.

text: Vanilla Ice Cream In a large bowl, mix 6 eggs, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1 can evaporated milk, 1 Tbsp. milk, and vanilla (amount not specified in the data); add enough additional milk (amount not specified) to fill an ice-cream freezer about 3/4 full, then freeze according to your machine’s directions.

text: Sparkle Cutout Cookies Cream 1 (8 oz.) softened cream cheese with 1 cup margarine, 2/3 cup sugar, and 1/2 tsp. vanilla; add 2 1/2 cups flour and a dash of salt, mix well, chill, roll to 1/4-inch thick, cut shapes, place on ungreased sheets, decorate with colored sugar or icing (amounts not specified), and bake at 375°F for 8 to 10 minutes until edges just start to brown.

text: Taco Soup Put 2 lb. browned hamburger meat and 1 chopped medium onion in a crock-pot with 1 packet dry Ranch dressing mix, 1 packet taco seasoning, 1 can whole-kernel corn, 1 can red kidney beans, 1 can pinto beans, 1 small can chopped chiles, and 3 cans stewed tomatoes; cook all day on low (or simmer on stovetop 2 to 3 hours).

text: Fruit Cocktail Cake Mix 1 can (No. 303) fruit cocktail with juice, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 2 eggs, 1 tsp. vanilla, 2 tsp. soda, 1 tsp. cinnamon, and 2 cups flour all at once and beat 3 minutes. text: Fa-La-La-La-Las Cream 1 cup butter-flavor Crisco with 1/2 cup sugar; beat in 1 egg, 3/4 tsp. salt, 3/4 tsp. vanilla, and 1/2 tsp. almond extract. text: Orange-Coconut Pie Cream 1/4 cup softened butter with 1 cup sugar, beat in 3 beaten eggs, then stir in 1/2 cup orange juice, 1 tsp. lemon extract, a dash of salt, and 1 cup flaked coconut. text: Sour Cream Pound Cake Cream 2 sticks real butter with 3 cups sugar, beat in 6 eggs one at a time, add 3 cups flour mixed with 1/4 tsp. baking soda, beat well, then blend in 1/2 pint sour cream and 1 tsp. vanilla. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan and bake at 325°F for about 1 hour or a bit longer.

text: Company Chicken Mix 1 cup instant rice with 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 can cream of chicken soup, and 1 can cream of celery soup; place 4 chicken breasts on top, add a pat of butter to each (amount not specified) and season to taste, then bake at 375°F for 1 hour.

text: Minestrone Soup Sauté 1 cup thinly sliced carrots, 1 cup sliced celery, 1/2 cup chopped onions, and 1 minced garlic clove in 2 Tbsp. margarine. Add 2 cans (15 oz. each) Chef Boyardee Beefogetti, 1 drained can chickpeas, 2 cups water, 2 beef bouillon cubes, 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. crushed basil, and 1/4 tsp. pepper; simmer covered about 15 minutes and top servings with Parmesan cheese (amount not specified) (serves about 6).

text: Cherry Topped Cheesecake Heat oven to 300°F. Reserve 1 cup dry cake mix from 1 package yellow cake mix; combine remaining cake mix with 2 Tbsp. oil and 1 egg, press crumb mixture into a 13 x 9-inch pan bottom and slightly up sides. Beat 2 (8 oz.) packages cream cheese with 1/2 cup sugar, then beat in remaining 3 eggs, 1 1/2 cups milk, 3 Tbsp. lemon juice, and 3 Tbsp. vanilla; pour over crust and bake at 300°F until set (time not specified in the provided lines), cool, then top with 1 can cherry pie filling.

text: Sweet ’N’ Sour Sauce Whisk together 1/2 cup vinegar, 1/2 cup sugar, and 1/3 cup oil until well blended; use for bean salad or cucumbers.

text: Easy Taco Dip In a glass pie plate, layer 1 large package cream cheese, 1 can Hormel chili, and 2 cups shredded Cheddar; microwave on High about 5 to 6 minutes and serve with nacho chips.

text: Monkey Bread Separate 2 packages refrigerator rolls, dip each in 1/2 cup melted margarine or butter, then in a mixture of 3/4 cup sugar and 1 tsp. cinnamon. Stack unevenly in a casserole or ring pan, bake at 425°F for 20 to 25 minutes, invert onto a plate, and optionally drizzle with powdered-sugar icing (amount not specified).

text: Coconut Cream Pie Or Lemon Meringue Pie For coconut version, cook a custard using 3 separated eggs (use yolks for filling), 4 Tbsp. cornstarch, 2 cups milk, 2 Tbsp. butter, 1 1/2 cups sugar, and 1 Tbsp. coconut flavoring, then pour into 1 unbaked pie shell and top with meringue made from the egg whites (method details not fully specified in the data). text: Death By Chocolate Bake 1 chocolate cake mix as directed, cool completely, and break into pieces. Beat together 2 packages chocolate instant pudding, 2 envelopes Dream Whip, and 3 cups cold milk; refrigerate 1 hour. Layer cake pieces with 2 (8 oz.) containers Cool Whip and the pudding mixture, and top with 4 crushed Heath bars if desired (assembly details beyond the provided lines are implied by ingredients).

Cool completely; break into small pieces. Mix together Jell-O, Dream Whip and milk; beat well. Refrigerate 1 hour."]}

text: Corn Meal Muffins Sift 1 cup flour and sift with 3/4 tsp. baking soda, 1 tsp. salt, and 1 tsp. baking powder; mix with 1 cup corn meal. Combine 1/4 cup melted bacon fat with 2 Tbsp. brown sugar and 2 well-beaten eggs, add 1 1/2 cups sour milk, then stir into dry ingredients just until smooth. Fill a well-oiled muffin pan 2/3 full and bake at 435°F for 15 to 20 minutes.

text: Hot Taco Rice Brown 1 lb. ground beef with 1 chopped onion; drain. Add 1 1/2 cups salsa, 1 can tomato sauce, and 1 chicken bouillon cube, bring to a boil, then stir in 1 1/2 cups Minute rice, cover, and simmer about 5 minutes.

text: Moist Devil’s Food Cake Beat 1 devil’s food cake mix with 1 can cherry pie filling, 1/4 cup oil, and 3 eggs on medium speed about 3 minutes; bake in a greased and floured tube pan at 350°F for about 40 minutes.

text: Peanut Butter Twinkies Bring 1 cup sugar and 1 cup light Karo syrup to a full boil, remove from heat, stir in 1 cup peanut butter, 1/4 stick oleo, and 1 Tbsp. vanilla. Add 6 to 8 cups cornflakes (enough to press) and press into a well-buttered 13 x 9-inch pan; cut into squares while warm.

text: Low-Calorie Pumpkin Pie Heat oven to 350°F and lightly grease or spray a 9-inch pie pan. Blend 1 (16 oz.) can solid-pack pumpkin, 1 (13 oz.) can evaporated skim milk, 1 egg, 2 egg whites, 1/2 cup biscuit mix, 2 Tbsp. sugar, 6 packets sugar substitute, 2 tsp. pumpkin pie spice, and 2 tsp. vanilla for about 1 minute (or beat 2 minutes). Pour into pan and bake about 50 minutes until center is puffed (about 8 servings).

text: Zucchini Squares Mix 2 cups shredded zucchini with 1/2 cup chopped onion, 1 clove garlic (minced), 1/2 cup grated Parmesan, 1/2 cup oil, 2 Tbsp. dried parsley, 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. seasoned salt, 1/2 tsp. oregano, and 2 slightly beaten eggs; bake in a greased 9 x 13-inch pan at 350°F for about 30 minutes until lightly browned on top.

text: Pound Cake Cream 1 stick butter with 1 cup Crisco and 3 cups sugar, add 6 eggs one at a time, add 3 cups plain flour one cup at a time plus 1/2 tsp. baking powder, then add 1 cup sweet milk in thirds and 1 tsp. vanilla; beat 3 minutes. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan, place in a cold oven, set to 350°F, and bake about 1 hour 15 minutes.

text: Chocolate Eclair Dessert Line a buttered 9 x 13-inch dish with about 10 graham crackers (half of ~20). Beat 2 (4 oz.) packages vanilla instant pudding with 3 1/2 cups milk for 2 minutes, fold in 8 oz. whipped topping, spread half over crackers, add remaining crackers, then remaining pudding mixture, and chill 2 hours. text: Butternut Cookies Cream 2 cups butter with 1 cup sugar and 4 tsp. vanilla until fluffy, add 4 cups flour and 1 tsp. salt, then mix in 4 cups finely chopped walnuts. Shape into 1-inch balls, bake at 325°F for about 20 minutes without browning, cool, and roll in confectioners sugar (amount not specified).

text: Hattie Coffer’s Kool-Aid Punch Make a syrup by heating 1 cup water with 2 cups sugar until dissolved; stir in 1 package Kool-Aid (any flavor), 1/2 cup lemon juice, 2 cups pineapple juice, 1 quart ginger ale, and 10 cups water (makes about 30 cups).

text: Scalloped Corn Heat oven to 350°F. Sauté 1/2 cup chopped onion in 2 Tbsp. butter until golden, blend in 2 Tbsp. flour, 1 tsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. paprika, and a dash black pepper and cook until bubbly. Remove from heat, whisk in 3/4 cup milk, bring to a boil and cook 1 minute stirring constantly, then stir in 1 can whole-kernel corn and 1 slightly beaten egg. Pour into a baking dish, top with breadcrumbs (amount not specified), and bake 30 minutes.

text: Becky’s Punch Mix 1 packet black cherry (or cherry) Kool-Aid with 1 small box same-flavor Jell-O in 2 quarts warm water, then add 1 cup sugar, 1 can frozen lemonade, and 1 can pineapple juice; freeze. Thaw about 1 hour before serving and add 2 liters 7-Up.

text: Chicken Saltimbocca Pound 3 large chicken breasts (skinned, boned, halved lengthwise) into 6 cutlets; top each with 1 thin ham slice and 1 slice process Swiss cheese, add some of 1 chopped medium tomato, and sprinkle lightly with crushed dried sage (amount not specified). Fold sides and roll; mix 1/3 cup fine dry bread crumbs with 2 Tbsp. grated Parmesan and 2 Tbsp. snipped parsley, dip rolls in 1/4 cup melted butter and coat with crumbs, then bake in a shallow pan at 350°F for 40 to 45 minutes (serves about 6).

text: Toll House Cookies (Oatmeal Version) Cream 1 cup shortening with 3/4 cup brown sugar and 3/4 cup white sugar. Add 1 1/2 cups sifted flour, 1 tsp. soda, 2 beaten eggs, 1 tsp. hot water, 1 tsp. vanilla, and 1 tsp. salt; stir in 2 cups oatmeal, 1 cup chopped nuts, and 1 package Toll House chocolate chips (or butterscotch chips). Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet and bake at 350°F for 10 to 15 minutes.

text: Chicken Tortilla Casserole Mix 1 can cream of chicken soup with 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup sour cream, 1 cup picante sauce, and onion to taste; heat until nearly boiling. Grease a 9 x 9-inch pan, break 12 tortillas into pieces and layer half in the pan, add half of 1 cooked boned chicken, pour on half the hot sauce mixture, repeat layers, top with Cheddar cheese (amount not specified), and bake at 350°F for 30 to 40 minutes.

Repeat layers with remaining ingredients and top with cheese. Bake in 350° oven for 30 to 40 minutes."]}

text: Chop Suey Brown 1 to 1 1/2 lb. stew meat and cook until tender (about 2 to 2 1/2 hours). Add 1 can mushrooms and 1 medium onion and cook until onion is done. Add 6 to 8 cups water plus 1 cup soy sauce and 1 large can chop suey vegetables; thicken with cornstarch stirred into a half-water/half-soy mixture (amounts not specified) and serve over rice or noodles.

text: Vegetable Pizza Press 1 (8 oz.) package crescent-roll dough onto a baking sheet (do not separate), bake as package directs until golden, and cool. text: Log Cabin Toast Mix 1/4 cup sugar with 2 tsp. cinnamon. Toast 2 slices bread, spread with soft margarine or butter (amount not specified), sprinkle with cinnamon sugar, cut each slice into 4 strips, and stack like “logs.”

text: Yum Yum Salad Mix 1 can cherry pie filling with 1 large can drained crushed pineapple, 1 can Borden milk (sweetened condensed; amount as “1 can”), 3/4 cup chopped pecans, and 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip; refrigerate overnight.

text: My Caramel Rolls Beat together 3 packages yeast, 1/2 cup sugar, 2 cups warm water, and 2 eggs until light and fluffy; stir in 3 Tbsp. oleo, 1 tsp. salt, and 6 to 7 cups flour, let rise once, and meanwhile prepare caramel (caramel ingredients/amounts not provided in the data).

text: Spanish Hamburger #1 Brown 6 lb. hamburger about halfway, add finely chopped 1 medium white onion, 1/2 green pepper, and 1 stalk celery, simmer 30 minutes, season with salt and pepper to taste, stir in 1 (20 oz.) can tomato soup, cover to keep steam in, and simmer about 2 hours.

text: Turkey Vegetable Stir-Fry Whisk 1 Tbsp. cornstarch with 2 Tbsp. soy sauce, 1/4 tsp. ground ginger, and 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can chicken broth; microwave uncovered 2 to 3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until thickened to make sauce. In a skillet, heat 2 Tbsp. vegetable oil and stir-fry 1 julienned carrot, 2 cups sliced mushrooms, 4 minced green onions, 1 diagonally sliced celery stalk, and 1 (6 oz.) package thawed snow peas until crisp-tender; add 2 cups chopped cooked turkey, pour in sauce, heat through, and serve over 2 cups cooked brown rice topped with 2 Tbsp. toasted slivered almonds.

text: Mango With Tomatoes And Scallions Or Leeks Toss 1 large (or 2 small) sliced mango with 2 medium tomatoes and 1 large leek (or 2 scallions). Whisk lemon juice with pulp (amount not specified) with 2 tsp. safflower oil and a pinch of dry mustard, pour over, toss, and serve chilled or at room temperature.

text: Vegetable Pizza Press and bake 2 cans crescent rolls as a crust (bake time per package; not specified), then spread with a mixture of 2 large packages softened cream cheese, 1/2 cup mayonnaise (not Miracle Whip), and 1/2 cup Ranch dressing; cut and serve (vegetable topping not listed in the provided lines).

text: Luau Brown 2 lb. pork sausage, remove, and cook 1 chopped green pepper, 2 chopped large onions, and 1 chopped bunch celery in as little grease as possible. Bring 7 cups water to a boil, stir in 2 packets Lipton noodle soup, 2 cups white Minute rice, and 3 1/2 oz. chopped almonds, then immediately stir in the sausage and vegetables, cover, and bake at 350°F for 40 to 45 minutes, stirring once or twice (serves about 10–12).

text: Ma’s Dill Pickles Pack cucumbers/dills (amounts not specified) into jars. Boil a brine of 7 cups water, 3 cups vinegar, 1/2 cup salt, and 1/2 cup sugar; pour hot brine over, seal.

text: Stir-Fried Gumbo Toss 3 to 4 cups okra with flour (amount not specified) plus salt and pepper; fry in oil (amount not specified) as needed. In a large skillet, melt 3/4 stick butter and sauté 3/4 cup sliced green bell pepper, 1 chopped small jalapeño (optional), 1 thinly sliced medium onion, and 1 medium carrot (or 3/4 cup thin slices) until onion is clear; add 1 can stewed tomatoes and cook about 5 minutes, stir in 3/4 cup water, bring to a boil, add 2 cups cooked ground beef or chicken breast or ham, and season with salt and pepper to taste.

text: No Bake Chocolate Cookies In a saucepan, stir together 2 cups sugar, 1/3 cup cocoa, 1/2 cup milk, and 1 stick oleo; bring to a boil and boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in 1 tsp. vanilla, 1/2 cup peanut butter, and 3 cups quick oats; drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper and cool (makes about 4 to 5 dozen).

text: Carrot Cake Mix 2 cups sifted flour with 1 tsp. soda, 1 tsp. salt, 2 cups sugar, and 1 tsp. cinnamon. Add 1 1/2 cups oil, 4 eggs, 2 cups grated carrots, and 1 cup nuts, mix well, pour into greased and floured pans, and bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes (makes 2 nine-inch or 3 eight-inch layers).

text: No Fat Rice And Vegetable Dish In a skillet sprayed with vegetable spray (amount not specified), sauté 1/2 cup sliced summer squash and 1/4 cup chopped onions until tender. Add 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms, 1/2 cup chopped fresh tomato, 1 tsp. chopped garlic, 1/2 tsp. basil, and lemon pepper and salt to taste; cook 5 minutes, then toss with 1 cup cooked rice.

text: Oyster Fritters Sift 2 cups flour with 2 tsp. baking powder and 1/2 tsp. baking soda. Beat 3 eggs, add 1/4 cup buttermilk and salt to taste, then stir in dry ingredients plus reserved oyster juice from 1 pint oysters; add oysters, stir to coat, and deep-fry at 350°F until golden.

text: Quick Coffee Cake (Double Recipe) Mix 2 cups flour, 6 tsp. baking powder, 1 tsp. cinnamon, 1 cup sugar, 1 tsp. salt, 2 beaten eggs, 1 cup milk, and 1/2 cup melted oleo or butter; spread in a 13 x 9-inch pan (or two 8-inch pans), sprinkle thickly with sugar and cinnamon (optional chopped nuts; amounts not specified), and bake at 375°F for 15 to 21 minutes.

text: Belly Buttons Prepare 1 box crust mix according to package directions (additional flour as needed; amounts not specified), roll dough out on a floured surface, spread with softened butter or margarine (amount not specified), cover with brown sugar (amount not specified) and cinnamon (amount not specified), roll up like a long thin cinnamon roll, slice into 1-inch pieces, set upright in a buttered 13 x 9-inch dish, and bake at 400°F for about 15 minutes.

text: Tater Tot Casserole Brown 1 lb. ground lean beef with 1 large chopped onion; stir in 1 can cream of mushroom soup and 1 can mixed vegetables (partially drained), spread in a buttered casserole, top with Tater Tots as needed, and bake at 350°F for about 45 minutes.

text: Cheesy Cornbread Cook 4 slices bacon in an 8-inch cast-iron skillet, remove bacon and reserve 2 Tbsp. drippings, then heat skillet with drippings at 425°F for 5 minutes. Stir together crumbled bacon, 1 (16 oz.) cornbread mix, 2 beaten eggs, 1 (15 oz.) can cream-style corn, 3/4 cup mayonnaise, and 1 cup shredded Swiss or Cheddar; pour into hot skillet and bake at 425°F for 30 to 35 minutes until golden.

text: Rice Crispy Chicken Crush 4 cups Rice Krispies to make 2 cups crumbs and mix with 1 tsp. paprika in a shallow dish. Beat 1 egg with 3/4 cup milk; in another dish mix 3/4 cup flour with 1 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. pepper, and 1 tsp. poultry seasoning. text: No-Fat Added Oven Fried Chicken Heat oven to 350°F. Coat a baking sheet with vegetable cooking spray. Mix 1/2 cup dry bread crumbs with 3 Tbsp. grated Parmesan, 1 tsp. dried thyme, 1/4 tsp. garlic powder, 1/4 tsp. onion powder, 1/4 tsp. black pepper, and optional 1/4 tsp. salt. Dip 4 skinless boneless chicken breast halves (about 3 oz. each) in 3/4 cup nonfat buttermilk, coat with crumb mixture, place on sheet, and bake until cooked through (baking time not provided in the given lines).

text: Sauerkraut Salad Toss 1 quart drained sauerkraut with 1 cup chopped green bell pepper, 1 cup chopped celery, 1 (4 oz.) jar pimento, and 1 chopped medium onion. Mix in a dressing of 1/2 cup vinegar, 1 1/2 cups sugar, and 2 Tbsp. oil (directions line is truncated in the data).

text: Sour Cream Meat Loaf Combine 2 lb. ground lean beef with 1 1/2 cups grated raw carrot, 1/4 cup grated unpeeled apple, 1 1/2 cups grated raw potato, 1 onion quartered and studded with 4 cloves, 6 crumbled fried bacon slices, 2 beaten eggs, 2 1/4 tsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. pepper, 1/8 tsp. nutmeg, 1/8 tsp. dry mustard, and 2 cups sour cream. Pack into a 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan and bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours (serves about 6).

text: Stuffed Chicken Breast Heat oven to 375°F. Prepare 1 box Stove Top stuffing as directed; optionally slice 1 medium green pepper into short strips. Mix 1/4 cup hot water with 1 can cream of mushroom soup. text: Meg’s Power Peanut Butter Balls Melt 2 sticks butter or margarine and pour over 1/2 cup graham cracker crumbs, 1 box confectioners sugar, and 1 cup crunchy peanut butter; mix well and form bite-size balls. Melt chocolate chips (amount not specified) with 2 oz. paraffin in a double boiler, dip balls, and set on a greased cookie sheet to harden.

text: Indian Meat Loaf Mix 1 lb. ground beef with 1/2 lb. ground pork, 1 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. pepper, 1/2 tsp. sage, and 1 beaten egg; stir in 1/2 cup corn meal, 1/2 cup chopped onion, 1/4 cup diced green pepper, 1/2 cup cream-style corn, and 1 1/4 cups canned tomatoes. text: Creamy Cheese Crab Dip Mix 1 (8 oz.) package plus 1 (3 oz.) package cream cheese with 1/2 cup white wine and 1/8 tsp. garlic powder, fold in 1 lb. crabmeat, bake at 350°F for about 20 minutes, and serve with crackers or toast rounds.

text: Skillet Beef and Macaroni In a skillet, cook 1 to 1 1/2 lb. ground beef with 1/2 c. chopped onion until the meat is browned and the onion is tender, then drain. Stir in 2 cans (8 oz.) tomato sauce, 1 c. water, 1 (7 oz.) pkg. macaroni, 1/2 c. chopped green pepper, 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. pepper, and 1 1/2 Tbsp. chili powder, bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer until the macaroni is tender, about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally and adding additional water if needed (yields 4 to 6 servings).

text: Jiffy Beef Stroganoff Brown 1 lb. ground beef, sprinkle with 1 pkg. dry onion soup mix and 1/2 tsp. ginger, arrange 3 c. medium noodles over the meat, add 1 (3 oz.) can sliced mushrooms, pour 3 c. hot water over the noodles, and cook on low for 20 minutes. Blend 2 Tbsp. flour into 1 c. sour cream, stir into the stroganoff, and cook 3 minutes longer.

text: Baked Cheese Sandwiches Make 4 cheese sandwiches using 2 slices of American cheese in each, remove crusts and arrange in a baking dish. Mix 5 eggs with 3 c. milk and 1 tsp. mustard, pour over the sandwiches, and bake at 400°F for about 20 minutes or until browned on top.

text: Teresa’s Brisket Cover the brisket with garlic, onion, celery powder, minced onion, and a bottle of liquid smoke and refrigerate overnight in a 13 x 9-inch pan. The next morning add 1 bottle Worcestershire sauce and black pepper, bake at 275°F for 6 to 8 hours, and cover with barbecue sauce.

text: Heavenly Rice Cook 3/4 c. rice without salt and drain off excess water, then while hot mix in 1 small can drained pineapple and sugar to taste. Let set until cold, fold in 1 c. whipped cream, and add miniature marshmallows if desired.

text: Baked Salmon Loaf Combine 1 (1 lb.) can salmon with 1/2 c. chopped celery, 1/4 c. chopped onion, 1/4 lb. chopped fresh mushrooms, 1/4 c. evaporated skim milk, 2 egg whites or egg substitute equal to 1 egg, and 1 c. bread crumbs or oat bran cereal; optionally add 1 1/2 Tbsp. dill weed.

text: Favorite Vegetable Soup (Low-Fat) In a 1 1/2-quart nonstick saucepan cook 1/4 c. diced onion with 2 packets instant chicken broth mix and 2 minced garlic cloves until translucent. Add 1 1/2 c. sliced zucchini, 1/2 c. sliced carrots, 1/2 c. chopped seeded tomato, 1 tsp. chopped parsley, 1/4 tsp. basil, and 1/8 tsp. pepper, cover and cook about 10 minutes. Add 2 c. water, bring to a boil, reduce heat and cook about 20 minutes, puree most of the soup, return to the pan, add reserved vegetables and heat (makes 2 servings).
json: {"title": "Favorite Vegetable Soup(Low-Fat)", "ingredients": ["1/4 c. diced onion", "2 packets instant chicken broth and seasoning mix", "2 garlic cloves, minced", "1 1/2 c. thinly sliced zucchini", "1/2 c. each thinly sliced carrots and chopped seeded tomato", "1 tsp. chopped fresh parsley", "1/4 tsp. basil leaves", "1/8 tsp. pepper"], "directions": ["In 1 1/2-quart nonstick saucepan, combine onion, broth mix and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is translucent. Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine; cover and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes.", "Add 2 cups water and bring to a boil.", "Reduce heat to medium, cover and cook until vegetables are soft, about 20 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove about 1/2 cup vegetables from saucepan and set aside.", "In blender container, in 2 batches, puree remaining soup; return pureed mixture to saucepan, add reserved vegetables and heat.", "Makes 2 servings."]}

text: Sour Cream Lasagna Cook 1 (8 oz.) pkg. egg dumpling noodles, rinse and drain. Brown 1 1/2 lb. ground beef and mix in 1 tsp. salt, a dash of pepper, 1/4 tsp. garlic salt, 1/4 tsp. liquid smoke, 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce, and 1 Tbsp. brown sugar, cook 5 minutes and remove from heat. Combine noodles with 1 c. cottage cheese, 1 (12 oz.) carton sour cream, and 6 chopped green onions. Layer noodle and meat mixtures in a 2-quart dish, top with 3/4 c. grated Cheddar cheese, and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

Brown hamburger in skillet.", "Add next 6 ingredients; mix well. Cook for 5 minutes; remove from heat.", "Combine noodles with cottage cheese, sour cream and green onions.", "Alternate layers of noodle mixture and meat mixture in 2-quart baking dish, ending with meat mixture.", "Top with Cheddar cheese.", "Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, or until heated through."]}

text: Tater Tot Casserole Lightly brown 3/4 to 1 lb. ground beef or turkey with 1 small chopped onion if desired, drain, and spread in a casserole dish. Mix 1 can cream soup with 1/2 can milk, spread over 1 can drained whole kernel corn, sprinkle with 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese, top with frozen Tater Tots, and bake covered at 325°F for 30 to 40 minutes or until done.

Spread corn over meat and soup over corn.", "Don't stir.", "Sprinkle cheese over soup.", "Cover top with frozen Tater Tots.", "Bake at 325°, covered, about 30 to 40 minutes, or longer if potatoes are not done."]}

text: Earthquake Cake Prepare 1 box German chocolate cake mix as directed. Grease a 9 x 13-inch pan, sprinkle 1 1/2 c. chopped pecans and 1 1/2 c. shredded coconut over the bottom, and pour cake batter over the top.

text: Raw Gluten Mix 2 lb. whole wheat flour with 1 qt. water into a firm dough and let stand 45 minutes. Rinse and squeeze under cold running water until starch is removed and water runs clear, keeping dough together, then cover with water until ready to use (yields 1 lb.).
json: {"title": "Raw Gluten", "ingredients": ["2 lb. whole wheat flour", "1 qt. water"], "directions": ["Mix whole wheat flour with water into a firm texture.", "Make sure all flour is mixed well (medium to firm dough).", "Let set for 45 minutes (no less).", "Put dough in a colander and while running cold water, continually squeeze dough to wash out starch from mixture.", "Continue to squeeze dough, while at the same time, making sure dough stays firmly together.", "Keep rinsing until all graininess is removed and water is clear from rinsing.", "Cover with water until ready to use.", "Yield: 1 pound."]}

text: Lemon Chicken and Zucchini Cut 1 1/2 lb. chicken breasts and thighs into 1-inch pieces. Blend 1/4 c. chicken broth with 1 Tbsp. cornstarch, then stir in 2 Tbsp. soy sauce and 1 tsp. sugar and set aside.

Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces.", "Blend chicken broth into cornstarch; stir in soy sauce and sugar.", "Set aside."]}

text: Meat Balls Mix 2 lb. ground beef with a 10 oz. jar sweet relish, 2 tsp. garlic powder, 1/2 c. minced onions, 1/2 tsp. onion salt, and 1 egg. Form into balls, coat with 1 box barbecue Shake ’N Bake, and bake at 350°F for 30 to 40 minutes.

Cover good.", "Cook at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes."]}

text: Butternut Chewies Beat 2 eggs until foamy, add 2 c. light brown sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla, and 1/2 c. melted margarine. Mix in 1 1/2 c. flour combined with 2 tsp. baking powder and 1/2 tsp. salt, stir in 1 c. chopped nuts, spread in a greased 13 x 9-inch pan, and bake at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes (makes 2 dozen).

text: Tennessee Tea Combine 1 c. sugar, 1 c. Country Time Lemonade, 1/2 c. instant tea, and 1 c. white grape juice in a gallon pitcher, fill with water, stir, and chill or serve over ice.

text: Apple Waldorf Salad Chop 1 Granny Smith apple and 1 red Delicious apple without peeling, sprinkle with 1 Tbsp. lemon juice, add 1/2 c. chopped celery, 1 Tbsp. pecans, a dash of cinnamon and nutmeg, and 1/4 c. nonfat yogurt, then serve chilled.

text: Jackie’s Coconut Pie Melt 1 1/2 sticks butter, beat with 8 eggs and 3 c. sugar, mix in 1 c. buttermilk, then add 2 tsp. vanilla and a 7 oz. can coconut. Pour into 2 deep dish pie shells and bake at 300°F for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Jackie'S Coconut Pie", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 sticks butter", "1 c. buttermilk", "3 c. sugar", "7 oz. can coconut", "8 eggs", "2 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Melt margarine.", "Add eggs and sugar to margarine and beat. Add buttermilk and mix thoroughly.", "Add vanilla and coconut. Mix thoroughly.", "Pour into 2 deep dish pie shells.", "Bake at 300° for 1 hour."]}

text: Navy Bean Soup Combine 2 (16 oz.) cans navy beans undrained, 1/2 c. diced salt pork if desired, 2 (14 1/2 oz.) cans stewed tomatoes, 2 diced potatoes, 2 diced onions, 2 diced carrots, 1 Tbsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. pepper, and celery salt to taste. Add water if needed and cook until vegetables are tender (makes 6 servings).

Add water, if needed to reach your favorite consistency.", "Cook until vegetables are tender, but not mushy!", "Makes 6 servings."]}

text: Layered Banana Pineapple Dessert Mix 1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs with 1/4 c. sugar and 1/3 c. melted margarine and press into a 13 x 9-inch pan. Layer 3 sliced bananas on top. Beat 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese with 3 1/2 c. cold milk and 2 pkg. vanilla instant pudding, spread over bananas, top with 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple drained and 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip, and refrigerate 3 hours.

text: Scalloped Potatoes Sauté 1 thinly sliced large onion in 1 Tbsp. butter until translucent, add 2 thinly sliced large potatoes, then mix in 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, 1 tsp. thyme, and 1/2 tsp. salt.

text: Herb Butter Cream 1/4 lb. Heritage butter at room temperature with 1 Tbsp. lemon juice, then beat in 3 Tbsp. fresh parsley, 3 Tbsp. tarragon basil, and salt and pepper to taste; chill and use on corn or vegetables.
json: {"title": "Herb Butter", "ingredients": ["1/4 lb. Heritage butter, room temperature", "1 Tbsp. lemon juice", "3 Tbsp. fresh herb parsley", "3 Tbsp. taragon basil", "salt and pepper to taste"], "directions": ["Cream butter and lemon juice.", "Beat in herbs, salt and pepper and chill.", "Use on corn-on-the-cob or other vegetables."]}

text: Turnip Greens Wash 1 bucket turnip greens thoroughly. In a large pot 3/4 full of water add 1 c. bacon grease and 1 Tbsp. salt and bring to a boil. Add greens by the handful, letting them cook down, poking them under as needed. Add 1/4 tsp. baking soda, boil until tender about 30 minutes, drain well, and chop.
json: {"title": "Turnip Greens", "ingredients": ["1 bucket turnip greens", "1 c. bacon grease", "1 Tbsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. baking soda"], "directions": ["Wash greens in cold water to remove grit or any dirt.", "In a large pot filled 3/4 full of water, add the bacon grease and salt. Bring to a boil.", "Add the greens by the handful to the pot, letting them have a", "little time to start to cook down before adding more.", "When pot is full, you will need to poke the greens down for a few minutes as they like to come to the top of the pot and run over.", "Add 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda to the greens to take the bitterness out.", "Cook at a boil until greens are tender, perhaps a half hour.", "Drain well.", "While greens are draining in the colander, cut them up using two knives."]}

text: Bourbon Balls Beat 1/2 c. butter until fluffy, gradually beat in 1 lb. confectioners sugar, then slowly add 4 1/2 tsp. 100-proof bourbon. Chill 1 hour, roll into 1-inch balls, chill again, melt 8 oz. semisweet chocolate in a double boiler, dip balls halfway, place on wax paper, top each with a pecan half, and chill until firm (about 3 dozen).

Chill 1 hour.", "Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over simmering water.", "Remove chocolate from heat; cool until a good dipping consistency.", "Dip bourbon balls with 3-pronged fork halfway into chocolate.", "Return to wax paper-lined tray.", "Place pecan half on top of each ball.", "When all the bourbon balls have been dipped, return tray to refrigerator.", "Chill about 30 minutes or until firm. Makes about 3 dozen."]}

text: Pinto Beans Sort and rinse 1 1/2 c. dry beans, place in saucepan with water and 3/4 tsp. ground ginger, bring to a boil, cover and cook about 1 hour. Add 3 Tbsp. melted meat drippings and 1 1/2 tsp. salt, continue cooking, then add 1 heaping Tbsp. sugar and cook until very tender.
json: {"title": "Pinto Beans", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 c. dry beans", "3/4 tsp. ground ginger", "3 Tbsp. melted meat drippings", "1 1/2 tsp. salt or to taste", "1 heaping Tbsp. sugar"], "directions": ["Look over beans and remove all split beans and gravel (if any).", "Rinse well.", "Put into 2 to 3-quart saucepan.", "Add ginger; bring to boil and cover with lid.", "Cook until beans have swollen and turned color, about 1 hour.", "Add grease and salt and continue to cook, keeping water about 1-inch above beans at all times.", "When beans begin to get tender, add sugar and cook until very tender."]}

text: Cook While You Sleep Cookies Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat 2 egg whites until foamy, add a pinch of salt and 1/4 tsp. cream of tartar, beat until stiff, then add 2/3 c. sugar gradually. Stir in vanilla, 1 c. chocolate chips, 1 c. chopped nuts, and coconut if desired. Drop by teaspoon onto foil-lined sheets, put in oven, turn oven off immediately, do not open for 8 hours, then remove cookies (makes 40–50).
json: {"title": "Cook While You Sleep Cookies", "ingredients": ["2 egg whites", "pinch of salt", "1 c. chocolate chips", "1/4 tsp. cream of tartar", "2/3 c. sugar", "1 c. chopped nuts", "coconut (optional)"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 350°.", "Beat egg whites until foamy; add salt and cream of tartar.", "Beat until stiff.", "Add 2 tablespoons of sugar at a time, beating well after each addition.", "Stir in vanilla, chocolate chips, nuts and coconut.", "Drop by teaspoon onto foil lined cookie sheets.", "Put in the oven and turn off oven immediately.", "Do not open the door for at least 8 hours.", "Carefully remove cookies from foil.", "Makes 40 to 50 cookies."]}

text: Chili Spaghetti Fry chopped mango (green pepper) and 1 chopped onion in butter, then brown 1 1/2 lb. hamburger in the same skillet. Add 3 cans tomato sauce and a dash of chili powder and simmer about 20 minutes.

text: Cherry Delight Mix 1 small can drained crushed pineapple with 1 small pkg. dry cherry Jell-O, stir in 1 small container cottage cheese, fold in 1 small container Cool Whip, and refrigerate.

Add dry jello. Stir. Then add cottage cheese. Stir and finally add Cool Whip. Stir. Refrigerate."]}

text: Banana Split Dessert Mix 2 c. crushed graham crackers with 6 Tbsp. melted butter and press into a 13 x 9-inch pan. Beat 1/2 c. butter with 2 c. powdered sugar, 2 eggs, and 1 tsp. vanilla until fluffy and spread over crust. Arrange sliced bananas, top with crushed pineapple, spread with 2 c. whipped cream, sprinkle with 1/4 c. crushed nuts, garnish with maraschino cherries, and chill 6 hours.

text: Strawberry Salad Dissolve 2 pkg. strawberry Jell-O in 1 c. boiling water, add 1 small pkg. strawberries, 2 crushed bananas, and 1 can crushed pineapple. Pour half into a pan, let set, spread with sour cream, add remaining mixture, and chill until firm.

text: Peanut Butter Pie Beat 2 eggs and mix with 1 c. corn syrup, sugar, 1/2 c. peanut butter, and 1 tsp. vanilla. Pour into ̀1 unbaked 8-inch pie crust and bake at 350°F for 45 to 60 minutes until browned.

text: Foolproof Fudge Melt 3 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips with 1 (14 oz.) can Eagle Brand milk over low heat, remove from heat, stir in a dash of salt, 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla, and 1/2 c. chopped nuts. Spread in an 8-inch square dish and chill 2 hours.

text: Hamburger Party Balls Mix 1 1/2 lb. hamburger with 1/2 c. chopped dill pickles, 1/4 c. Carnation cream, 2 Tbsp. Shake ’n Bake for chicken, and chopped onion if desired. Shape into balls, roll in remaining Shake ’n Bake, and bake at 350°F for 20 to 30 minutes.

text: Pigs in Blanket Wrap cocktail hot dogs in crescent roll dough and bake as directed on the package. Serve warm with mustard.

text: Fresh Tomato Salsa Combine 5 diced tomatoes with 1/3 c. tomato sauce, 1/4 c. finely chopped purple onion, 3 minced garlic cloves, 1–2 minced jalapeños, 2 Tbsp. cilantro, 1 tsp. oregano, 2 Tbsp. lime juice, and 1 tsp. salt, then chill.

text: Fresh Apple Cake #2 Beat 1 c. oil with 1 3/4 c. sugar and 2 eggs until creamy. Add 2 1/2 c. flour, 1 tsp. soda, 2 tsp. baking powder, and 1 tsp. salt gradually, then stir in 3 c. chopped apples, 1 c. nuts, 1 c. coconut, and 1 tsp. vanilla. Bake in an angel food pan at 350°F for 1 hour.

text: Pumpkin Pie Dessert Mix 2 1/4 c. crushed butter crackers with 1/2 c. sugar and 3/4 c. melted margarine and press into a 9 x 13 pan. Whisk 2 c. cold milk with 2 pkg. instant vanilla pudding, stir in 1 can pumpkin and spices, spread over crust, refrigerate 3 hours, and garnish with whipped topping and nuts.

Garnish with whipped topping and nuts."]}

text: Vermicelli Salad Combine cooked and cooled 1 (12 oz.) pkg. vermicelli with chopped black olives, green onions, pimentos, oil, Tex Joy seasoning, lemon juice, and 1/2 to 1 c. mayonnaise. Refrigerate overnight.

text: Two Potato Bake Layer 4 c. sliced sweet potatoes on one side of a greased baking dish and 4 c. sliced red potatoes on the other. Sprinkle with onion, drizzle with melted oleo, season with salt and pepper, repeat layers, add 3/4 c. skim milk, parsley, and Parmesan, and bake until tender.

text: Spinach Dip Mix thawed, drained spinach with 1 c. sour cream, 1 c. mayonnaise, 1 c. chopped green onions, and 1 pkg. vegetable soup mix. Serve in hollowed sourdough bread with bread chunks.

text: Scalloped Potatoes Mix 2 cans cream of chicken soup with 1 c. sour cream and 2 Tbsp. chives. Layer with 6 c. frozen hash browns and 2 c. Cheddar cheese in a greased pan and bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

text: Pork Chop Dinner Layer pork chops, sliced potatoes, and mushrooms in a baking pan, pour onion soup mix with water over top, cover with foil, and bake at 350°F for 2 hours.
json: {"title": "Pork Chop Dinner", "ingredients": ["5 or 6 pork chops", "sliced potatoes (thick)", "sliced fresh mushrooms, drained (canned mushrooms are okay)"], "directions": ["Layer ingredients in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan.", "Pour envelope of dry onion soup and 2 cups of water over top.", "(For richer broth, add another envelope of onion soup and one more cup of water.)", "Lay foil over top and bake at 350° for 2 hours."]}

text: Chicken Casserole Mix 4 c. cooked chicken, 1 c. celery, 1 c. rice, 3/4 c. mayonnaise, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 Tbsp. lemon juice, 3 Tbsp. onion, 3 chopped hard-boiled eggs, and optional water chestnuts. Sauté butter with almonds and corn flakes, sprinkle on top, and bake at 350°F for 35 minutes.
json: {"title": "Chicken Casserole", "ingredients": ["4 c. cooked chicken", "1 c. chopped celery", "1 c. cooked rice", "3/4 c. mayonnaise", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 Tbsp. lemon juice", "3 Tbsp. chopped onion", "3 hard-boiled eggs", "1 can water chestnuts (optional)", "3/4 to 1 stick butter", "1/2 c. slivered almonds (optional)", "1 c. crushed corn flakes"], "directions": ["Mix first nine ingredients.", "Saute 5 minutes butter, almonds and corn flakes.", "Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.", "Makes 4 to 6 servings."]}

text: Cabbage and Noodles Boil chopped cabbage and egg noodles until tender. Sauté sliced onions in butter, add cabbage and noodles, stir well, and season with salt and pepper.
json: {"title": "Cabbage And Noodles", "ingredients": ["1 head cabbage", "1 to 2 onions, sliced", "1/2 pkg. egg noodles", "1 stick butter or oleo"], "directions": ["Cut cabbage and boil until tender.", "Boil noodles until tender. In a frying pan, saute onions in butter.", "When onions are tender, add cabbage and noodles.", "Keep stirring and adding butter, if needed, so it doesn't stick.", "Add salt and pepper to taste."]}

text: Scalloped Tomatoes Preheat oven to 375°F. Combine tomatoes, green pepper, onion, garlic, basil, and pepper in a sprayed casserole. Toss bread cubes with melted margarine, sprinkle on top, and bake 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Scalloped Tomatoes(Heart Smart)", "ingredients": ["1 (16 oz.) can tomatoes in juice, chopped", "2 Tbsp. minced green pepper", "2 Tbsp. minced onion", "1 garlic clove, minced", "1 tsp. basil, crushed", "1/8 tsp. pepper", "2 slices stale or day old bread (whole wheat), cut into cubes (1 1/2 c.)", "4 tsp. margarine, melted"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 375°.", "In a 1-quart casserole sprayed with nonstick cooking spray, place tomatoes in juice.", "Stir in green pepper, onion, garlic, basil and pepper.", "In a small bowl, combine bread cubes and margarine; sprinkle over tomatoes.", "Bake about 30 minutes until hot and bubbly.", "Makes 4 servings."]}

text: Hobo Dinner Place 1/4 lb. hamburger patty on foil, top with sliced potato, carrot, onion, salt, pepper, and butter, wrap tightly, and bake at 400°F for 1 hour (serves 1).
json: {"title": "Hobo Dinner", "ingredients": ["1/4 lb. hamburger", "1 small potato, sliced", "1/2 carrot, sliced", "1 slice onion", "salt and pepper", "1 patty of butter"], "directions": ["Shape hamburger into patty.", "Place vegetables on top of hamburger (which is in the center of a 12-inch square piece of foil).", "Season with salt, pepper and butter.", "Fold ends of foil in a drugstore wrap.", "Bake at 400° for 1 hour.", "Serves 1 person."]}

text: Monkey Bread Coat biscuit quarters in sugar and cinnamon, layer with pecans and cherries in a Bundt pan, pour melted butter mixed with brown sugar and cinnamon over top, bake at 350°F for 35 minutes, cool briefly, and invert.
json: {"title": "Monkey Bread", "ingredients": ["4 regular size cans buttermilk biscuits cut into quarters", "1 c. granulated sugar", "2 tsp. cinnamon in a medium sized plastic bag", "1/2 to 3/4 c. pecan pieces", "10 to 15 maraschino cherries cut in half", "1 1/2 sticks margarine or butter", "1 c. brown sugar", "1 Tbsp. cinnamon"], "directions": ["Put pecan pieces and maraschino cherries into bundt pan.", "Add the 1 c. granulated sugar in a plastic bag along with the 2 tsp. cinnamon. Toss a few of the biscuit quarters in the mixture and put into bundt pan. Continue coating all the", "biscuit pieces. Heat margarine or butter, brown sugar, and 1 Tbsp. cinnamon. Pour over the biscuits. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes. Cool 15 minutes, then, turn out onto cake dish. Serve warm."]}

text: Mixed Up Marinade Stir together 1/4 c. A.1. sauce, 1/4 c. red wine vinegar, 2 Tbsp. soy sauce, 2 Tbsp. ketchup, 1 tsp. garlic salt, pepper, and onion powder, pour over steaks, marinate 2 hours, then grill.
json: {"title": "Mixed Up Marinade", "ingredients": ["1/4 c. A.1. steak sauce", "1/4 c. red wine vinegar", "2 Tbsp. soy sauce", "2 Tbsp. ketchup", "1 tsp. garlic salt", "dash of pepper", "pinch of onion powder"], "directions": ["Stir all ingredients together.", "Pour over steaks.", "Marinate at least 2 hours.", "Grill or broil steaks as usual."]}

text: Banana Nut Muffins Mix dry ingredients, add mashed bananas, milk, butter, and egg, fill muffin cups, sprinkle with cinnamon sugar if desired, and bake at 400°F for 20–22 minutes (1 dozen).
json: {"title": "Banana Nut Muffins", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 c. whole-wheat flour", "1 c. chopped walnuts", "1/2 c. toasted wheat germ", "1/2 c. brown sugar", "1 Tbsp. baking powder", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. ground nutmeg", "2 ripe bananas, mashed", "3/4 c. milk", "5 Tbsp. melted butter", "1 egg", "cinnamon sugar (optional)"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 400°.", "Fit 12 muffin cups with paper liners. Coat each with cooking spray.", "Mix flour, walnuts, wheat germ, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, salt and nutmeg in large bowl.", "Stir in bananas, milk, butter and egg.", "Mix just until blended.", "Using an ice cream scoop, fill muffin cups evenly with batter.", "Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar, if desired.", "Bake muffins until a skewer inserted into centers comes out clean, 20 to 22 minutes.", "Cool 1 minute, then remove from the muffin pan and cool on a wire rack. Makes 1 dozen muffins."]}

text: Fudge Pie Mix 2 well-beaten eggs with 1 c. sugar, 1 stick butter, 1/2 c. self-rising flour, 2 Tbsp. cocoa, and a pinch of salt, pour into a greased and floured pie pan, and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Fudge Pie", "ingredients": ["2 eggs, well beaten", "1 c. sugar", "1 stick butter", "1/2 c. flour (self-rising)", "2 Tbsp. cocoa", "pinch of salt"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients together and pour into greased and floured pie pan.", "Bake at 350° for 30 minutes."]}

text: Brazilian Coffee Cookies Cream 1/3 c. shortening with 1/2 c. granulated sugar and 1/2 c. packed brown sugar, then beat in 1 egg, 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla, and 1 Tbsp. milk. Sift together 2 c. flour, 2 Tbsp. powdered instant coffee, 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. baking soda, and 1/4 tsp. baking powder, add to the creamed mixture, mix well, shape into 1-inch balls, place on ungreased cookie sheets, flatten to about 1/8 inch, and bake at 400°F for 8 to 10 minutes.
json: {"title": "Brazilian Coffee Cookies", "ingredients": ["1/3 c. shortening", "1/2 c. granulated sugar", "1 Tbsp. milk", "2 c. flour", "1/2 c. brown sugar, packed", "1 egg", "2 Tbsp. powdered instant coffee", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1 1/2 tsp. vanilla", "1/4 tsp. baking soda", "1/4 tsp. baking powder"], "directions": ["Mix shortening, sugars, egg, vanilla and milk until fluffy. Sift dry ingredients together.", "Add to sugar mixture; mix thoroughly.", "Shape dough into 1-inch balls.", "Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.", "Flatten to 1/8-inch thickness.", "Bake at 400° for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned."]}

text: Quick-Energy Pickups Crush 3 or 4 squares of graham crackers and mix with 1 c. powdered sugar, 1 c. crunchy peanut butter, 1 c. semi-sweet chocolate chips, and 1/2 c. instant nonfat dry milk or 3 Tbsp. milk. Shape teaspoonfuls into 1-inch balls, roll in graham cracker crumbs, and refrigerate until firm.
json: {"title": "Quick-Energy Pickups", "ingredients": ["3 or 4 sq. graham crackers", "1 c. powdered sugar", "1 c. crunchy peanut butter", "1 c. semi-sweet chocolate chips", "1/2 c. instant nonfat dry milk or 3 Tbsp. milk"], "directions": ["Crush graham crackers.", "Mix remaining ingredients in a bowl. Shape teaspoonfuls of mixture into 1-inch balls.", "Roll the balls in the graham cracker crumbs until coated.", "Refrigerate until firm."]}

text: Chicken with Rice (Arroz con Pollo) Mix 2 tsp. salt, chopped garlic, 1/2 tsp. oregano, 1 can tomato sauce, chopped tomatoes, chopped green pepper, chopped onion, 1 Tbsp. achiote coloring, olives, and capers. Add 1 (2 1/2 lb.) cut-up chicken and cook a few minutes, then add 1 lb. rice and 2 c. water or broth, stir and cook until the liquid is absorbed, cover and finish cooking until rice is tender, then garnish with peas and strips of pimentos and serve hot.
json: {"title": "Chicken With Rice(Arroz Con Pollo)", "ingredients": ["1 (2 1/2 lb.) ready to cook chicken, cut up", "2 chopped cloves garlic", "2 tsp. salt", "1 chopped green pepper", "1 Tbsp. onion", "1/4 c. olives", "1 Tbsp. achiote coloring or Bijol", "2 c. water or broth", "1 c. peas", "1/2 tsp. oregano", "2 chopped tomatoes", "1 chopped onion", "1 Tbsp. capers", "1 lb. rice", "4 pimentos", "1 can tomato sauce"], "directions": ["Mix salt, garlic, oregano, tomato sauce, tomatoes, peppers, onion, achiote, olives and capers.", "Add the chicken and cook for a few minutes.", "Add the rice and water.", "Stir and cook until the water has been absorbed, then cover until the rice is done.", "Serve hot.", "Garnish with strips of pimentos and peas."]}

text: Puff Pancakes Preheat oven to 425°F and grease a 10-inch ovenproof skillet. Beat 2 eggs with 1/2 c. flour, 1/2 c. milk, 2 Tbsp. melted butter, 1 Tbsp. sugar, and 1/4 tsp. salt until smooth, pour into skillet, bake 15 minutes, reduce heat to 350°F, and bake 10 to 15 minutes more until puffed and golden (serves 6).
json: {"title": "Puff Pancakes", "ingredients": ["2 eggs", "1/2 c. flour", "1/2 c. milk", "2 Tbsp. melted butter", "1 Tbsp. sugar", "1/4 tsp. salt"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 425°.", "Grease a 10-inch cast-iron or ovenproof skillet.", "Beat eggs and add rest of ingredients.", "Beat until smooth.", "Pour into skillet and bake 15 minutes.", "Reduce heat to 350° and bake 10 to 15 minutes or until puffy and golden brown. Serve with Vanilla Cream Syrup.", "Serves 6."]}

text: Easy Hot Dish Brown 1 lb. hamburger with chopped onion and celery, mix with 1 can Franco-American spaghetti, 1 can Veg-All mixed vegetables, and 1 can undiluted cream of chicken soup, then bake uncovered until thoroughly heated or keep warm on the stovetop.
json: {"title": "Easy Hot Dish", "ingredients": ["1 can Franco-American spaghetti", "onion and celery, chopped", "1 can Veg-All mixed vegetables", "1 lb. hamburger", "1 can cream of chicken soup (not diluted)"], "directions": ["Brown hamburger with onion and celery.", "Mix with remaining ingredients.", "Put in oven dish and bake, uncovered, until thoroughly heated.", "Or keep it warm in frying pan on top of stove."]}

text: Hot Spiced Tea Mix 1 1/3 c. Tang, 1/2 c. sugar, 1/2 c. instant tea, 1 tsp. cinnamon, and 1/2 tsp. cloves; use as needed (makes about 2 cups mix).
json: {"title": "Hot Spiced Tea", "ingredients": ["1 1/3 c. Tang", "1/2 c. sugar", "1/2 c. instant tea", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1/2 tsp. cloves"], "directions": ["Mix together; makes 2 cups."]}

text: Easy Spaghetti Sauté 1 chopped medium onion, 1 chopped garlic clove, and 2 Tbsp. chopped parsley in 4 Tbsp. olive oil until soft, add 1 lb. ground beef, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/8 tsp. pepper and brown lightly, then stir in 2 1/4 c. tomato juice, 1 can tomato paste, 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp. oregano, 1 pkg. spatini, and 1 Tbsp. brown sugar, and simmer about 1 hour (serves 4 to 6).
json: {"title": "Easy Spaghetti", "ingredients": ["1 (8 oz.) pkg. spaghetti", "1 lb. ground beef", "4 Tbsp. olive oil", "1 medium onion, chopped", "1 clove garlic, chopped", "2 Tbsp. chopped parsley", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/8 tsp. pepper", "2 1/4 c. (No. 2 can) tomato juice", "1 can tomato paste (2/3 c.)", "1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce", "1 tsp. oregano", "1 pkg. spatini", "1 Tbsp. brown sugar"], "directions": ["Saute onion, garlic and parsley in olive oil until soft; add meat and seasonings.", "Brown lightly.", "Blend in remaining ingredients and simmer for approximately 1 hour.", "Makes 4 to 6 servings."]}

text: Cashew Chicken Cut 1 chicken breast into thumb-size cubes and marinate in a soy sauce and sherry mixture for 4 to 6 hours or overnight before cooking with green pepper, blanched cashews, pineapple, snow peas, and seasonings.
json: {"title": "Cashew Chicken", "ingredients": ["1 chicken breast", "1 green pepper", "1 c. blanched cashews", "6 pineapple rings", "1 box frozen snow peas", "3/4 c. water", "1 chicken bouillon cube", "1 tsp. cornstarch", "sherry", "soy sauce", "powdered ginger", "peanut oil"], "directions": ["Cut chicken breast into thumb sized cubes; marinate in a soy sauce/sherry mixture for 4 to 6 hours (overnight is better)."]}

text: Corn Casserole Sauté 1 chopped red or green pepper and 1 chopped medium onion in 1/2 c. margarine, then combine with 1 (17 oz.) can corn with liquid, 1 (17 oz.) can creamed corn, 3 slightly beaten eggs, and 1 pkg. corn muffin mix, pour into a well-greased 2-quart casserole, top with 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese, and bake at 350°F for 55 to 65 minutes.
json: {"title": "Corn Casserole", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. margarine", "1 red or green pepper, chopped", "1 medium onion, chopped", "1 (17 oz.) can corn", "1 (17 oz.) can creamed corn", "3 eggs, slightly beaten", "1 pkg. corn muffin mix", "1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese"], "directions": ["Saute the pepper and onion in the margarine.", "In large bowl, combine the can of corn with the liquid, the creamed corn, the eggs and the muffin mix.", "Add the pepper and onion mixture and mix well.", "Pour into a well-greased 2-quart casserole.", "Top with the grated cheese.", "Bake at 350° for 55 to 65 minutes."]}

text: Rhubarb Crumble Mix 1 c. brown sugar, 3/4 c. quick oats, 1 c. flour, 1/2 c. melted butter, and 1 tsp. cinnamon. Press half into a 9-inch square pan, cover with 4 c. diced rhubarb, cook together 1 c. sugar, 2 tsp. cornstarch, 1 c. water, and 1 tsp. vanilla until thick and clear, pour over rhubarb, sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture, and bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Rhubarb Crumble", "ingredients": ["1 c. brown sugar", "3/4 c. quick rolled oats", "1 c. flour", "1/2 c. melted butter", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "4 c. diced rhubarb", "1 c. sugar", "2 tsp. cornstarch", "1 c. water", "1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Mix brown sugar, oats, flour, butter and cinnamon.", "Press 1/2 of mixture into a 9-inch square pan.", "Cover with rhubarb.", "Mix sugar and cornstarch together.", "Add water and vanilla.", "Cook until thick and clear.", "(Add 3 drops red coloring.)", "Pour over rhubarb. Sprinkle remaining brown sugar mixture on top.", "Bake at 350° for 1 hour.", "Top with whipped cream or ice cream."]}

text: Skillet Pineapple Upside-Down Cake Melt 1/4 c. butter in a skillet, spread 1 c. brown sugar evenly over it, arrange 8 pineapple slices and 8 maraschino cherries on top, cover with batter made from 3 beaten eggs, 1 1/2 c. sugar, 1 1/2 c. sifted cake flour, 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder, 1/2 tsp. salt, 3/4 c. scalded milk, 1 tsp. vanilla, and 2 Tbsp. butter, and bake until done.
json: {"title": "Skillet Pineapple Upside-Down Cake", "ingredients": ["1/4 c. butter", "1 c. brown sugar", "8 slices canned pineapple", "8 maraschino cherries", "3 eggs, beaten", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1 1/2 c. cake flour, sifted", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 1/2 tsp. baking powder", "3/4 c. scalded milk", "2 Tbsp. butter", "1 1/2 c. sugar"], "directions": ["Melt butter in skillet.", "Spread brown sugar evenly over butter. Place 1 slice of pineapple in center of the skillet.", "Arrange other slices around the center slice.", "Place a cherry in center of each pineapple slice.", "Cover with the following batter."]}

text: Kim’s Chicken Alfredo Pizza Prepare pizza crust and sprinkle with cornmeal if using a stone. Spread 1 c. light Alfredo sauce over crust, add green pepper, chopped onion, jalapeños, cooked chicken breasts, season with garlic salt, coarse pepper, jerk spice, and parsley flakes, top with Mozzarella cheese, and bake at 450°F for 15 minutes.
json: {"title": "Kim'S Chicken Alfredo Pizza", "ingredients": ["1 c. Ragu light alfredo sauce", "1/2 c. green pepper", "chopped onion", "2 jalapenos, finely chopped", "garlic salt", "pepper (coarse)", "jerk spice or any spice you prefer", "dried parsley flakes", "2 chicken breasts, cooked", "Mozzarella cheese", "pizza crust", "cornmeal"], "directions": ["Make pizza crust according to directions. If you use a pizza stone, sprinkle with cornmeal before rolling out crust. Cover crust with sauce and all ingredients, ending with cheese. Bake at 450° for 15 minutes."]}

text: Don Hill’s Lasagna Cook 1 1/2 lb. hamburger with chopped onion and bell pepper until meat is no longer pink, add garlic, 1 jar spaghetti sauce, salt, and pepper. Cook egg noodles until almost tender, then layer noodles, sauce, Mozzarella, Cheddar, and Parmesan cheeses in a casserole dish and bake until browned.
json: {"title": "Don Hill'S Lasagna", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 lb. hamburger meat", "1 onion, chopped", "1 bell pepper, chopped", "garlic to taste", "1 (15 1/4 oz.) jar spaghetti sauce", "salt and pepper to taste", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. hearty wide egg noodles", "3 c. shredded Mozzarella cheese (12 oz.)", "1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese", "3 c. shredded Cheddar cheese (12 oz.)"], "directions": ["Cook hamburger, onion and bell pepper until tender and meat is no longer pink.", "Add garlic, spaghetti sauce, salt and pepper; set aside.", "Cook egg noodles in pot until almost tender.", "Layer casserole dish with half of noodles.", "Spread half of sauce mixture over noodles.", "Layer with half of each of the cheeses.", "Repeat the layering:", "noodles, sauce, Mozzarella cheese and Cheddar cheese with Parmesan cheese on top.", "Bake in oven until brown."]}

text: Layered Salad Layer chopped lettuce, sliced red onion, 1/2 lb. fried and crumbled bacon, and 1/2 head cauliflower in a bowl. Mix 1/4 c. sugar with 2 c. mayonnaise and 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese, spread on top, refrigerate several hours, then toss before serving.
json: {"title": "Layered Salad", "ingredients": ["1 head lettuce, chopped", "1 red onion, sliced", "1/2 lb. bacon, fried crisp and crumbled", "1/2 head cauliflower, separated into small pieces", "1/4 c. sugar", "2 c. mayonnaise", "1/2 c. Parmesan cheese"], "directions": ["Layer first four ingredients in order shown.", "Combine sugar, mayonnaise and cheese.", "Put on top.", "Refrigerate several hours and toss before serving."]}

text: Apple Cream Coffee Cake Heat oven to 375°F. Mix 1/2 c. sugar with 2 tsp. cinnamon and 1/2 c. chopped walnuts. Cream 1/2 c. softened butter with remaining sugar, beat in 2 eggs and 1 tsp. vanilla, add 2 c. flour sifted with baking powder, baking soda, and salt alternately with 1 c. sour cream, spread half the batter in a greased tube pan, top with sliced apple and half the cinnamon mixture, add remaining batter, sprinkle with remaining topping, and bake 45 minutes.
json: {"title": "Apple Cream Coffee Cake", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. chopped walnuts", "2 tsp. cinnamon", "1 1/2 c. sugar", "1/2 c. softened butter or margarine", "2 eggs", "1 tsp. vanilla", "2 c. flour", "1 tsp. baking powder", "1 tsp. baking soda", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1 c. sour cream", "1 large apple, sliced thinly"], "directions": ["Heat oven to 375°.", "Mix in separate bowl 1/2 sugar, cinnamon and walnuts.", "In large bowl, mix soft butter or margarine and sugar.", "Beat until light and fluffy.", "Add eggs and blend well; add vanilla.", "Sift together flour, baking powder, soda and salt.", "Mix into creamed mixture alternately with sour cream.", "Spread half mixture into greased 10-inch tube pan.", "Add sliced apples all around.", "Sprinkle with half cinnamon mixture.", "Add rest of batter, then top with remaining cinnamon mixture.", "Bake 45 minutes."]}

text: Apple Crunch Mix 3 sliced apples with 1/4 c. packed brown sugar in a baking pan. Combine 3/4 c. flour, 3/4 c. white sugar, 1/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. cinnamon, mix in 1 beaten egg, spread over apples, drizzle with 1/3 c. melted margarine, and bake at 375°F for about 45 minutes until lightly browned.
json: {"title": "Apple Crunch", "ingredients": ["3 medium apples, pared and sliced", "1/4 c. packed brown sugar", "1/3 c. melted margarine", "3/4 c. flour", "3/4 c. white sugar", "1/4 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. cinnamon", "1 egg"], "directions": ["Mix apples with brown sugar in baking pan and set aside.", "Mix flour, sugar, salt and cinnamon; set aside.", "Beat egg.", "Mix with flour mixture.", "Spread over fruit.", "Pour margarine over top.", "Bake at 375° for about 45 minutes until lightly browned.", "Serve warm."]}

text: Ambrosia Combine 1 can drained pineapple chunks, 1 can drained mandarin oranges, 1 1/2 c. seedless grapes, 1 c. miniature marshmallows, 1 c. flaked coconut, and 1/2 c. nuts. Mix 3/4 c. sour cream or vanilla yogurt with 1 Tbsp. sugar, stir into fruit mixture, and chill.
json: {"title": "Ambrosia", "ingredients": ["1 (20 oz.) can pineapple chunks, drained", "1 (11 oz.) can mandarin orange segments, drained", "1 1/2 c. seedless grapes", "1 c. miniature marshmallows", "1 c. flaked coconut", "1/2 c. nuts", "3/4 c. sour cream or vanilla yogurt", "1 Tbsp. sugar"], "directions": ["Combine pineapple, oranges, grapes, marshmallows, coconut and nuts.", "Mix together sour cream and sugar.", "Stir sour cream mixture into fruit mixture.", "Chill."]}

text: Chocolate Covered Cherries Cream 1/3 c. butter, beat in 2 c. marshmallow cream, a dash of salt, and 1 tsp. almond flavoring, then gradually add 4 c. sifted confectioners sugar. Chill the fondant, wrap around 36 drained maraschino cherries, chill again, melt 12 oz. chocolate chips with optional paraffin, dip cherries, and let set on waxed paper.
json: {"title": "Chocolate Covered Cherries", "ingredients": ["1/3 c. butter", "2 c. marshmallow cream", "dash of salt", "1 tsp. almond flavoring", "4 c. confectioners sugar, sifted", "36 maraschino cherries", "12 oz. chocolate chips", "1/4 cake paraffin (optional)"], "directions": ["Cream butter.", "Beat in marshmallow cream, salt and flavoring. Add confectioners sugar gradually, mixing well after each addition.", "Turn onto waxed paper and knead well.", "Refrigerate one hour.", "Drain cherries.", "Roll in fondant, covering completely. Chill balls in refrigerator.", "Melt chocolate in double boiler. Dip chilled fondant into chocolate and place on waxed paper to set."]}

text: Pork Medallions Blend 1 1/2 Tbsp. olive oil with garlic and 1/4 tsp. rosemary, then season 1 lb. thinly sliced pork tenderloin with the mixture, 2 1/2 Tbsp. lemon juice, 1/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. black pepper.
json: {"title": "Pork Medallions", "ingredients": ["1 lb. lean, boneless pork tenderloins, thinly sliced", "1 1/2 Tbsp. olive oil", "3 cloves garlic", "1/4 tsp. rosemary", "2 1/2 Tbsp. lemon juice (fresh)", "1/4 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. black pepper"], "directions": ["Combine olive oil and garlic in blender or food processor. Process, then add rosemary and whirl 1 minute more."]}

text: Coconut Kisses Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat 2 egg whites until foamy, gradually add 2/3 c. sugar until stiff peaks form, fold in 1/2 tsp. vanilla, 2 c. cornflakes, 1 (3 1/2 oz.) can flaked coconut, and 1/2 c. chopped pecans, drop by tablespoon onto foil-lined cookie sheets, place in oven and immediately turn it off, and do not open the door for 8 hours (yields about 3 dozen).
json: {"title": "Coconut Kisses", "ingredients": ["2 egg whites", "2/3 c. sugar", "1/2 tsp. vanilla", "2 c. cornflakes", "1 (3 1/2 oz.) can flaked coconut", "1/2 c. pecans, chopped"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 350°.", "Beat egg whites at high speed until foamy.", "Gradually add sugar, one tablespoon at a time, beating until stiff peaks form.", "Fold in vanilla, cereal, coconut and nuts. Drop by tablespoon on a foil lined cookie sheet.", "Place in oven and immediately turn off oven.", "Do not open door for 8 hours. Carefully peel cookies from foil.", "Store tightly sealed.", "Yield:", "3 dozen."]}

text: Lemon Chess Pie Combine 2 c. sugar and 4 eggs, mix together 1 Tbsp. flour and 1 Tbsp. cornmeal and add, then stir in 1/2 c. milk, 1/4 c. melted butter, and 1/2 c. lemon juice, pour into an unbaked pie shell, and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
json: {"title": "Lemon Chess Pie", "ingredients": ["2 c. sugar", "4 eggs", "1 Tbsp. flour", "1 Tbsp. cornmeal", "1/2 c. milk", "1/4 c. melted butter", "1/2 c. lemon juice"], "directions": ["Combine sugar and eggs.", "Toss together flour and cornmeal, then add to egg mixture.", "Add milk gradually, then butter and lemon juice.", "Pour into unbaked pie shell.", "Bake for 45 minutes at 350°."]}

text: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies Cream 1 c. butter-flavored shortening with 1 1/4 c. brown sugar and 1/2 c. sugar, beat in 2 eggs, 2 Tbsp. milk, and 2 tsp. vanilla, add 1 3/4 c. flour, 1 tsp. baking soda, then stir in 2 1/2 c. oatmeal, 2 c. chocolate chips, and 1 c. chopped nuts, drop by tablespoon on ungreased sheets, and bake at 375°F for 10 to 12 minutes.
json: {"title": "Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies", "ingredients": ["1 c. butter flavored shortening", "1 1/4 c. brown sugar", "2 eggs", "2 tsp. vanilla", "1 tsp. baking soda", "2 c. (12 oz.) chocolate chips", "1 c. chopped nuts", "1/2 c. sugar", "2 Tbsp. milk", "1 3/4 c. flour", "2 1/2 c. oatmeal"], "directions": ["Beat margarine and sugar until creamy.", "Add eggs, milk and vanilla and beat well.", "Add flour, baking soda and salt.", "Mix well. On ungreased cookie sheet, drop by tablespoonful.", "Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.", "Cool one minute before removing from cookie sheet.", "Cool completely on cooling rack."]}

text: Dirty Pudding Crush 1 small pkg. Oreo cookies and spread half in a 9 x 13-inch pan. Mix 1 large Cool Whip with 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese and 1 c. powdered sugar. In another bowl mix 2 (3 oz.) pkg. French vanilla instant pudding with 3 c. milk, combine mixtures, pour over crumbs, top with remaining crumbs, and refrigerate.
json: {"title": "Dirty Pudding", "ingredients": ["1 small pkg. Oreo cookies", "1 large Cool Whip", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 c. powdered sugar", "2 (3 oz.) pkg. French vanilla instant pudding mix", "3 c. milk"], "directions": ["Crush cookies and place half of them in 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Mix together Cool Whip, cream cheese and powdered sugar.", "Mix pudding and milk in separate bowl. Combine both mixtures and pour over crumbs. Spread remaining crumbs over top. Refrigerate before serving."]}

text: Pickled Bologna Boil together 1 1/2 qt. white vinegar, 1/2 c. sugar, 1 tsp. salt, and 1 tsp. pickling spice for 10 minutes, pour hot syrup over sliced bologna packed in a glass jar, cover, refrigerate, and use the next day.
json: {"title": "Pickled Bologna", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 qt. white vinegar", "1/2 c. sugar", "1 tsp. salt", "1 tsp. pickling spice"], "directions": ["Boil ingredients together for 10 minutes.", "Remove skin from 2 rings bologna--slice--pack in a glass jar.\tPour hot syrup over meat.", "Put lid on jar and refrigerate.", "Ready to use the next day. Can also use small party hotdogs."]}

text: Nutty Oven Fried Chicken Mix 1 c. biscuit mix with 1/3 c. finely chopped pecans, 2 tsp. paprika, 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. poultry seasoning, and 1/2 tsp. dried sage. Dip chicken in 1/2 c. evaporated milk, coat with pecan mixture, drizzle with 1/3 c. melted margarine, and bake until done.
json: {"title": "Nutty Oven Fried Chicken", "ingredients": ["1 c. buttermilk biscuit mix", "1/3 c. finely chopped pecans", "2 tsp. paprika", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/2 tsp. poultry seasoning", "1/2 tsp. dried sage", "1 (2 to 3 lb.) chicken, cut up or 6 breasts", "1/2 c. evaporated milk", "1/3 c. melted margarine"], "directions": ["In shallow mixing dish, combine biscuit mix, pecans and seasoning.", "Mix well.", "Dip chicken in milk.", "Coat generously with pecan mixture."]}

text: Wayne’s Cajun Bean Soup Cook chopped potatoes, onion, and celery until tender, add 3 cans Northern beans, 1 qt. tomatoes, 1 or 2 cans tomato soup, 1 1/2 tsp. chili powder, and 1 lb. sliced smoked sausage, simmer, and serve.
json: {"title": "Wayne'S Cajun Bean Soup", "ingredients": ["3 potatoes", "1 medium onion", "1 c. celery", "3 cans Northern beans", "1 qt. tomatoes", "1 or 2 cans tomato soup", "1 1/2 tsp. chili powder", "1 lb. smoked sausage, sliced thin"], "directions": ["Cook potatoes, celery and onion until tender.", "Add beans, tomatoes, soup, chili powder and smoked sausage.", "Simmer and serve."]}

text: Grandma’s Cheesecake Melt 1 stick butter, mix with 1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs and 4 Tbsp. sugar, press into a springform pan, beat 3 (8 oz.) cream cheese bars with 1 c. sugar, egg yolks from 5 eggs, 1 pt. sour cream, and 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla, pour into crust, and bake at 350°F.
json: {"title": "Grandma'S Cheesecake(New York Style)", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs", "4 Tbsp. sugar", "1/4 lb. (1 stick) butter", "3 (8 oz.) cream cheese bars", "1 c. sugar", "5 eggs, separated whites", "1 pt. sour cream", "1 1/2 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 350°.", "Melt butter; add sugar and graham cracker crumbs.", "Mix and line spring-form pan for crust.", "Room temperature cream cheese; sour cream leave out several hours before mixing.", "Beat cream cheese, sour cream, sugar, egg yolks and vanilla."]}

text: Preacher Cookies Bring 2 c. sugar, 1 stick butter, and 1/2 c. milk to a boil and cook 3 minutes, remove from heat, stir in 1/2 c. powdered cocoa, 2 c. quick oats, and 1 tsp. vanilla, drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper, and cool (yields about 3 dozen).
json: {"title": "Preacher Cookies", "ingredients": ["2 c. sugar", "1 stick butter or margarine", "1/2 c. milk", "1/2 c. powdered cocoa", "2 c. quick oats", "1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Put sugar, butter and milk in a heavy saucepan.", "Bring to a boil and boil for 3 minutes while stirring constantly.", "Remove from heat.", "stir in cocoa, oats and vanilla.", "Mix well. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper.", "Cool 30 minutes.", "Yields 3 dozen."]}

text: Punch Bowl Cake Bake an 18.5 oz. yellow cake mix in two layers as directed, prepare 1 large box instant vanilla pudding, then layer cake, pudding, cherry pie filling, crushed pineapple, Cool Whip, frozen coconut, and chopped pecans in a punch bowl.
json: {"title": "Punch Bowl Cake", "ingredients": ["18.5 oz. box yellow cake mix", "1 large box instant vanilla pudding", "20 oz. can cherry pie filling", "20 oz. can crushed pineapple, drained", "12 oz. container Cool Whip", "6 oz. pkg. frozen coconut", "1/2 c. chopped pecans"], "directions": ["Make cake as directed in", "2 layers.", "Make pudding as directed."]}

text: Sour Cream Apple Pie Line an unbaked 9-inch pie shell with sliced apples made from 3 to 4 tart green apples, mix 3/4 c. sugar, 1/3 c. flour, spices, and 1/4 c. butter, sprinkle over apples, bake at 350°F for 25 minutes, spread 1 c. sour cream on top, and bake 15 minutes more.
json: {"title": "Sour Cream Apple Pie", "ingredients": ["1 unbaked 9-inch pie shell", "3/4 c. granulated sugar", "1/3 c. all-purpose flour", "1/4 tsp. each ground nutmeg and salt", "1 tsp. ground cinnamon", "1/4 c. butter or margarine, softened", "3 to 4 large tart green apples, peeled and sliced to make 5 c.", "1 Tbsp. lemon juice", "1 c. sour cream"], "directions": ["Heat oven to 350°.", "Place pie shell on cookie sheet.", "In medium bowl, combine sugar, flour, spices and salt.", "With pastry blender or two knives, cut butter into sugar mixture until crumbly. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons on bottom of shell.", "Arrange apple slices in overlapping rows in shell.", "Sprinkle each row with a few drops of lemon juice and remaining sugar mixture.", "(Apples will round slightly in pie shell.)", "Bake 25 minutes.", "Spoon and spread sour cream over top.", "Bake 15 minutes longer.", "Makes 1 pie."]}

text: Meat Loaf Mix 1 1/2 lb. ground round with bread soaked in 1 c. milk, 1 beaten egg, 1/4 c. chopped onion, 1 1/4 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. pepper, 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce, and 1 Tbsp. catsup, pack into a loaf pan, and bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
json: {"title": "Meat Loaf", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 lb. ground round", "3 to 4 medium slices whole wheat bread", "1 c. milk", "1 egg, beaten", "1/4 c. chopped onion", "1 1/4 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. pepper", "1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce", "1 Tbsp. catsup"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients thoroughly.", "Spread in ungreased loaf pan, 9 x 5 x 3-inch.", "Bake in 350° oven for 1 1/2 hours."]}

text: Cumin Rice Dish Sauté 1 c. uncooked rice with chopped onion and bell pepper in 2 Tbsp. bacon fat until browned, add 2 cans consommé, 3/4 Tbsp. cumin, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce, bring to a boil, cover, and simmer 30 to 40 minutes.
json: {"title": "Cumin Rice Dish", "ingredients": ["1 c. uncooked rice", "1/3 c. chopped onion", "1/4 c. bell pepper", "2 cans consomme", "3/4 Tbsp. cumin", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce", "2 Tbsp. bacon fat"], "directions": ["Saute onion, pepper and rice in bacon fat until brown.", "Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil.", "Turn heat down and simmer 30 to 40 minutes, covered."]}

text: Prune Punch Cake Mix 1/2 c. Crisco, 1 c. sugar, 2 eggs, 1 c. prune juice, 1 c. cooked prunes, 2 c. flour, 1 tsp. soda, 1 tsp. cinnamon, 3/4 tsp. salt, and 1 1/2 tsp. nutmeg, pour into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan, bake at 350°F until done, then top warm cake with sugar mixed with orange juice.
json: {"title": "Prune Punch Cake", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. Crisco", "2 eggs", "1 c. prune juice", "1 tsp. soda", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 c. sugar", "1 c. cooked prunes", "2 c. flour", "3/4 tsp. salt", "1 1/2 tsp. nutmeg"], "directions": ["Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Mix all of the ingredients and pour into prepared pan.", "Bake at 350° until done. Remove cake from oven and top with 2 teaspoons sugar", "mixed with the juice of an orange to make 1/3 cup.", "Put on top of cake while warm.", "Mix sugar and cinnamon to sprinkle on top, if desired. Cool and cut into squares.", "Serve with Cool Whip."]}

text: Danish Cake Mix 1 c. shortening, 1 3/4 c. sugar, 3 eggs, 3 c. sifted flour, 1 1/2 tsp. soda, 1 tsp. salt, 1 c. buttermilk, 1 Tbsp. orange juice, 1 c. nuts, 2 c. chopped dates, grated orange rind, and 1 tsp. vanilla, bake in a tube pan at 350°F for 1 1/4 hours, and pour sauce over cake while hot.
json: {"title": "Danish Cake", "ingredients": ["1 c. shortening", "1 3/4 c. sugar", "3 eggs", "3 c. flour, sifted", "1 1/2 tsp. soda", "1 tsp. salt", "1 c. buttermilk", "1 Tbsp. orange juice", "1 c. nuts", "2 c. chopped dates", "1 grated orange rind", "1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Mix", "shortening, sugar, eggs, flour, soda, salt, buttermilk, orange juice, nuts, dates, orange rind and vanilla.", "Bake in a tube pan at 350° for 1 1/4 hours.", "When done, while still hot, pour sauce over cake."]}

text: Sherried Beef Mix 1/2 envelope onion soup mix with 2 cans cream of celery soup and 3/4 can dry sherry, pour over 3 lb. chuck cubes, cover, bake at 325°F for 3 hours, stirring occasionally and adding water if needed.
json: {"title": "Sherried Beef", "ingredients": ["3 lb. chuck cubes", "1/2 envelope onion soup mix", "2 cans cream of celery soup", "3/4 can sherry (dry)"], "directions": ["Mix the onion soup mix, celery soup and sherry; pour over meat in large casserole or roasting pan.", "Cover; bake at 325° for 3 hours.", "Stir occasionally.", "Add water if needed.", "Quick and easy!!"]}
