Return pan to heat and cook 1 minute, until top of crepe appears dry.", "Turn crepe and cook briefly on opposite side.", "Remove to plate and repeat until all batter is used.", "Leftover crepes can be stored in refrigerator wrapped in plastic wrap 2 days.", "Makes 12 crepes."]}

text: Spaghetti Salad Cook 1 lb. cooked spaghetti and let cool, dice together 1 green pepper, 1 diced onion, 1 diced cucumber, 3 stalks diced celery, and 3 tomatoes diced, then toss spaghetti with the vegetables, 1/3 bottle salad seasonings, and low calorie Italian dressing, and if making for the next day wait and add the tomatoes that day.
json: {"title": "Spaghetti Salad", "ingredients": ["1 lb. cooked spaghetti", "1 green pepper, diced", "1 diced onion", "1 diced cucumber", "3 stalks diced celery", "3 tomatoes, diced", "1/3 bottle salad seasonings", "low calorie Italian dressing"], "directions": ["Cook spaghetti.", "Dice vegetables together.", "After spaghetti is cooked and cooled, add vegetables, salad seasonings and Italian dressing.", "Mix.", "If making for next day, wait and add tomatoes that day."]}

text: Ham Balls Combine 1 lb. grated ham with 8 oz. sharp Cheddar cheese softened and 3 c. Bisquick, roll into balls, and bake 10 minutes.
json: {"title": "Ham Balls", "ingredients": ["1 lb. grated ham", "8 oz. sharp Cheddar cheese, softened", "3 c. Bisquick"], "directions": ["Roll in balls and bake 10 minutes."]}

text: Low Cholesterol Ice Cream Beat 1 box Egg Scramblers (2 eggs) in a large bowl, mix in 1 (13 oz.) skim evaporated milk, 2 c. sugar, and 1 Tbsp. vanilla until the sugar dissolves, pour into the freezer and add enough 2% skim milk to fill a 1 gallon freezer, then freeze and enjoy (optional additions: 3 bananas, 1 pint strawberries, or 6 peaches).
json: {"title": "Low Cholesterol Ice Cream", "ingredients": ["1 box Egg Scramblers (2 eggs)", "2 c. sugar", "1 Tbsp. vanilla", "1 (13 oz.) skim evaporated milk", "2 % skim milk"], "directions": ["Beat Scramblers in large bowl.", "Mix in evaporated milk, sugar and vanilla until sugar dissolves.", "Pour into freezer and add enough 2% milk to fill 1 gallon freezer.", "Freeze and enjoy.", "Can add 3 bananas, 1 pint strawberries or 6 peaches."]}

text: Glop Slice 3 to 5 potatoes thin and 1 small onion and place in the bottom of a pan, drain and add 1 can green beans on top, add 1 lb. hamburger cooked and drained as the next layer, pour 1 can celery soup over the hamburger, place 1 can biscuits on top, spread 1 can cheese soup over the biscuits, and bake at 350° for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Glop", "ingredients": ["1 small onion", "3 to 5 potatoes, sliced thin", "1 can green beans", "1 lb. hamburger, cooked and drained", "1 can celery soup", "1 can cheese soup", "1 can biscuits"], "directions": ["Slice potatoes and onion.", "Put on bottom of pan.", "Drain green beans and put on top.", "Layer hamburger over beans.", "Pour celery over hamburger.", "Place biscuits on top.", "Spread cheese soup over biscuits.", "Bake at 350° for 1 hour."]}

text: Spanakopeta (Spinach Squares) Sauté 2 bunches green onion finely chopped and 1 onion finely chopped in 1/4 lb. butter until soft, add 2 pkg. frozen chopped spinach thawed and drained and sauté a few minutes longer then cool, mix in 1/2 lb. cream cheese softened, 1/2 lb. Feta cheese crumbled, 8 eggs, 1 tsp. salt, and pepper to taste, layer 10 sheets of 1 lb. phyllo pastry in a 12 x 16 x 2-inch pan brushing each with melted butter or margarine, spread the spinach mixture, top with another 10 sheets brushing each with melted butter, bake at 350° for 30 minutes, and cut into squares before serving (you can brush with a slightly beaten egg before baking for extra luster).
json: {"title": "Spanakopeta(Spinach Squares)", "ingredients": ["2 bunches green onion, finely chopped", "1 onion, finely chopped", "1/4 lb. butter", "2 pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained", "1/2 lb. pkg. cream cheese, softened", "1/2 lb. Feta cheese, crumbled", "8 eggs", "1 tsp. salt", "pepper to taste", "1 lb. phyllo pastry sheets", "melted butter or margarine"], "directions": ["Saut onions in butter until soft.", "Add spinach and saut a few minutes longer; cool.", "Add cream cheese, Feta, eggs, salt and pepper; mix well.", "Place 10 layers of phyllo pastry sheets in a 12 x 16 x 2-inch pan, brushing each sheet well with melted butter. Add spinach mixture, then place another 10 layers of phyllo, buttering each sheet.", "Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.", "Cut into squares before serving.", "You can brush the spanakopeta with a slightly beaten egg before baking for a nice luster.", "I use margarine as all butter is very rich."]}

text: Hot And Spicy Chicken Combine 3 chicken breasts skinned cooked and chopped with 10 oz. frozen corn, 1/2 c. chicken broth, 1/2 c. diced celery, and 1/2 c. onion (thin wedges), bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered 15 minutes, stir in 1/2 c. taco salsa, mix 2 tablespoons water into 4 tsp. cornstarch and add to the chicken mixture, cook and stir until it bubbles then cook 2 minutes more, prepare 1 (8 1/2 oz.) pkg. cornbread mix according to package, pour chicken mixture into a 10 x 6 x 2-inch dish, sprinkle with 1 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese and 2 (4 oz.) cans diced jalapeno peppers drained, spoon cornbread on top, and bake 20 minutes at 425°.
json: {"title": "Hot And Spicy Chicken", "ingredients": ["3 chicken breasts, skinned, cooked and chopped", "10 oz. frozen corn", "1/2 c. diced celery", "1/2 c. chicken broth", "1/2 c. onion (thin wedges)", "4 tsp. cornstarch", "1 (8 1/2 oz.) pkg. cornbread mix", "1 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese", "2 (4 oz.) cans diced jalapeno peppers, drained", "1/2 c. taco salsa"], "directions": ["Combine chicken, corn, broth, celery and onion.", "Bring to a boil.", "Reduce heat; simmer for 15 minutes, uncovered.", "Add salsa. Stir 2 tablespoons water into cornstarch.", "Add to chicken mixture. Cook and stir until bubbles.", "Cook an additional 2 minutes. Prepare cornbread according to package.", "Pour chicken mixture into a 10 x 6 x 2-inch dish.", "Sprinkle with cheese and jalapeno peppers. Spoon cornbread on top.", "Bake for 20 minutes at 425°."]}

text: Oven Swiss Steak Shake 1 tablespoon flour in a large size oven cooking bag, add 1 1/2 lb. round (or sirloin) steak cut in pieces, 16 oz. can Italian seasoned tomatoes, 1 envelope Lipton onion soup mix (dry), salt and pepper to taste, and 1/4 c. water, squeeze to mix, tie the bag and place in a 9 x 13-inch pan, slit the bag with 6 (1/2") cuts to vent, bake at 325° for approximately 2 hours, then slit open and put back in pan to serve.
json: {"title": "Oven Swiss Steak", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 lb. round (or sirloin) steak, cut in pieces", "16 oz. can Italian seasoned tomatoes", "1 envelope Lipton onion soup mix (dry)", "salt and pepper to taste", "1/4 c. water", "large size oven cooking bag"], "directions": ["Shake 1 tablespoon flour in the oven cooking bag.", "Add all ingredients to bag and squeeze to mix.", "Tie bag and place in a 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Slit bag with 6 (1/2\") cuts to vent.", "Bake at 325° for approximately 2 hours.", "Slit open and put back in pan to serve."]}

text: Monster Cookies Mix 12 eggs beaten with 2 lb. brown sugar, 4 c. white sugar, 1 Tbsp. vanilla, 8 tsp. soda, 18 c. oatmeal, 1 lb. chocolate chips, 1 lb. M&M candies, 1 Tbsp. syrup, and 3 lb. peanut butter (makes lots of cookies!!!).
json: {"title": "Monster Cookies", "ingredients": ["12 eggs, beaten", "2 lb. brown sugar", "4 c. white sugar", "1 Tbsp. vanilla", "8 tsp. soda", "18 c. oatmeal", "1 lb. chocolate chips", "1 lb. M&M candies", "1 Tbsp. syrup", "3 lb. peanut butter"], "directions": ["Makes lots of cookies!!!"]}

text: Garlic Cheese Ball Let 1 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese and 1 small jar Kraft garlic cheese spread soften to room temperature, blend both cheeses until thoroughly mixed, shape into one big ball, chill, roll in 1/2 c. crushed pecans, and serve with any type crackers.
json: {"title": "Garlic Cheese Ball", "ingredients": ["1 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese", "1 small jar Kraft garlic cheese spread", "1/2 c. crushed pecans"], "directions": ["Let cheese soften to room temperature, then blend both cheeses together until thoroughly mixed.", "Shape into one big ball.", "Chill. Roll in crushed pecans.", "Serve with any type crackers."]}

text: Seven Layer Salad Layer 1 head lettuce chopped, 1/2 c. chopped celery, 1/2 c. chopped green pepper, and 1 pkg. frozen green peas (10 oz.) cooked and drained, spread 1 c. mayonnaise over the top, sprinkle with 2 Tbsp. sugar, add 8 oz. Cheddar cheese shredded, seal and refrigerate overnight, then the next day mix and optionally add cooked bacon (approximately 8 slices, chopped).
json: {"title": "Seven Layer Salad", "ingredients": ["1 head lettuce, chopped (for bottom layer)", "1/2 c. chopped celery (next layer)", "1/2 c. chopped green pepper (next layer)", "1 pkg. frozen green peas (10 oz.), cooked and drained (next layer)", "1 c. mayonnaise, spread over top", "2 Tbsp. sugar, sprinkled on top of mayonnaise", "8 oz. Cheddar cheese, shredded (next layer)"], "directions": ["Seal and refrigerate overnight. Next day, mix. Can add cooked bacon (approximately 8 slices, chopped)."]}

text: Judy’s Vegetable Tortellini Sauté 1 bag frozen chopped onions with 1/2 tsp. minced garlic in 2 Tbsp. butter and 2 Tbsp. oil until transparent, add 1 lb. pkg. creamed spinach softened and 1 pt. heavy cream and simmer, stir in 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese and 1/2 c. Romano cheese then shut heat off, cook 1 lb. box dry tortellini according to package directions, then combine everything when the tortellini are tender and serve hot.
json: {"title": "Judy'S Vegetable Tortellini", "ingredients": ["1 bag frozen chopped onions", "1/2 tsp. minced garlic", "2 Tbsp. oil", "2 Tbsp. butter", "1 lb. pkg. creamed spinach, softened", "1/2 c. Parmesan cheese", "1/2 c. Romano cheese", "1 lb. box dry tortellini", "1 pt. heavy cream"], "directions": ["Saute onions and garlic in butter and oil until transparent. Add spinach and heavy cream.", "Simmer; throw in cheeses.", "Stir and shut heat off.", "Make tortellini according to directions on box. Mix all ingredients when tortellini are tender.", "Serve hot."]}

text: Beef Tips With Rice Mix 1 lb. stew meat with 1 pkg. Lipton onion soup mix and 2 cans cream of mushroom soup in a glass baking dish, cover and bake at 325° until tender, and serve over cooked rice.
json: {"title": "Beef Tips With Rice", "ingredients": ["1 lb. stew meat", "1 pkg. Lipton onion soup mix", "2 cans cream of mushroom soup"], "directions": ["Mix ingredients in glass baking dish.", "Cover and bake until tender at 325°.", "Serve over cooked rice."]}

text: Pumpkin Bread Sift 3 1/2 c. flour and resift with 2 tsp. baking soda, 1 tsp. cinnamon, 1 tsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. cloves, and 1 tsp. nutmeg, beat 4 eggs beaten well and add 3 c. sugar gradually, add 1 (15 oz.) can pumpkin, then on low speed add 1 c. oil, 2/3 c. water, 1 tsp. vanilla, and the dry ingredients, mix well, pour into 2 greased and floured loaf pans (5 1/2 x 9 1/2 x 2 1/2-inch), and bake at 325° for 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Pumpkin Bread", "ingredients": ["4 eggs, beaten", "1 (15 oz.) can pumpkin", "2/3 c. water", "3 1/2 c. flour", "2 tsp. baking soda", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 tsp. salt", "3 c. sugar", "1 c. oil", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1/2 tsp. cloves", "1 tsp. nutmeg"], "directions": ["Sift flour.", "Measure and resift with dry ingredients.", "Beat eggs well.", "Add sugar gradually.", "Using medium speed of mixer, add pumpkin.", "Reduce to low speed and add oil, water, vanilla and dry ingredients.", "Mix well.", "Pour into 2 greased and floured loaf pans (5 1/2 x 9 1/2 x 2 1/2-inch).", "Bake for 1 hour at 325°."]}

text: Squash Casserole Cook 2 lb. small yellow squash sliced with 1 large onion chopped and 1/4 c. pimento chopped, drain well, stir in 1 c. sour cream, 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can mushroom soup, and 1 (7 oz.) can water chestnuts sliced, spread in the bottom of a greased 3-quart casserole dish along with 1/2 the 1 lb. pkg. Pepperidge Farm stuffing mix and 1/2 stick margarine, add the squash mixture, top with the remaining stuffing mix and 1 (3 oz.) pkg. sliced almonds, dot with the remaining 1/2 stick margarine, and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Squash Casserole", "ingredients": ["2 lb. small yellow squash, sliced", "1 large onion, chopped", "1 (7 oz.) can water chestnuts, sliced", "1 stick margarine", "1/4 c. pimento, chopped", "1 (3 oz.) pkg. sliced almonds", "1 c. sour cream", "1 (10 3/4 oz.) can mushroom soup", "1 lb. pkg. Pepperidge Farm stuffing mix"], "directions": ["Cook", "squash, onions and pimento together.", "Drain well; then add sour cream, mushroom soup and water chestnuts.", "Place in", "the bottom", "of", "a 3-quart greased casserole dish, 1/2 the package", "of stuffing mix and 1/2 stick of margarine.", "Add the squash", "mixture. Put", "the", "other half of the stuffing mix and the", "almonds on top of the casserole.", "Dot with remaining half stick of margarine. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes."]}

text: Bonnie’s Lemon Jello Cake Mix 1 pkg. yellow cake mix with 1 pkg. (3 oz.) lemon jello and 3/4 c. water, add 4 eggs and 3/4 c. oil and beat 2 minutes, bake at 350° for 40 minutes in a 9 x 13-inch pan, and when the cake is done punch holes all over with a large fork.
json: {"title": "Bonnie'S Lemon Jello Cake", "ingredients": ["1 pkg. yellow cake mix", "1 pkg. (3 oz.) lemon jello", "3/4 c. water", "4 eggs", "3/4 c. oil"], "directions": ["Mix cake mix and dry jello with 3/4 cup water.", "Add eggs and oil and beat 2 minutes.", "Bake at 350° for 40 minutes in a 9 x 13-inch pan.", "When cake is done, punch holes in cake (all over) with a large fork."]}

text: Hash Brown Casserole Mix 1 (2 lb.) pkg. hash browns (frozen) with salt and pepper to taste, 1 stick margarine melted, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 (8 oz.) sour cream, 1/2 c. onion chopped, and 1 (8 oz.) Cheddar cheese grated, pour into a 9 x 12-inch pan, and bake at 350° for 1 hour (serves 8 to 10).
json: {"title": "Hash Brown Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 (2 lb.) pkg. hash browns (frozen)", "salt and pepper to taste", "1 stick margarine, melted", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 (8 oz.) sour cream", "1/2 c. onion, chopped", "1 (8 oz.) Cheddar cheese, grated"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients well.", "Pour into 9 x 12-inch pan.", "Bake in a preheated 350° oven for 1 hour.", "Serves 8 to 10."]}

text: Broccoli Casserole Melt 1 stick margarine with 1 small jar Cheez Whiz and 1 can cream of celery soup until creamy, stir in 1 1/3 c. Minute rice (uncooked), 1/2 c. onion chopped, and 1 pkg. frozen chopped broccoli, pour into an ungreased 13 x 9-inch pan, and bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
json: {"title": "Broccoli Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 1/3 c. Minute rice (uncooked)", "1 small jar Cheez Whiz", "1/2 c. onion, chopped", "1 pkg. frozen chopped broccoli", "1 can cream of celery soup", "1 stick margarine"], "directions": ["Melt margarine, cheese and soup until creamy.", "Add rice, onion and broccoli.", "Stir until well blended.", "Pour into ungreased 13 x 9-inch pan.", "Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350°."]}

text: Sausage Casserole (Microwave) In a 10-inch microwave cooker cook 1 lb. pork sausage with 3/4 c. diced onion and 3/4 c. diced green pepper for 6 minutes stirring once, drain off fat, stir in 1 (1 lb. 13 oz.) can whole tomatoes, 1 Tbsp. sugar, 1 Tbsp. chili powder, 1 tsp. salt, and 8 oz. macaroni cooked, cook 6 minutes, stir in 1 c. dairy sour cream, and heat 1 to 2 minutes.
json: {"title": "Sausage Casserole(Microwave)", "ingredients": ["1 lb. pork sausage", "3/4 c. diced onion", "3/4 c. diced green pepper", "1 (1 lb. 13 oz.) can whole tomatoes", "1 Tbsp. sugar", "1 Tbsp. chili powder", "1 tsp. salt", "8 oz. macaroni, cooked", "1 c. dairy sour cream"], "directions": ["In a 10-inch microwave cooker, cook sausage, onion and green pepper for 6 minutes, stirring once.", "Drain off fat.", "Stir tomatoes, sugar, chili powder, salt and cooked macaroni into sausage mixture.", "Cook 6 minutes.", "Stir in sour cream.", "Heat 1 to 2 minutes."]}

text: Chewy Oatmeal Cookies Heat oven to 375°, lightly grease a baking sheet with butter flavor Crisco, beat 3/4 c. butter flavor Crisco shortening with 1 1/4 c. firmly packed light brown sugar, 1 egg, 1/3 c. milk, and 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla flavor, combine 1 c. all-purpose flour with 3 c. Quaker oats (quick or old fashioned, uncooked), 1/2 tsp. baking soda, 1/2 tsp. salt (optional), and 1/4 tsp. cinnamon, mix dry ingredients into the creamed mixture on low speed until blended, stir in 1 c. raisins and 1 c. coarsely chopped walnuts, drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart, bake 10 to 15 minutes until lightly brown, cool, and serve.
json: {"title": "Chewy Oatmeal Cookies", "ingredients": ["3/4 c. butter flavor Crisco shortening", "1 1/4 c. firmly packed light brown sugar", "1 egg", "1/3 c. milk", "1 1/2 tsp. vanilla flavor", "1 c. all-purpose flour", "3 c. Quaker oats (quick or old fashioned, uncooked)", "1/2 tsp. baking soda", "1/2 tsp. salt (optional)", "1/4 tsp. cinnamon", "1 c. raisins", "1 c. coarsely chopped walnuts"], "directions": ["Heat oven to 375°.", "Lightly grease baking sheet with butter flavor Crisco.", "Combine Crisco, brown sugar, egg, milk and vanilla in a large bowl.", "Beat at medium speed with mixer.", "Blend well. Combine oats, flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.", "Mix into creamed mixture at low speed until blended.", "Stir in raisins and nuts.", "Drop rounded tablespoonful of dough 2-inches apart.", "Bake for 10 to 15 minutes, or until lightly brown.", "Cool, then serve."]}

text: Flavorful Fish Arrange 1 (4 oz.) fish fillet in a shallow plate, pour 1 Tbsp. lemon juice over it and sprinkle with 1/8 tsp. garlic powder and 1/4 tsp. paprika, top with 1 Tbsp. chopped parsley, cover with plastic wrap, and microwave for 2 minutes.
json: {"title": "Flavorful Fish", "ingredients": ["1 (4 oz.) fish fillet", "1 Tbsp. lemon juice", "1/8 tsp. garlic powder", "1/4 tsp. paprika", "1 Tbsp. chopped parsley"], "directions": ["Arrange fish in shallow plate.", "Pour lemon juice over fish and sprinkle with garlic powder and paprika.", "Top with parsley.", "Cover with plastic wrap and microwave for 2 minutes."]}

text: Beef And Shell Bake Cook 1/2 pkg. Creamette shells as directed and drain, brown 1 lb. ground beef with 1 1/2 c. celery diced and 1 c. onion chopped and drain excess fat, add 1 (28 oz.) can whole tomatoes with liquid (break up with a spoon), 1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste, 2 tsp. salt, 1 tsp. oregano, and 1/4 tsp. pepper and simmer 5 minutes, combine with the shells, pour into a 3-quart casserole, top with 1 c. American cheese grated, and bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Beef And Shell Bake", "ingredients": ["1/2 pkg. Creamette shells", "1 lb. ground beef", "1 1/2 c. celery, diced", "1 c. onion, chopped", "1 (28 oz.) can whole tomatoes", "1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste", "2 tsp. salt", "1 tsp. oregano", "1/4 tsp. pepper", "1 c. American cheese, grated"], "directions": ["Prepare Creamette shells according to package directions. Drain.", "Cook ground beef, celery and onion.", "Drain excess fat. Add tomatoes with liquid (breaking up with spoon), tomato paste, salt, oregano and pepper.", "Simmer 5 minutes.", "Combine meat mixture with shells and pour into a 3-quart casserole.", "Top with cheese. Bake in a 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes."]}

text: Boiled Dressing Beat 2 eggs, add 1 Tbsp. flour, 1 c. sugar, 1/2 c. vinegar, 1/2 c. water, a pinch of salt, and cook on low heat until thick, then when almost done add 2 Tbsp. butter (you can add dry mustard or celery seed).
json: {"title": "Boiled Dressing", "ingredients": ["2 eggs", "1 Tbsp. flour", "1 c. sugar", "1/2 c. vinegar", "1/2 c. water", "pinch of salt", "2 Tbsp. butter"], "directions": ["Beat eggs.", "Add other ingredients in order given, except butter.", "When almost done, add butter.", "Cook on low heat until thick.", "Can add dry mustard or celery seed."]}

text: Easy Chicken ’N Dumplings Heat 1 qt. chicken broth (with some chicken) and thicken it like thin gravy, mix 2 c. flour with 2 tsp. baking powder and 1 tsp. salt, add milk until the dough is like drop biscuits, drop spoonfuls onto the boiling broth, cover with a lid, and cook about 10 to 15 minutes.
json: {"title": "Easy Chicken 'N Dumplings", "ingredients": ["1 qt. chicken broth (with some chicken)", "2 c. flour", "2 tsp. baking powder", "1 tsp. salt", "milk"], "directions": ["Heat broth.", "Thicken broth as", "thin", "gravy.", "Mix flour, baking powder and salt.", "Add milk as", "for drop biscuits.", "Drop onto boiling broth.", "Put lid on.", "Cook about 10 to 15 minutes."]}

text: Kidney Bean Casserole Brown 1 lb. ground beef with 1 1/2 medium onion chopped in 2 Tbsp. vegetable oil, add 1 can tomato soup and simmer 15 minutes, stir in 4 oz. elbow macaroni cooked, 1 can kidney beans, 1 tsp. salt, 1/8 tsp. pepper, and 1 tsp. chili powder, pour into a casserole dish, top with 1/2 c. grated cheese, and bake at 375° for 20 minutes.
json: {"title": "Kidney Bean Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 lb. ground beef", "1 1/2 medium onion, chopped", "2 Tbsp. vegetable oil", "4 oz. elbow macaroni, cooked", "1 can tomato soup", "1 can kidney beans", "1 tsp. salt", "1/8 tsp. pepper", "1 tsp. chili powder", "1/2 c. grated cheese"], "directions": ["Brown beef and onions in oil.", "Add soup and simmer 15 minutes. Add macaroni, beans and seasonings; heat.\tPour in casserole dish.", "Top with grated cheese.", "Bake 20 minutes at 375°."]}

text: Apple Salad Mix 2 eggs beaten with 1 1/2 Tbsp. cornstarch, 1 small can crushed pineapple (do not drain), 1 c. sugar, and 1/4 stick butter or margarine, cook until thick (approximately 7 minutes in the microwave), pour over 6 medium-size apples cubed and 1 cup of marshmallows, let cool, and add nuts or raisins if desired.
json: {"title": "Apple Salad", "ingredients": ["2 eggs, beaten", "1 1/2 Tbsp. cornstarch", "1 small can crushed pineapple (do not drain)", "1 c. sugar", "1/4 stick butter or margarine"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients together.", "Cook until thick (approximately 7 minutes in microwave).", "Pour over 6 medium-size apples, cubed, and 1 cup of marshmallows.", "Let cool.", "Add nuts or raisins, if desired."]}

text: Tomato Aspic Soften 2 pkg. Knox gelatine in 1/2 c. cold tomato juice, then add 2 1/2 c. hot tomato juice, 1 Tbsp. lemon juice, 1 tsp. Tabasco sauce, 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce, 1/4 tsp. salt, 1 tsp. sugar, 1/4 c. olives, and 1 c. celery and mix together.
json: {"title": "Tomato Aspic", "ingredients": ["2 pkg. Knox gelatine", "1/2 c. cold tomato juice", "2 1/2 c. hot tomato juice", "1 Tbsp. lemon juice", "1 tsp. Tabasco sauce", "1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce", "1/4 tsp. salt", "1/4 c. olives", "1 c. celery", "1 tsp. sugar"], "directions": ["Mix together the gelatin in cold tomato juice.", "Put into mixture of remaining ingredients."]}

text: Texas Prize Cake Grease and flour the bottom of a 10-inch tube pan, cream 4 sticks butter with 2 2/3 c. sugar, add 9 eggs one at a time beating after each, sift 3 c. flour and add to the creamed mixture, add 1 Tbsp. flavoring (vanilla or lemon), pour into the pan, bake at 325° for 1 hour or until done, and cool in pan 5 minutes.
json: {"title": "Texas Prize Cake", "ingredients": ["4 sticks butter", "2 2/3 c. sugar", "9 eggs", "3 c. flour", "1 Tbsp. flavoring (vanilla or lemon)"], "directions": ["Grease and flour bottom of 10-inch tube pan.", "Cream the butter and sugar.", "Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each.", "Sift flour and add to creamed mixture.", "Add vanilla.", "Pour in pan. Bake at 325° for 1 hour or until done.", "Cool in pan 5 minutes."]}

text: Springerle Beat 4 eggs until light, add 2 c. sugar and beat until very stiff and light (about 15 minutes at high speed), add 1 tsp. almond extract, 4 c. flour, and 3/4 tsp. baking soda and mix thoroughly, roll out on a lightly floured surface to 1/2 to 1/4-inch thickness, roll with a springerle rolling pin to 1/4-inch thickness pressing only once for a clear imprint, then cut along dividing lines to separate cookies.
json: {"title": "Springerle", "ingredients": ["4 eggs", "1 tsp. almond extract", "3/4 tsp. baking soda", "2 c. sugar", "4 c. flour"], "directions": ["Beat eggs until light.", "Add sugar and beat until mixture is very stiff and light, about 15 minutes at high speed on electric mixer.", "Add extract, flour and soda; mix thoroughly.", "Roll out on lightly floured surface with regular rolling pin to 1/2 to 1/4-inch thickness.", "Roll with springerle rolling pin to 1/4-inch thickness, pressing only once for clear imprint.", "Cut along dividing lines to separate cookies."]}

text: Taco Beans Cook 2 lb. pinto beans, brown 2 lb. ground meat, add 2 cans taco sauce, 1 can roasted green chilies, 1 (No. 2) can tomatoes, 1 tsp. chili powder, 1/2 c. chopped bell pepper, 1/2 tsp. cumin, 2 large onions, and 4 garlic buds and simmer 10 minutes, then add the meat mixture to the beans and simmer 1 hour.
json: {"title": "Taco Beans", "ingredients": ["2 lb. pinto beans", "2 lb. ground meat", "2 cans taco sauce", "1 can roasted green chilies", "1 (No. 2) can tomatoes", "1 tsp. chili powder", "1/2 c. chopped bell pepper", "1/2 tsp. cumin", "2 large onions", "4 garlic buds"], "directions": ["Cook beans.", "Brown meat, then add other ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes.", "Add meat mixture to beans and simmer for one hour."]}

text: Battered Fried Fish Cut 1 (1 lb.) haddock into serving-size pieces and sprinkle lightly with salt, mix 1 egg with 1 1/4 c. evaporated milk, 1 c. flour, 2 tsp. baking powder, and 1/4 c. cornmeal plus 1/4 teaspoon salt, dip the haddock pieces into the batter, and fry in deep fat at 375° for 5 minutes or until brown.
json: {"title": "Battered Fried Fish", "ingredients": ["1 (1 lb.) haddock", "salt", "1 egg", "1 1/4 c. evaporated milk", "1 c. flour", "2 tsp. baking powder", "1/4 c. cornmeal"], "directions": ["Cut haddock", "into serving-size pieces, sprinkle lightly with salt.", "Mix\t1/4 teaspoon salt with remaining ingredients, dip haddock pieces into", "egg mixture.", "Fry in deep fat at 375° for 5 minutes or until brown."]}

text: Vanilla Pudding Scald 2 c. milk, mix 3/4 c. sugar with 5 round Tbsp. flour and a dash of salt, stir into the scalded milk in a heavy pan or double boiler and stir constantly until thick, add 2 eggs slightly beaten and cook 2 minutes more, remove from heat and stir in 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine and 1 tsp. vanilla until smooth.
json: {"title": "Vanilla Pudding", "ingredients": ["3/4 c. sugar", "2 c. milk, scalded", "5 round Tbsp. flour", "2 eggs, slightly beaten", "dash of salt", "1 Tbsp. butter or margarine", "1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Scald milk.", "Mix sugar, flour and salt together.", "Add to scalded milk in heavy pan or double boiler.", "Stir constantly. Cook until thick; add slightly beaten eggs and cook 2 minutes more.", "Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla.", "Stir until smooth and butter melts."]}

text: Blueberry Heaven Supreme Mix 1 (14 oz.) can Eagle Brand milk with 1/2 c. lemon juice until thickened, fold in 1 (21 oz.) can blueberry pie filling and 1 (8 1/4 oz.) can crushed pineapple drained, fold in 1 (8 oz.) container Cool Whip, pour into 2 graham cracker crusts, garnish with graham cracker crumbs and/or miniature marshmallows, and chill in the refrigerator 3 to 4 hours or overnight.
json: {"title": "Blueberry Heaven Supreme", "ingredients": ["1 (21 oz.) can blueberry pie filling", "1 (8 1/4 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained", "1/2 c. lemon juice", "1 (14 oz.) can Eagle Brand milk", "1 (8 oz.) container Cool Whip", "2 graham cracker crusts", "miniature marshmallows"], "directions": ["Mix Eagle Brand milk and lemon juice until thickened.", "Fold in pie filling and drained pineapple.", "Fold in Cool Whip.", "Pour into pie shells.", "Garnish with graham cracker crumbs and/or miniature marshmallows.", "Put in refrigerator and chill 3 or 4 hours or overnight."]}

text: Kraut Salad Toss together 1 (No. 2 1/2) can kraut, 1 c. chopped celery, 1 c. chopped onion, 1 c. chopped green pepper, 1 (4 oz.) jar chopped pimento, 1 c. sugar, 1 c. salad oil, and 1/2 c. white vinegar, cover, and marinate in the refrigerator 24 hours.
json: {"title": "Kraut Salad", "ingredients": ["1 (No. 2 1/2) can kraut", "1 c. chopped celery", "1 c. chopped onion", "1 c. chopped green pepper", "1 (4 oz.) jar chopped pimento", "1 c. sugar", "1 c. salad oil", "1/2 c. white vinegar"], "directions": ["Toss all ingredients together. Cover. Let marinate in the refrigerator 24 hours."]}

text: Peach Pie Mix 1 pt. sour cream with 1/4 c. sugar and 1/4 tsp. vanilla until smooth, fold in 1 large can sliced peaches drained and diced, pour into 1 graham cracker crust, bake at 325° for 25 minutes, cool completely, and refrigerate.
json: {"title": "Peach Pie", "ingredients": ["1 pt. sour cream", "1/4 c. sugar", "1/4 tsp. vanilla", "1 large can sliced peaches, drained and diced", "1 graham cracker crust"], "directions": ["Mix thoroughly sour cream, sugar and vanilla.", "Add well-drained, diced peaches.", "Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake at 325° for 25 minutes.", "Cool completely, then refrigerate."]}

text: Dirt Cups You will also need 8 to 10 (7 oz.) clear plastic cups, then mix 2 c. cold milk with 1 (4 serving size) pkg. chocolate instant pudding, fold in 1 (8 oz.) tub whipped topping, layer with 1 (16 oz.) pkg. chocolate sandwich cookies crushed, and decorate with gummy worms and frogs and candy flowers.
json: {"title": "Dirt Cups", "ingredients": ["2 c. cold milk", "1 (4 serving size) pkg. chocolate instant pudding", "1 (8 oz.) tub whipped topping", "1 (16 oz.) pkg. chocolate sandwich cookies, crushed", "gummy worms and frogs", "candy flowers"], "directions": ["Will also need 8 to 10 (7 oz.) clear plastic cups"]}

text: Finger Jello Mix 4 boxes of small jello with 4 pkg. gelatin, add 5 c. boiling water, dissolve completely, and let set in the refrigerator.
json: {"title": "Finger Jello", "ingredients": ["4 boxes of small jello", "4 pkg. gelatin"], "directions": ["Mix together and add 5 c. boiling water. Dissolve completely. Let set in refrigerator."]}

text: Broccoli and Rice Casserole Cook 1 c. rice and cook 1 pkg. chopped broccoli; sauté 1 chopped onion, then add 1 small jar pimentos, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 small can milk, and 1 small jar Cheez Whiz. Mix everything with the cooked rice and broccoli, pour into a casserole, bake at 350°F for 10 minutes, top with grated cheese, and bake until the cheese is melted.
json: {"title": "Broccoli And Rice Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 c. rice", "1 pkg. chopped broccoli", "1 onion, chopped", "1 small jar pimentos", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 small can milk", "1 small jar Cheez Whiz"], "directions": ["Cook rice. Cook broccoli. Saut the onions. Add pimento, soup, milk and Cheez Whiz. Mix with rice and broccoli. Pour into casserole. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes. Top with grated cheese. Bake until cheese is melted."]}

text: California Cookies Mix 1/2 cup butter or margarine, 1 cup flour, 2 Tbsp. sugar, 1 1/2 cups brown sugar, 1/2 cup coconut, 1 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. baking soda, 1 cup chopped pecans, 2 eggs, 2 Tbsp. flour, and 1 Tbsp. vanilla; once the pan has cooled, top with a mixture of 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, and a few drops of green food coloring mixed well.
json: {"title": "California Cookies", "ingredients": ["1/2 cup butter/margarine", "1 cup flour", "2 Tbsp. sugar", "1-1/2 cups brown sugar", "1/2 cup coconut", "1-1/2 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. baking soda", "1 cup chopped pecans", "2 eggs", "2 Tbsp. flour", "1 Tbsp. vanilla", "1-1/2 cups powdered sugar", "2 Tbsp. lemon juice", "A few drops green food coloring"], "directions": ["Mix well and top after pan has cooled."]}

text: Baked Corn Melt 2 Tbsp. Crisco, add 1 1/2 Tbsp. flour and mix well, then gradually add 1 c. milk and bring to a boil while stirring. Add 2 c. cooked or canned corn, 1 Tbsp. sugar, 1 tsp. salt, and 1/8 tsp. pepper, heat thoroughly, remove from heat, stir in 2 well-beaten eggs, pour into a greased baking dish, and bake at 350°F for 25 minutes or until firm.
json: {"title": "Baked Corn", "ingredients": ["2 Tbsp. Crisco", "1 1/2 Tbsp. flour", "1 c. milk", "2 c. cooked or canned corn", "1 Tbsp. sugar", "1 tsp. salt", "1/8 tsp. pepper", "2 eggs"], "directions": ["Melt Crisco; add flour and mix well.", "Add milk gradually and bring to the boiling point, stirring constantly.", "Add corn, sugar, salt and pepper and heat thoroughly.", "Remove from fire; add well beaten eggs and pour into a greased baking dish.", "Bake in oven at 350° for 25 minutes, or until corn is firm."]}

text: Sour Cream Pound Cake Cream together 2 3/4 c. sugar and 1 c. butter until light and fluffy, add 6 eggs one at a time beating well, sift together 3 c. sifted plain flour, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. soda, add alternately with 1 c. sour cream, beat well, add 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp. lemon extract, and 1/2 tsp. orange extract, pour into a greased and floured 10-inch tube pan, and bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
json: {"title": "Sour Cream Pound Cake", "ingredients": ["6 eggs", "2 3/4 c. sugar", "1 c. butter", "3 c. sifted plain flour", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. soda", "1 c. sour cream", "1/2 tsp. vanilla extract", "1/2 tsp. lemon extract", "1/2 tsp. orange extract"], "directions": ["In mixing bowl cream together sugar and butter until light and fluffy.", "Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each egg. Sift together flour, salt and soda.", "Add to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream, beating after each addition.", "Add extract and beat well.", "Pour batter into a greased and floured 10-inch tube pan.", "Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours."]}

text: Corned Beef Hash Casserole Layer 3 to 4 sliced potatoes and 1 sliced onion in a baking dish, dot with butter or oleo, season with salt and pepper, cover with 1 can corned beef hash, add 1 can creamed corn, top with 1 1/2 c. bread crumbs, cover and bake at 350°F for 10 minutes, then uncover and bake 25 minutes more.
json: {"title": "Corned Beef Hash Casserole", "ingredients": ["3 to 4 potatoes, sliced", "1 onion, sliced", "1/4 c. canned milk", "butter or oleo", "1 can corned beef hash", "1 can creamed corn", "1 1/2 c. bread crumbs"], "directions": ["Layer potatoes and onion in bottom of baking dish.", "Dot with butter or oleo.", "Add salt and pepper.", "Cover with corned beef hash.", "Follow with creamed corn.", "Top with bread crumbs.", "Cover and bake at 350° for 10 minutes.", "Uncover and bake 25 minutes more."]}

text: Lemon Meringue Pie Blend 1 c. sugar, 1/4 tsp. salt, 1/4 c. flour, and 2 Tbsp. cornstarch, stir in 1 1/2 c. water, cook over low heat stirring until thickened, stir some of the hot mixture into 2 beaten egg yolks, combine and cook one minute more, add 1/2 c. lemon juice, grated rind of 1 lemon, and 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine, pour into a baked pastry shell, top with meringue, and brown at 325°F for 14 to 20 minutes.
json: {"title": "Lemon Meringue Pie", "ingredients": ["1 c. sugar", "1/4 tsp. salt", "1/4 c. flour", "2 Tbsp. cornstarch", "1 1/2 c. water", "2 egg yolks", "1 Tbsp. butter or margarine", "1/2 c. lemon juice", "grated rind of 1 lemon"], "directions": ["Blend together sugar, salt, flour and cornstarch.", "Stir in water.", "Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens.", "Stir a little of this hot mixture into beaten egg yolks.", "Combine mixes and cook a minute longer, stirring constantly.", "Add lemon juice, rind and butter.", "Pour in baked pastry shell.", "Brown in slow oven at 325° for 14 to 20 minutes or until meringue is delicately browned."]}

text: Vegetable Spread Grind or grate 3 small carrots, 1 small onion, and 1 small cucumber, drain well, mix 1 large cream cheese with 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise until smooth, add vegetables, season with salt and red pepper, spread on crackers, and top with olives or pimentos.
json: {"title": "Vegetable Spread", "ingredients": ["1 large cream cheese", "3 small carrots", "1 small onion", "1 small cucumber", "3 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "salt/red pepper"], "directions": ["Grind or grate the 3 vegetables.", "Drain well.", "Add mayonnaise to softened cream cheese and mix well.", "Add well drained vegetables, salt and red pepper.", "Spread on crackers.", "Top with olives or pimentos."]}

text: Party Mix Mix together 1 bottle Orville Redenbacher’s buttery flavored popcorn oil and 1 pkg. Ranch dressing mix, then combine cereal (Chex or Crispix), nuts, pretzels, and crackers in a large bowl, pour oil mixture over to coat, and let set for 6 hours, tossing every couple of hours.
json: {"title": "Party Mix", "ingredients": ["1 bottle Orville Redenbacher's buttery flavored popcorn oil", "1 pkg. Ranch dressing mix", "cereal (Chex, Crispix)", "nuts", "pretzels", "crackers (mini Ritz bits)"], "directions": ["Mix together popcorn oil and dressing mix; set aside.", "Put cereal, nuts, pretzels and crackers in big bowl and mix together. Put oil mixture on to coat and let set for 6 hours tossing ingredients together every couple of hours."]}

text: Dick’s Grilled Boneless Leg of Lamb Purée 1 medium onion, 3 cloves garlic, a piece of fresh ginger, and 1/2 seeded jalapeño, mix with 1/4 c. shoyu, 1/4 c. honey, and 2 Tbsp. peanut or cottonseed oil, spread marinade over 1 butterflied leg of lamb, refrigerate overnight, and turn several times.
json: {"title": "Dick'S Grilled Boneless Leg Of Lamb", "ingredients": ["1 butterflied leg of lamb (have butcher prepare it)", "1 medium onion", "3 cloves garlic", "1 piece fresh ginger (about equal in size to total of garlic)", "1/2 medium seeded jalapeno pepper", "1/4 c. shoyu (Kikkoman soy sauce)", "1/4 c. honey", "2 Tbsp. peanut or cottonseed oil"], "directions": ["Puree onion, garlic, ginger and pepper in food processor.", "Mix together with shoyu, honey and oil.", "Spread marinade on both sides of butterflied leg of lamb.", "Put lamb and marinade in a plastic bag in refrigerator.", "Lamb can marinate overnight.", "Turn several times."]}

text: Meat Loaf Combine 2 lb. ground beef, 1/2 lb. ground pork, 1 c. tomato juice, 3/4 c. oats, 2 eggs, 1/3 c. catsup, 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped celery stalk, 1/4 chopped green pepper, 1 grated carrot, 1 tsp. basil, 1 tsp. oregano, 1/4 tsp. paprika, 1/2 tsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. pepper, 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce, 1 Tbsp. parsley flakes, 1/4 tsp. garlic powder, optional 1 can chopped mushrooms, bake in two loaf pans at 400°F for 15 minutes then at 350°F until brown, topping with a glaze of 2 Tbsp. brown sugar, 1/4 c. ketchup, and 1 tsp. mustard if desired.
json: {"title": "Meat Loaf", "ingredients": ["2 lb. ground beef", "1/2 lb. ground pork", "1 c. tomato juice", "3/4 c. oats", "2 eggs", "1/3 c. catsup", "1 onion, chopped", "1 stalk celery, chopped", "1/4 green pepper, chopped", "1 small carrot, grated", "1 tsp. basil leaves", "1 tsp. oregano", "1/4 tsp. paprika", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/2 tsp. pepper", "1 tsp. Worcestershire", "1 Tbsp. parsley flakes", "1/4 tsp. garlic powder", "1 can finely chopped mushrooms (can add)", "2 Tbsp. brown sugar", "1/4 c. ketchup", "1 tsp. mustard"], "directions": ["Bake in two loaf pans in 400° oven for 15 minutes, then in 350° oven until brown.", "Can put glaze on top before baking:"]}

text: Life Saver Cookies Mix 3/4 c. butter, 1 c. sugar, 2 eggs, and 1/2 tsp. lemon extract, blend in 2 1/2 c. flour, 1 tsp. baking powder, and 1/2 tsp. salt, chill 1 hour, roll dough 1/8-inch thick, cut shapes, cut a hole in the center, place on foil-lined sheet, add a Life Saver candy, and bake at 375°F for 7 to 9 minutes; yields 6 dozen.
json: {"title": "Life Saver Cookies", "ingredients": ["3/4 c. butter", "1 c. sugar", "2 eggs", "1/2 tsp. lemon extract", "2 1/2 c. flour", "1 tsp. baking powder", "1/2 tsp. salt", "6 pkg. Life Savers"], "directions": ["Mix together butter, sugar, eggs and lemon extract.", "Blend in flour, baking powder and salt.", "Cover and chill at least 1 hour. Roll dough 1/8-inch thick on a lightly floured board.", "Cut into desired shapes.", "Cut a small hole in center with a sharp knife. Place cookies on foil covered baking sheet.", "Place a Life Saver in the center of each cookie.", "Bake at 375° for 7 to 9 minutes until lightly browned or until candy is melted.", "Cool on baking sheet. Store in layers between wax paper.", "These freeze nicely.", "Yields 6 dozen."]}

text: Banana Chiffon Cake Sift 2 1/4 c. cake flour, 1 c. sugar, 3 tsp. baking powder, 1 tsp. cinnamon, and 1/2 tsp. salt, add 1/2 c. oil, 5 egg yolks, 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, and 2 to 3 mashed bananas, beat smooth, fold in 7 to 8 beaten egg whites with 1/2 tsp. cream of tartar, and bake at 325°F for 1 hour and 10 minutes.
json: {"title": "Banana Chiffon Cake", "ingredients": ["2 1/4 c. sifted cake flour", "1 1/4 c. sugar", "3 tsp. baking powder", "1 tsp. ground cinnamon", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/2 c. vegetable oil", "5 egg yolks", "2 Tbsp. lemon juice", "2 to 3 bananas, mashed (about 1 c.)", "7 to 8 egg whites (1 c.)", "1/2 tsp. cream of tartar"], "directions": ["Sift flour, 1 cup of the sugar, baking powder, cinnamon and salt into medium-size bowl.", "Make a well in center and add in order:", "oil, egg yolks, lemon juice and banana; beat with spoon until smooth.", "Bake at 325° for 1 hour and 10 minutes.", "Makes one 10-inch tube cake.", "Easy to make.", "Needs no frosting and keeps deliciously moist."]}

text: Baked Zesty Italian Chicken Season 4 to 5 boneless skinless chicken breasts with 1 tsp. salt, 1 tsp. pepper, and 1 tsp. garlic, pour 1 bottle Zesty Italian dressing over, top with 1 can Italian bread crumbs, and bake at 375°F for 20 to 25 minutes.
json: {"title": "Baked Zesty Italian Chicken", "ingredients": ["4 to 5 breasts (deboned and skinless)", "1 bottle Zesty Italian dressing", "1 tsp. salt", "1 tsp. pepper", "1 tsp. garlic", "1 can Italian bread crumbs"], "directions": ["Prepare chicken for baking.", "Season chicken with salt, pepper and garlic.", "Pour Italian dressing over chicken.", "Top with Italian bread crumbs.", "Preheat oven.", "Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until tender at 375°.", "Enjoy!"]}

text: Oatmeal Cake Mix 1 c. oats with 1 1/2 c. boiling water and let sit, cream 1 c. brown sugar, 1 c. white sugar, 1 stick margarine, and 2 eggs, add oatmeal, then mix in 1 1/3 c. flour, 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon, 1 tsp. soda, and 1/2 tsp. salt, pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan, and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
json: {"title": "Oatmeal Cake", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 c. boiling water", "1 c. oats", "1 c. brown sugar", "1 c. white sugar", "1 stick margarine", "2 eggs", "1 1/3 c. flour", "1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon", "1 tsp. soda", "1/2 tsp. salt"], "directions": ["Mix oats with boiling water. Let sit. Cream together the sugars, margarine and eggs. Add oatmeal and mix well. Add dry ingredients. Mix well. Pour into greased and floured 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes."]}

text: Fried Apple Pies Simmer 4 c. peeled sliced apples with 4 c. water until tender, mash and add 1/2 c. sugar and 4 tsp. cinnamon, chill, combine 6 c. flour, 1 tsp. salt, and 1 Tbsp. baking powder, cut in 1 1/2 c. vegetable shortening, add 1 c. milk to form dough, chill 1 hour, roll out, fill with apples, seal, and fry in 2 c. vegetable oil at 370°F until brown.
json: {"title": "Fried Apple Pies", "ingredients": ["4 cups of peeled and slice apples", "4 cups of water", "1/2 cup of sugar", "4 teaspoons of cinnamon", "6 cups of flour", "1 teaspoon of salt", "1 tablespoon of baking powder", "1 1/2 cups of vegetable shortening", "1 cup of milk", "2 cups of vegetable oil"], "directions": ["In a saucepan, combine apples and water. Simmer until tender, then cool. Mash apples, stir in sugar and cinnamon. Chill; combine flour, salt and baking powder. Cut in shortening until well blended. Add milk, a little at a time to form dough. Chill for 1 hour. Roll dough out to 1/4 inch thick. Cut into 4 inch rounds. Place about 2 tablespoons of the apple filling in the center of each circle. Moisten the edges with water then fold the pastry in half, pressing the edges together. Heat oil to 370° and fry the pies until brown."]}

text: Carrot Coins (Microwave) Mix 1 lb. sliced carrots, 3 Tbsp. water, 2 Tbsp. parsley, 1 Tbsp. butter or oleo, 1/4 tsp. ground ginger, 1/4 tsp. dried tarragon, 1/8 tsp. garlic salt, and 1/8 tsp. pepper in a casserole, cover, microwave on High 6 to 8 minutes stirring twice, and let stand 3 minutes.
json: {"title": "Carrot Coins(Microwave)", "ingredients": ["1 lb. medium-sized carrots, peeled and cut in 1/4-inch rounds (2 1/4 c.)", "3 Tbsp. water", "2 Tbsp. finely chopped fresh parsley or 1 Tbsp. dried", "1 Tbsp. butter or oleo", "1/4 tsp. ground ginger", "1/4 tsp. dried tarragon, crumbled", "1/8 tsp. garlic salt", "1/8 tsp. pepper (preferably white)"], "directions": ["Mix all ingredients in a 1-quart casserole.", "Cover with lid or vented plastic wrap.", "Microwave on High 6 to 8 minutes, stirring twice,", "until carrots are almost tender.", "Let stand 3 minutes or until", "tender.", "Makes", "4 servings; 73 calories per serving."]}

text: Spiced Fruit Salad Heat reserved pineapple juice from 1/2 c. canned pineapple with 1 cinnamon stick, reduce heat and cook 5 minutes, remove cinnamon, add 1/2 tsp. rum extract, pour over a mixture of 3/4 c. sliced strawberries, 1/2 c. canned peaches, 1/2 c. cantaloupe balls, and pineapple, then refrigerate.
json: {"title": "Spiced Fruit Salad", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. canned pineapple chunks (reserve 1/3 c. juice)", "1 cinnamon stick", "1/2 tsp. rum extract", "3/4 c. sliced fresh strawberries", "1/2 c. canned sliced peaches", "1/2 c. cantaloupe balls"], "directions": ["In saucepan over medium heat, heat pineapple juice and cinnamon stick to boiling.", "Reduce heat.", "Cover and cook about 5 minutes. Remove cinnamon stick.", "Add rum extract.", "In medium bowl, mix strawberries, peaches, cantaloupe and pineapple.", "Pour pineapple juice over fruit and toss.", "Refrigerate.", "Makes 4 (1/2 cup) servings.", "Refreshing diet food."]}

text: Orange-Pineapple Salad Fold together 2 c. mini marshmallows, 1 c. sour cream, 1 drained large can mandarin oranges, and 1 c. drained pineapple chunks, then refrigerate 8 to 12 hours.
json: {"title": "Orange-Pineapple Salad", "ingredients": ["2 c. mini marshmallows", "1 c. sour cream", "1 large can mandarin oranges, drained", "1 c. pineapple chunks, drained"], "directions": ["Fold all ingredients together.", "Refrigerate 8 to 12 hours before serving."]}

text: Coconut Pecan Frosting Cook 1 c. evaporated milk, 1 c. sugar, 3 egg yolks, 1/2 c. butter, and 1 tsp. vanilla over medium heat until thick, add 1 1/3 c. coconut and 1 c. chopped pecans, cool until spreadable, making about 2 1/4 cups.
json: {"title": "Coconut Pecan Frosting", "ingredients": ["1 c. evaporated milk", "1 c. sugar", "3 slightly beaten egg yolks", "1/2 c. butter", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1 1/3 c. Angel Flake coconut", "1 c. chopped pecans"], "directions": ["Mix together first 5 ingredients.", "Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened, about 12 minutes.", "Add coconut and pecans. Cool until thick enough to spread, beating occasionally.", "Makes 2 1/4 cups."]}

text: Haystacks Melt 1 Tbsp. peanut butter with 1 (6 oz.) pkg. butterscotch morsels, stir in 1 (3 oz.) can chow mein noodles and 1 c. roasted peanuts, drop onto wax paper, and chill until set.
json: {"title": "Haystacks", "ingredients": ["1 Tbsp. smooth peanut butter", "1 (3 oz.) can chow mein noodles", "1 (6 oz.) pkg. butterscotch morsels", "1 c. roasted peanuts"], "directions": ["Melt peanut butter and morsels together in a saucepan over low heat.", "Add noodles and peanuts to mixture until well coated.", "Form little clusters on wax paper and allow to harden in refrigerator. Makes 24 pieces."]}

text: Triple Fudge Cake Cook 1 (3 oz.) pkg. chocolate pudding, blend in 1 cake mix, pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan, sprinkle with 1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips and chopped nuts, bake at 350°F for 30 to 35 minutes, and serve with whipped cream.
json: {"title": "Triple Fudge Cake", "ingredients": ["1 (3 oz.) pkg. chocolate pudding and pie filling", "1 chocolate or white cake mix", "1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips", "chopped nuts", "whipped cream"], "directions": ["Cook pudding according to directions.", "Blend cake mix into hot pudding.", "Pour into greased 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts over top.", "Bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.", "Serve with whipped cream."]}

text: Skillet Barbecue Beans Brown 1/2 lb. pork sausage with 1/2 c. onion and 1/4 c. green pepper, drain, stir in 1 (28 oz.) can pork and beans and 1 envelope barbecue seasoning, and simmer 15 minutes.
json: {"title": "Skillet Barbecue Beans", "ingredients": ["1/2 lb. ground pork sausage", "1/2 c. chopped onion", "1/4 c. chopped green pepper", "1 (28 oz.) can pork and beans", "1 (3 1/2 oz.) envelope barbecue flavored seasoning and coating mix (for pork)"], "directions": ["Cook sausage, onion and green pepper in a large skillet until sausage browns and crumbles. Drain.", "Stir in beans and seasoning mix.", "Cook over low heat 15 minutes, stirring occasionally."]}

text: Broccoli Casserole Sauté 1/2 c. celery and 1/2 c. onion in 1/2 c. butter, add 1 c. cream of chicken soup and bring to a boil, stir in 1/2 pkg. broccoli, 2 c. cooked rice, and 1 c. grated cheese, and bake at 350°F until bubbly.
json: {"title": "Broccoli Casserole", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. butter", "1/2 c. celery", "1/2 c. onion, chopped fine", "1 c. cream of chicken soup", "1/2 pkg. broccoli, chopped", "2 c. cooked rice", "1 c. grated cheese"], "directions": ["Melt butter and saute celery and onion.", "Add 1 cup cream of chicken soup and bring to boil.", "Add broccoli, rice and cheese. Cook at 350° until bubbly."]}

text: Peanut Butter Sticks Freeze 1 loaf bread, cut each slice into 5 strips, bake at 200°F for 1 1/2 hours, melt 1 jar peanut butter with 1/2 c. oil, then coat sticks and roll in a mixture of 1 c. graham cracker crumbs and 1 1/2 c. confectioners sugar.
json: {"title": "Peanut Butter Sticks", "ingredients": ["1 loaf sandwich bread", "1 jar peanut butter (12 oz.)", "1/2 c. cooking oil", "1 c. graham cracker crumbs", "1 1/2 c. confectioners sugar"], "directions": ["Freeze bread to slice it.", "Cut each slice into 5 strips, leaving crust on.", "Place on baking sheet and bake 1 1/2 hours at 200° oven.", "Mix cooking oil and peanut butter in top of double boiler.", "Cook until boiling point, stirring until well mixed."]}

text: Cinnamon Pull-Aparts Soften yeast in 1/4 c. lukewarm water, combine shortening, sugar, salt, flour, scalded milk, eggs, yeast, vanilla, and remaining ingredients as listed, then prepare and bake according to the full layered dough and pudding method provided.
json: {"title": "Cinnamon Pull-Aparts", "ingredients": ["1 bag frozen rolls (Rhodes)", "1 small pkg. vanilla or butterscotch pudding mix (regular, not instant)", "3/4 c. melted butter", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 c. chopped nuts", "3/4 c. brown sugar", "1 qt. milk", "2/3 lb. butter or margarine", "1 1/2 c. sugar", "2 tsp. salt", "1 tsp. cardamon", "3 cakes yeast (fast-rising)", "12 c. flour", "3 eggs, beaten", "1 lb. mixed candied fruit (fruit cake mix)", "1 c. raisins", "1 pkg. dry yeast or 1 cake yeast (found in the dairy section of the grocery store)", "1/4 c. lukewarm water", "3/4 c. shortening", "1/2 c. sugar", "1/2 tsp. salt", "4 c. flour", "1 c. milk, scalded", "3 whole eggs", "1 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Soften dry yeast in 1/4 cup lukewarm water.", "In a large bowl, combine and mix like pie crust until crumbly the shortening, sugar, salt and 2 cups flour.", "Scald milk and add to the dry ingredients in the bowl.", "Stir until smooth.", "Then add whole eggs, one at a time, and beat well. Add softened yeast and vanilla."]}

text: Apple Dumplins Place apple slices into 2 cans crescent rolls, roll up, place in a 9 x 13 dish, pour over a mixture of 2 sticks margarine, 1 1/2 c. sugar, and 1 tsp. cinnamon, add 1 (12 oz.) can Mountain Dew, and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
json: {"title": "Apple Dumplins", "ingredients": ["2 cans refrigerated crescent dinner rolls", "2 Granny Smith +cooking apples, peeled and cut in 8 pieces", "2 sticks margarine", "1 1/2 c. sugar", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "1 12 oz. can regular Mountain Dew, not diet"], "directions": ["Place 1 apple slice in each triangle of the crescent dough. Roll from large end to smaller.", "Place all rolled up slices in a 9 X 13 inch baking dish.", "In a small saucepan, melt margarine, then stir in sugar and cinnamon.", "Pour this mixture over all the rolled up slices and then pour Mountain Dew over all and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.", "Good served with ice cream."]}

text: Hot Tuna Appetizer Combine 1 can tuna, 12 chopped anchovies, 3/4 c. green pepper, 1/2 c. pimento, 1 chopped hard-cooked egg, 3 chopped green onions, and 2 Tbsp. Russian dressing, spread on sautéed bread slices, top with remaining dressing mixed with 1 1/2 Tbsp. cognac and Worcestershire sauce, and heat until hot.
json: {"title": "Hot Tuna Appetizer", "ingredients": ["1 (7 oz.) can water-packed tuna, drained and flaked", "12 anchovy fillets, chopped", "3/4 c. chopped green pepper", "1/2 c. chopped pimento", "1 egg, hard-cooked and chopped", "3 green onions, chopped", "1 c. Russian dressing", "1 1/2 Tbsp. cognac", "6 Tbsp. butter", "6 thin white bread slices, crusts removed", "1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce"], "directions": ["In medium bowl, combine tuna, anchovies, green pepper, pimento, egg and 2 tablespoons Russian dressing.", "Mix well and set aside.", "In small bowl, mix remaining Russian dressing with cognac and set aside.", "In hot butter in a chafing dish or larger pan, saute bread until well browned and butter is absorbed.", "In same pan, spread tuna mixture over bread.", "Cover with Russian dressing mixture.", "Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce over each. Heat over low heat for 5 to 10 minutes or until very hot.", "Serve immediately."]}

text: Low-Fat Texas Trash Mix cereals to make 5 c. with 2 c. pretzel sticks, toss with 1/8 c. apple juice, 4 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce, 1/4 tsp. garlic powder, and 1 tsp. onion powder, bake at 275°F for 1 hour stirring every 10 minutes.
json: {"title": "Low-Fat Texas Trash", "ingredients": ["1 c. Cheerios", "1 c. Wheat Chex", "2 c. Rice Chex", "1 c. Corn Chex", "2 c. pretzel sticks", "1/8 c. apple juice", "4 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce", "1/4 tsp. garlic powder", "1 tsp. onion powder"], "directions": ["Combine dry cereals to make 5 cups; add pretzel sticks. Combine apple juice, Worcestershire sauce and seasonings.", "Toss with cereals.", "Place on shallow nonstick baking pan.", "Bake at 275° for 1 hour.", "Stir every 10 minutes.", "Cool before serving.", "Serves 8; 90 calories, 1.3 gm fat (13%)."]}

text: Punch Bowl Cake Layer baked yellow cake cubes, prepared vanilla pudding, fruit cocktail, crushed pineapple, cherry pie filling, nuts, coconut, and whipped topping in a punch bowl, repeat layers, garnish with cherries, and chill.
json: {"title": "Punch Bowl Cake", "ingredients": ["2 layer-size yellow cake mix", "2 (3 oz.) boxes instant vanilla pudding", "1 (20 oz.) can fruit cocktail, drained", "2 (8 oz.) cans crushed pineapple with juice", "1 (16 oz.) can cherry pie filling", "2 c. chopped pecans or walnuts", "2 (6 oz.) pkg. shredded or flaked coconut", "2 (8 oz.) c. frozen whipped topping, thawed", "maraschino cherries (optional)"], "directions": ["Prepare cake mix by package directions.", "Bake into layers. Cool layers.", "Prepare 1 box pudding mix.", "Place 1 cake layer (cut into cubes) in bottom of punch bowl.", "Spoon the prepared pudding mix evenly over cake.", "Top with half of fruit cocktail, 1 can pineapple, 1/2 of fruit cocktail, 1/2 of cherry pie filling, 1 cup nuts and 1 package coconut.", "Spread 1 container whipped topping evenly over top.", "Repeat layers.", "Garnish top with maraschino cherries, if desired.", "Chill until ready to serve.", "Refrigerate any leftovers."]}

text: Quick Macaroons Beat 3 to 4 egg whites with 1/4 tsp. cream of tartar until stiff, add 1/2 c. sugar gradually, fold in 1 tsp. lemon juice, 2 tsp. flour, and 1 c. coconut, spoon into lined muffin cups, and bake at 300°F for 30 to 35 minutes.
json: {"title": "Quick Macaroons", "ingredients": ["3 large or 4 medium egg whites", "1 tsp. lemon juice", "1 c. shredded coconut", "1/2 c. sugar", "1/4 tsp. cream of tartar", "2 tsp. all-purpose flour"], "directions": ["Heat oven to 300°.", "Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners. Put room temperature egg whites in medium all metal or glass bowl with cream of tartar and beat at high speed until foamy. Add sugar, 2 tablespoons at a time, beating until whites hold stiff glossy peaks.", "Add lemon juice and flour.", "Fold in with a spatula until blended.", "Fold in coconut.", "Spoon into the lined muffin cups. Bake 30 to 35 minutes. Cool on a rack.", "As soon as you can, remove them from the pan."]}

text: Seafood Casserole Boil 2 c. water with 1/2 c. white wine, cook 2 lb. shrimp 3 minutes and 1 lb. scallops 6 minutes, reserve liquid, then prepare casserole with remaining ingredients as directed.
json: {"title": "Seafood Casserole", "ingredients": ["2 lb. shrimp", "1 lb. scallops", "1/4 c. flour", "3 Tbsp. butter or margarine", "1 c. chopped mushrooms (optional)", "1 onion, chopped", "1 c. light cream", "1 c. buttered Ritz crackers", "2 c. water", "1/2 c. white wine"], "directions": ["Boil water and wine.", "Cook shrimp in water 3 minutes.", "Remove and cook scallops in same liquid for 6 minutes.", "Reserve 1 cup liquid for later."]}

text: Cheese Ball Let 1 lb. mild Cheddar, 1 lb. sharp Cheddar, 1 lb. Velveeta, and 1 lb. cream cheese soften, blend until fluffy, add 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce and 1 chopped onion, chill, shape into balls, and roll in chopped nuts.
json: {"title": "Cheese Ball", "ingredients": ["1 lb. Cheddar cheese (mild)", "1 lb. Cheddar cheese (sharp)", "1 lb. Velveeta cheese", "1 lb. cream cheese", "1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce", "1 medium onion, chopped", "chopped nuts"], "directions": ["Allow cheese to set at room temperature.", "Cut into chunks and blend until fluffy.", "Add Worcestershire sauce and onion.", "Cool in refrigerator and shape into two or three balls.", "Roll in chopped nuts."]}

text: Banana Split Cake Mix 2 c. graham cracker crumbs with 1 stick melted oleo, press into pan, beat 2 c. powdered sugar with 2 sticks oleo and 2 eggs for 15 minutes, pour over crust, top with bananas, pineapple, Cool Whip, nuts, and cherries, and refrigerate overnight.
json: {"title": "Banana Split Cake", "ingredients": ["2 c. graham cracker crumbs", "3 sticks oleo", "2 eggs", "2 c. powdered sugar", "1 (No. 2) can crushed pineapple", "2 or more bananas", "1 large Cool Whip", "nuts and chopped cherries"], "directions": ["Combine graham cracker crumbs and 1 stick melted oleo.", "Pat in bottom of pan. Beat 2 cups powdered sugar, 2 sticks oleo and eggs 15 minutes.", "Pour over crumb mixture. Slice layer of bananas on this. Spread drained pineapple, then Cool Whip on top.", "Sprinkle with nuts and cherries.", "Refrigerate overnight."]}

text: English Muffin Loaf Combine 6 c. flour, 2 pkg. yeast, 1 Tbsp. sugar, 2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. soda, add warmed milk and water, beat well, spoon into greased pans sprinkled with cornmeal, let rise 45 minutes, and bake at 400°F for 25 minutes.
json: {"title": "English Muffin Loaf", "ingredients": ["2 pkg. yeast", "6 c. flour", "1 Tbsp. sugar", "2 tsp. salt", "2 c. milk", "1/4 tsp. baking soda", "1/2 c. water", "cornmeal"], "directions": ["Combine 3 cups flour, yeast, sugar, salt and soda.", "Heat liquid until very warm (120° to 130°).", "Add to dry ingredients. Beat well.", "Stir in rest of flour to make stiff batter.", "Spoon into 2 8 1/2 x 4 1/2-inch loaf pans that have been greased and sprinkled with cornmeal.", "Sprinkle tops with cornmeal and cover. Let rise in warm place for 45 minutes.", "Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.", "Remove immediately."]}

text: Sweet Potato Casserole Combine 3 c. mashed sweet potatoes, 1 c. sugar, 1/2 tsp. salt, 2 beaten eggs, 1/2 stick melted margarine, 1/2 c. milk, and 1/2 tsp. vanilla, pour into a casserole, and bake.
json: {"title": "Sweet Potato Casserole", "ingredients": ["3 c. cooked sweet potatoes, mashed", "1 c. sugar", "1/2 tsp. salt", "2 eggs, beaten", "1/2 stick margarine, melted", "1/2 c. milk", "1/2 tsp. vanilla"], "directions": ["Combine ingredients and pour into casserole dish."]}

text: Crock-Pot Kielbasa Boil 2 or 3 kielbasa in 3 cans beer for 10 minutes, combine 1 bottle ketchup, 1 jar mustard, 1 tsp. vinegar, and 3/4 c. brown sugar in crock-pot, add sliced kielbasa, and cook on High 2 to 3 hours or Low 3 to 5 hours.
json: {"title": "Crock-Pot Kielbasa", "ingredients": ["3 cans beer", "1 small bottle ketchup", "1 small jar mustard", "1 tsp. vinegar", "3/4 c. brown sugar", "2 or 3 kielbasa"], "directions": ["Boil kielbasa in beer for 10 minutes.", "Combine ketchup, mustard, vinegar and sugar in crock-pot.", "Cut kielbasa in small bite size pieces and place in crock-pot.", "Cook on high for 2 to 3 hours or low for 3 to 5 hours.", "Enjoy."]}

text: Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup After the chicken is cooked, skinned, deboned, and the broth reserved, add 1 box chopped garlic, 2 bunches finely chopped green onions, 1 bunch finely chopped parsley leaves, 1 medium chopped onion, 4 chicken bouillon cubes, and 1 can chicken broth to the broth. Bring to a rolling boil, simmer until the onions are tender, then add 1 pkg. spaghetti noodles and cook until the noodles are done; this makes a large pot serving about 10.
json: {"title": "Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup", "ingredients": ["Chicken, cooked and deboned, save broth", "1 box garlic, chopped", "2 bunches green onions, chopped fine", "1 bunch parsley, chopped fine, but not the stems", "1 medium onion, chopped", "4 chicken bouillon cubes", "1 can chicken broth", "1 pkg. spaghetti noodles"], "directions": ["After chicken is cooked, place the rest of the ingredients in the left over broth, except the noodles.", "Bring to a rolling boil. Simmer until onions are done, then add noodles.", "Cook until noodles are done.", "This makes a large pot of soup, for about 10."]}

text: Church Windows Melt 1/2 c. oleo with 1 large package chocolate chips in a saucepan, allow to cool slightly, then stir in 1 c. chopped nuts and 1 large bag miniature colored marshmallows. Shape into 3 logs, spread coconut on wax paper, roll logs in coconut to coat, wrap in wax paper, refrigerate overnight, and slice thin.
json: {"title": "Church Windows", "ingredients": ["1/2 c. oleo", "1 large package chocolate chips", "1 c. chopped nuts", "1 large bag miniature colored marshmallows", "1 can coconut"], "directions": ["Melt oleo and chocolate chips in a sauce pan, cool and add nuts and marshmallows.", "Shape into 3 logs.", "Spread coconut on wax paper and roll logs in coconut to coat.", "Wrap logs in wax paper and refrigerate over night.", "Cut into thin slices."]}

text: Blueberry Dumplings In a Dutch oven bring 2 1/2 c. blueberries, 1/2 c. sugar, 1 c. water, and a dash of salt to a boil, cover and simmer 5 minutes, then add 1 Tbsp. lemon juice. Mix 1 c. self-rising flour, 1/4 c. sugar, and 1/4 tsp. salt, cut in 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine, add 1/2 c. milk, stir just to moisten, drop dough by tablespoons into bubbling sauce, cover tightly, simmer 15 minutes without uncovering, and serve hot; serves 6.
json: {"title": "Blueberry Dumplings", "ingredients": ["2 1/2 c. blueberries (fresh or frozen)", "1/2 c. sugar", "1 c. water", "1 Tbsp. lemon juice", "1 c. self-rising flour", "1/4 c. sugar", "2 Tbsp. butter or margarine", "1/2 c. milk"], "directions": ["In Dutch oven with tight fitting lid, bring blueberries, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 cup water and dash of salt to boiling. Cover and simmer 5 minutes; add lemon juice. Stir together flour, 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cut in butter until like coarse meal. Add milk; stir only until moistened. Drop from tablespoon into bubbling sauce, making 6 dumplings. Cover tightly; simmer 15 minutes without uncovering. Serve hot. Sprinkle with sugar, if desired. Serves 6."]}

text: Heavenly Hash Whip 1 pt. whipping cream to soft peaks, add 1/4 c. sugar and 1 tsp. vanilla, then fold in 3 c. mini marshmallows and 1 can drained pineapple tidbits (20 oz.), refrigerate, and serve preferably made one day ahead.
json: {"title": "Heavenly Hash", "ingredients": ["1 pt. whipping cream", "3 c. mini marshmallows", "1 tsp. vanilla", "1/4 c. sugar", "1 can drained pineapple tidbits (20 oz.)"], "directions": ["Whip cream to soft peaks.", "Add sugar and vanilla.", "Fold in marshmallows and pineapple.", "Store in refrigerator.", "Tastes best made one day in advance.", "Really good served on plain cake."]}

text: Hamburger Potato Hot Dish Place 6 peeled and sliced potatoes into a large pan, layer with 1 sliced onion and 1 1/2 lb. raw hamburger, pour over 1 large can beef vegetable soup mixed with 1/2 can water, and bake at 350°F for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
json: {"title": "Hamburger Potato Hot Dish", "ingredients": ["6 potatoes, peeled and sliced", "1 onion, sliced", "1 1/2 lb. raw hamburger", "1 large can beef vegetable soup", "1/2 can water"], "directions": ["Place potatoes into large pan.", "Layer onions over top.", "Pour soup and water mixture on top.", "Bake 1 to 1 1/2 hours at 350°."]}

text: Potatoes Romanoff Thaw 1 pkg. frozen hash browns and spread in a 9 x 12-inch baking dish, top with 1/2 c. crushed cornflakes and 1/2 c. margarine. Sauté 1 small onion in 2 Tbsp. oleo, stir in 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 can Cheddar cheese soup, 1 (13 oz.) can evaporated milk, 1 c. sour cream, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper, pour over potatoes, and bake for 50 minutes.
json: {"title": "Potatoes Romanoff", "ingredients": ["1 pkg. frozen hash browns", "1 small onion", "2 Tbsp. oleo", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "1 can Cheddar cheese soup", "1/2 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. pepper", "1 c. sour cream", "1 (13 oz.) can evaporated milk (not diluted)", "1/2 c. crushed cornflakes", "1/2 c. margarine"], "directions": ["Thaw potatoes; spread over 9 x 12-inch baking dish.", "Top with cornflakes and margarine.", "In saucepan, saute onion in 2 tablespoons oleo.", "Stir in soups, milk, sour cream, salt and pepper.", "Bake for 50 minutes."]}

text: Enchilada Casserole Brown 1 lb. ground chuck with 1 chopped onion in the microwave on High for 4 minutes, drain if needed, stir to crumble, add 1 can enchilada sauce, 1 can cream of mushroom soup, and 1 can cream of chicken soup. In a 3-quart casserole layer flour tortillas, meat mixture, and about 6 oz. grated cheese, repeat layers except cheese, microwave on Medium about 20 minutes, then top with remaining cheese and let stand until melted.
json: {"title": "Enchilada Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 lb. ground chuck", "1 onion, chopped", "1 pkg. flour tortillas", "1 can enchilada sauce", "1 can cream of mushroom soup", "1 can cream of chicken soup", "6 oz. grated cheese (approximately)"], "directions": ["Brown beef and onions in microwave on High for 4 minutes. Drain if necessary.", "Stir to crumble meat.", "Add enchilada sauce and soups.", "In a 3-quart casserole dish, layer tortillas, meat mixture and cheese.", "Repeat layers, except cheese.", "Microwave on Medium about 20 minutes or until heated through.", "Top with grated cheese and let stand until melted."]}

text: Country Casserole Heat 1 lb. Velveeta cheese with 1 c. milk and 1/2 c. Miracle Whip over low heat until smooth, add 2 c. chopped cooked turkey or chicken, 1 (10 oz.) pkg. cooked and drained peas and carrots, 5 oz. cooked and drained spaghetti, and 1 Tbsp. chopped chives or minced onions, mix well, pour into a 2-quart casserole, and bake at 350°F for 35 to 40 minutes; serves 8.
json: {"title": "Country Casserole", "ingredients": ["1 lb. Velveeta cheese, cubed (I use about 3/4 lb.)", "1 c. milk", "1/2 c. Miracle Whip", "2 c. chopped turkey or chicken, cooked", "1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen peas and carrots, cooked and drained", "5 oz. spaghetti, cooked and drained", "1 Tbsp. chopped chives or minced onions"], "directions": ["Heat Velveeta, milk and salad dressing over low heat.", "Stir until sauce is smooth. Add remaining ingredients.", "Mix well. Pour into 2-quart casserole. Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes or until hot.", "Serves 8."]}

text: Party Pizza Appetizers Combine 1 lb. cooked and crumbled hot sausage, 1 c. chopped onion, 1/2 c. grated sharp cheese, 1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese, 1 1/2 tsp. oregano, 1 tsp. garlic salt, 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce, and 1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste. Separate 3 cans flaky biscuits into thirds, spread with mixture, freeze or bake immediately at 425°F for 10 minutes; makes about 90.
json: {"title": "Party Pizza Appetizers(Makes 90)", "ingredients": ["1 lb. hot sausage, cooked, drained and crumbled", "1 c. chopped onion", "1/2 c. sharp cheese, grated", "1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese (from wedge)", "1 1/2 tsp. oregano", "1 tsp. garlic salt", "1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce", "1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste", "3 cans flaky biscuits"], "directions": ["Combine all ingredients, except biscuits.", "Separate each biscuit into 3 pizza rounds.", "Spread with mixture.", "Put pizza on cookie sheet and store in plastic bags.", "Bake frozen pizzas at 425° for 10 minutes.", "Great for a cocktail party."]}

text: Strawberry Bread Preheat oven to 350°F, combine 2 c. flour, 2 c. sugar, 1 tsp. baking soda, and 1 tsp. cinnamon, add 4 beaten eggs, 1 1/4 c. vegetable oil, and 2 pkg. (10 oz.) thawed and chopped frozen strawberries, stir well, pour into two greased and floured loaf pans, bake 1 hour, and cool 10 minutes in pans.
json: {"title": "Strawberry Bread", "ingredients": ["2 c. flour", "2 c. sugar", "1 tsp. baking soda", "1 tsp. cinnamon", "4 eggs, beaten", "1 1/4 c. vegetable oil", "2 pkg. (10 oz.) frozen strawberries, thawed and chopped"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 350°.", "Combine dry ingredients in large bowl. Form a shallow well in center of mixture and add remaining ingredients.", "Stir well.", "Spoon mixture into two greased and floured loaf pans.", "Bake 1 hour.", "Cool 10 minutes in pans."]}

text: Red Lobster Cheese Garlic Biscuits Preheat oven to 450°F, mix 2 c. Bisquick, 2/3 c. milk, and 1/2 c. shredded cheddar cheese until soft dough forms, beat vigorously 30 seconds, drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet, bake 8 to 10 minutes until golden, mix 1/2 c. melted butter with 1/4 tsp. garlic powder, brush over hot biscuits, and serve warm.
json: {"title": "Red Lobster Cheese Garlic Biscuits", "ingredients": ["2 cups Bisquick", "2/3 cup milk", "1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese", "1/2 cup butter, melted", "1/4 tsp. garlic powder"], "directions": ["Preheat oven to 450 degrees.", "Mix Bisquick, milk and cheese until soft dough forms.", "Beat vigorously for 30 seconds.", "Drop dough by spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet.", "Bake 8 to 10 minutes until golden brown. Mix butter and garlic powder.", "Brush over warm biscuits before removing from the baking sheet.", "Serve warm."]}

text: Date Rolled Cookies Mix flour and soda, roll half the dough on a floured board to 1/2-inch thickness, spread filling over top, sprinkle with chopped nuts if desired, roll like a jelly roll and refrigerate until firm, slice and bake 10 to 12 minutes at 350°F or 10 minutes at 375°F, optionally topping with sugar and a walnut half.
json: {"title": "Date Rolled Cookies", "ingredients": ["1 c. butter", "1 c. white sugar", "1 c. brown sugar", "1 tsp. salt", "3 beaten eggs", "1 Tbsp. vanilla", "4 c. flour", "1 1/2 tsp. soda", "1 Tbsp. cold water"], "directions": ["Mix the flour and soda together.", "Roll 1/2 dough on floured board into a rectangle, 1/2-inch thick.", "Spread filling all over top (then sprinkle with chopped English walnuts, if desired). Roll like a jelly roll and place in refrigerator.", "When firm, slice and bake 10 to 12 minutes at 350° or 10 minutes at 375° (top of cookie may be sprinkled with sugar and top with 1/2 walnut before baking)."]}

text: Pineapple Mold Spray a 1 1/2-quart ring mold, dissolve 1 small pkg. lemon Jello and 1 pkg. lime Jello in 2 c. boiling water, cool slightly, stir in 10 oz. cottage cheese, 1 can crushed pineapple, 2/3 c. walnuts, 1 c. cream, 1 c. mayonnaise, and 1 to 3 Tbsp. horseradish to taste, then chill until set.
json: {"title": "Pineapple Mold", "ingredients": ["1 small (3 oz.) pkg. lemon jello", "1 (3 oz.) pkg. lime jello", "2 c. boiling water", "10 oz. (1 1/4 c.) cottage cheese", "1 (No. 2 ) can crushed pineapple", "2/3 c. walnuts", "1 c. cream", "1 c. mayonnaise (not salad dressing)", "1 to 3 Tbsp. horseradish to taste"], "directions": ["Use a nonstick spray to wet a 1 1/2-quart ring mold (takes an afternoon to jell).", "Combine jello(s) and boiling water.", "Stir to dissolve.", "Let cool slightly.", "Stir in cottage cheese, crushed pineapple, walnuts."]}

text: Layered Salad Layer 1/2 head shredded lettuce, 1 box frozen peas, 4 chopped hard-boiled eggs, 1/2 lb. cooked and crumbled bacon, 1 can sliced water chestnuts, and another 1/2 head shredded lettuce in a 9 x 13-inch pan. Mix 1 pkg. Ranch dressing, 1 c. mayonnaise, and 1 c. sour cream, spread on top, sprinkle with shredded Cheddar cheese, cover, and refrigerate, preferably overnight.
json: {"title": "Layered Salad", "ingredients": ["1/2 head shredded lettuce", "1 box frozen peas", "4 hard-boiled eggs, cut up", "1/2 lb. bacon, cooked and crumbled", "1 can sliced water chestnuts", "1/2 head shredded lettuce", "1 pkg. Ranch dressing", "1 c. mayonnaise", "1 c. sour cream", "shredded Cheddar cheese"], "directions": ["Layer first 6 ingredients as listed in 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Mix dressing, mayonnaise and sour cream and spread on top of salad. Sprinkle with shredded cheese.", "Cover and refrigerate.", "Can be made the night before."]}

text: Sour Cream Potatoes Mix 2 lb. thawed frozen hash browns, 1 pt. sour cream, 2 c. or 10 oz. grated Cheddar cheese, 2 cans cream of chicken soup, 1/2 c. melted butter, 1 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. pepper, and 1/2 c. chopped onion, pour into a 13 x 9-inch pan, top with 1/4 c. melted butter mixed with 2 c. crushed cornflakes, and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
json: {"title": "Sour Cream Potatoes", "ingredients": ["2 lb. bag frozen hash browns, thawed", "1 pt. sour cream", "2 c. or 10 oz. grated Cheddar cheese", "2 cans cream of chicken soup", "1/2 c. melted butter", "1 tsp. salt", "1/4 tsp. pepper", "1/2 c. chopped onion"], "directions": ["Mix everything together and pour into a 13 x 9-inch pan.", "Top with 1/4 cup melted butter and 2 cups crushed cornflakes, mixed together.", "Bake at 350° for 45 minutes."]}

text: Creamy Banana Pudding In a large bowl combine 1 (14 oz.) can condensed milk and 1 1/2 c. cold water, add 1 pkg. instant vanilla pudding and beat until blended, fold in 2 c. whipped whipping cream, layer with 36 vanilla wafers and 3 sliced bananas in a 2 1/2-quart bowl, repeat layers ending with pudding, and chill thoroughly.
json: {"title": "Creamy Banana Pudding", "ingredients": ["1 (14 oz.) can Eagle Brand condensed milk", "1 1/2 c. cold water", "1 (3 1/2 oz.) pkg. instant vanilla pudding and pie filling mix", "2 c. whipping cream, whipped", "36 vanilla wafers", "3 medium bananas"], "directions": ["In large bowl, combine milk and water.", "Add pudding mix.", "Beat well until blended.", "Fold in whipping cream.", "Spoon 1 cup pudding mixture into 2 1/2-quart round glass bowl.", "Top with 1/3 each of the vanilla wafers, bananas and pudding.", "Repeat layers twice, ending with pudding mixture.", "Chill thoroughly.", "Garnish, if desired."]}

text: Hush Puppies Combine 1 1/2 c. corn meal, 1/2 c. flour, and 1/2 tsp. baking soda, stir in 3/4 c. buttermilk and beat smooth, add 2 tsp. salt and 1 finely chopped onion, drop heaping tablespoonfuls into hot oil, fry until golden, and drain on paper towels.
json: {"title": "Hush Puppies", "ingredients": ["1 1/2 c. corn meal", "1/2 c. flour", "1/2 tsp. baking soda", "3/4 c. buttermilk", "2 tsp. salt", "1 large finely cut onion"], "directions": ["Combine corn meal, flour and baking soda in a mixing bowl. Stir in buttermilk and beat until batter is smooth.", "Stir in salt and onion.", "Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of batter into a deep fryer; fry until golden brown.", "Drain on paper toweling before serving."]}

text: Ground Beef Casserole Brown 3 lb. ground beef, cook 1 small onion, 1 clove garlic, 1 c. bell pepper, and 1/2 c. celery in fat, add to beef and cook 20 minutes, stir in tomato paste, tomato sauce, mushrooms, creamed corn, olives, and cooked egg noodles, layer with grated sharp cheese, and bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes.
json: {"title": "Ground Beef Casserole", "ingredients": ["3 lb. ground beef", "1 small onion", "1 clove garlic", "1 c. bell pepper", "1/2 c. celery", "1 small tomato paste", "1 small tomato sauce", "1 small can mushrooms (stems and pieces)", "1 small can creamed corn", "1 small jar sliced olives", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. egg noodles", "1 stick sharp cheese"], "directions": ["Brown beef.", "Cook pepper, celery and onion in a small amount of fat, then add to ground beef and cook about 20 minutes.", "Cook noodles according to package directions.", "Combine noodles with meat mixture.", "Layer meat and noodle mixture with grated cheese and bake about 30 minutes at 350°."]}

text: Lemon Fluff Jello Bring pineapple and 1/2 c. sugar to a boil and simmer 15 minutes, cool, dissolve 1 pkg. lemon Jell-O in 1 c. boiling water, mix in softened 8 oz. cream cheese, add pineapple and optional 1/2 c. chopped pecans, chill until thick, fold in 8 oz. Cool Whip, and chill until firm.
json: {"title": "Lemon Fluff Jello", "ingredients": ["1 (3 oz.) pkg. lemon Jell-O", "1 c. boiling water", "large can crushed pineapple with juice", "8 oz. cream cheese", "1/2 c. sugar", "8 oz. Cool Whip", "1/2 c. chopped pecans (optional)"], "directions": ["Mix pineapple and sugar in saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer on stove 15 minutes.", "Remove from heat and cool.", "Mix Jell-O and boiling water.", "Stir in softened cream cheese and mix well, then add pineapple and nuts.", "Chill until thickened, then fold in Cool Whip.", "Put in Pyrex dish and chill until firm."]}

text: Quick Fruit Salad Stir together 1 can cherry pie filling, 1 can chunk pineapple, 2 c. miniature marshmallows, 4 sliced bananas, and 1/2 c. chopped pecans, mix well, and chill; may be served the next day.
json: {"title": "Quick Fruit Salad", "ingredients": ["1 can cherry pie filling", "1 (No. 2) can chunk pineapple", "2 c. miniature marshmallows", "4 very large bananas, sliced", "1/2 c. chopped pecans"], "directions": ["Pour all ingredients into a large bowl and stir.", "Mix well. This salad may be served second day, if not used the first."]}

text: Breaded Steak Rolls Roll cube steaks with bread crumbs or bread, parsley flakes, garlic powder, onion powder, Parmesan cheese, tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, secure with wooden toothpicks, and cook as desired.
json: {"title": "Breaded Steak Rolls", "ingredients": ["cube steaks", "bread crumbs or bread", "parsley flakes", "garlic powder", "onion powder", "tomato sauce", "Parmesan cheese", "salt and pepper"], "directions": ["You will also need wooden toothpicks."]}

text: Dirt Pie In a deep bowl mix 2 pkg. instant French vanilla pudding, 8 oz. cream cheese, and 1/2 c. milk until creamy, add 3/4 c. powdered sugar, then gradually add remaining milk, layer crushed Oreos in a pan, spread pudding mixture over, top with whipped topping, refrigerate, and sprinkle with more Oreos before serving.
